materials: 1 skein each 312 Black A, 254 Pumpkin B and 316 Soft White C
RED HEART® Super Saver®, Art. E300 available in solid color 7 oz (198 g), 364 yd (333 m); multi color, heather and print 5 oz (141 g), 244 yd (223 m), flecks 5 oz (141 g), 260 yd (238 m) skeins
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 4mm [G-6], 5.5mm [US I-9], 6.5mm [US K-10½]
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Wristbands measure 5” [13 cm] long x 8” [20 cm] around. Hat circumference: 22” [56 cm]. Directions for Corset are for size small; changes for sizes medium and large are in parentheses.
gauge: Gauge: Hat: 11 sc = 4” [10 cm]; Rounds 1-5 = 3½” [9 cm] across with medium hook. Corset: 6 sts = 3” [8 cm]; 8 rows = 3” [8 cm].
instructions:
Hat Band/Tie
Row 23: With largest hook, ch 41, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, sc in front loops only of each sc across; turn—100 sc.
Row 24: Ch 41, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, sc in each sc across; turn—140 sc.
Rows 25-29: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Fasten off at end of Row 29.
Cross Bones (Make 2)
With smallest hook and C, ch 2; 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook; slip st in first sc of 4-sc group, ch 11, 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in next 9 ch. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.
Skull
Row 1: With smallest hook and C, ch 3; 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in last ch; turn—3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn—5 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] twice; turn—7 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 4 sc, skip 1 sc, sc in last sc; turn—5 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 2 sc, skip 1 sc, sc in last sc; turn—3 sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
With yarn needle and strand of C, place bones in an “X” configuration and sew to hat as shown. Layer skull over cross bones and sew to hat. With yarn needle and A, embroider skull face details as shown. Weave in ends.
CORSET
First Side
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Begin at center front with larger hook and A, ch 31; sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across changing to B in last sc; turn—30 sc. Fasten off A.
Work in back loops throughout.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 3: Repeat Row 2, changing to A; turn. Fasten off B.
Row 4 (Right Side): Work 6 Cross (see Special Stitches) across changing to B in last sc; turn. Fasten off A.
Row 5: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in each st to last 2 sts, skip next sc, sc in last st; turn—28 sc.
Row 6: Repeat Row 5 changing to A—26 sc. Fasten off B.
Row 7: Repeat Row 5 changing to B—24 sc. Fasten off A.
Row 8: Repeat Row 5—22 sc.
Row 9: Repeat Row 6—20 sc.
Row 10: Work 4 Cross across changing to B; turn. Fasten off A.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 12: Repeat Row 11 changing to A. Fasten off B.
Row 13: Repeat Row 11 changing to B. Fasten off A.
Row 14: Repeat Row 11.
Row 15: Repeat Row 12.
Row 16: Repeat Row 10.
Rows 17-35 (17-39, 17-43): Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Fasten off at end of Row 35 (39, 43).
Opposite Side
Row 1: With wrong side facing, join B to unused loops of beginning ch; ch 1, skip first ch, sc to last 2 ch, skip 1 ch, sc in last ch; turn—28 sc.
Repeat Rows 6-35 (6-39, 6-43) as for first side. Do not fasten off.
Trim
With right side facing, medium hook and B, [ch 4, skip 4 sc, slip st in next sc] 5 times; ch 1, sc in row ends evenly across top edge of corset; working in sc at side edge of corset, [ch 4, skip 4 sc, slip st in next sc] 5 times; ch 1, sc in row ends evenly across lower edge of corset. Fasten off.
Lacing
With largest hook and A, ch 200. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave lacing in ch-4 spaces of trim as you would lace a shoe. Weave in ends.
WRIST BANDS (Make 2)
First Side
Row 1 (Wrong Side): With largest hook and A, ch 16; sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across changing to B in last sc; turn—15 sc. Fasten off A.
Work in back loops throughout.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 3: Repeat Row 2 changing to A; turn. Fasten off B.
Row 4 (Right Side): Work 3 Cross across changing to B; turn. Fasten off A.
Rows 5-13: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Fasten off at end of Row 13.
Opposite Side
Row 1: With wrong side facing, join B to unused loops of beginning ch; ch 1, sc in each ch across; turn—15 sc.
Rows 2-8: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Fasten off at end of Row 8.
FINISHING
With wrong side facing, B and yarn needle, matching st for st, sew last rows of each side together. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Reflective™: 1 ball each 8671 Neon Green A, 8012 Black B, and 8429 Grey C.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 6mm [US J-10] and 5mm [US H-8]
abbreviations: A, B and C = Color A, Color B, and Color C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Finished Hood Circumference: 19 (21½)” (48.5 (54.5) cm)
gauge: 10 sts = 4” (10cm); 8 rounds = 4” (10cm) in half double crochet (hdc) using larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HOOD
Hair
With larger hook and B, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, work 8 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc. Pull gently on tail to tighten ring.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—16 sc.
Round 3: Ch 2 (does not count as a st here and throughout), [hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st] 8 times; join with slip st in first hdc—24 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 2, [hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st] 8 times; join with slip st in first hdc—32 hdc.
Round 5: Ch 2, [hdc in next 3 sts, 2 hdc in next st] 8 times; join with slip st in first hdc—40 hdc.
Round 6: Ch 2, [hdc in next 4 sts, 2 hdc in next st] 8 times; join with slip st in first hdc—48 hdc.
Size Child Only
Round 7: Ch 2, [hdc in next 7 sts, 2 hdc in next st] 6 times; join with slip st in first hdc—54 hdc.
Both Sizes
Next Round: Ch 2, working in back loops only, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc—48 (54) hdc.
Next Round: Ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc. Fasten off B.
Face
Next Round (right side): With right side facing, working in back loops only, draw up a loop of A in same st as joining, ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc.
Next 1 (2) Rounds: Ch 2, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc.
Directions are for size Toddler. Changes for size Child are in parentheses.

Form Face Opening
Note: Work now proceeds back and forth in rows to form the face opening.
Row 1: Ch 2, hdc in first 32 (36) sts; leave remaining sts unworked for face opening—32 (36) sts.
Row 2: Ch 2, turn, hdc2tog, hdc in next 28 (32) sts, hdc2tog—30 (34) sts.
Row 3: Ch 2, turn, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in next 28 (32) sts, 2 hdc in next st—32 (36) sts.
Next 3 (4) Rows: Ch 2, turn, hdc in each st across.
Complete Face Opening and Work Neck
Note: Work is now joined back into a round to complete the face opening. The neck is then worked in continuous rounds. Do not join with a slip stitch at the end of rounds.
Round 1: Ch 16 (18), do not turn, sc in first hdc of last row to join work back into rounds, hdc in next 31 (35) hdc, hdc in next 16 (18) ch—48 (54) sts.
Place a marker in the joining sc of Round 1 to indicate beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is worked.
Round 2: Hdc in each st around.
Round 3: Hdc in next 12 (15) sts, hdc2tog, hdc in next 3 sts, hdc2tog, hdc in last 29 (32) sts—46 (52) sts.
Rounds 4–6: Hdc in each st around.
Sc in next st, slip st in next st. Fasten off A.
SCREWS (make 2)
With smaller hook and C, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, work 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc. Pull gently on tail to tighten ring.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, working in back loops only, [sc in next st, sc2tog] 4 times; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc2tog, sc in next 2 sts] twice; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Rounds 5 and 6: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Trim Facing Opening
With right side facing, join A with sc anywhere in edge of face opening, sc evenly around opening, working sc2tog at each of the four corners; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Hair Trim
Hold hood with neck edge at bottom and right side facing, join B with slip st at back of hood, in any unworked front loop of last B-colored round, slip st in next 2 sts, FPdc around next st of first A-colored round, *slip st in next 3 sts of last B-colored round, FPdc around next st of first A-colored round; repeat from * around. Note: Depending on the size you are making you may need to slip st in more sts at the end of the round. Fasten off.
Fold in half to find sides. With yarn needle and long ending tails, sew one screw to each side of neck area, below and to the side of the face opening.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “SuperSaver™”: 385 Royal A and 321 Gold B.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Finished Chest: 16-19 (20-25, 26-32)”. Finished Length: 10 (14, 17)”.
gauge: 12 sts = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specified gauge.
instructions:
SKIRT
With A, ch 12 (16, 18).
Row 1 (RS): Dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in next 3 ch, hdc in next 5 (7, 8) ch, turn – 10 (14, 16) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1 (does not count as st), hdc in first st and in next 4 (6, 7) sts, dc in next 5 (7, 8) sts, change to B, turn.
Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in next 4 (6, 7) sts, hdc in next 5 (7, 8) sts, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, hdc in first st and in next 4 (6, 7) sts, dc in next 5 (7, 8) sts, change to A, turn.
Row 5: Ch 3, dc in next 4 (6, 7) sts, hdc in next 5 (7, 8) sts, turn.
Rows 6-22 (38, 54): Repeat Rows 2-5, end with Row 2. Fasten off. 
WAISTBAND
Row 1: With right side facing and working along ends of hdc rows, join B with sc in first row, sc in same row, work 2 sc in next row, sc in each row to last 2 rows, 2 sc in each of last 2 rows, turn – 26 (42, 58) sts.
Row 2: Ch 2, dc in next st (counts as dc2tog), dc in each st to last 2 sts, dc2tog – 24 (40, 56) sts. Fasten off.
TOP
Row 1: Join A with slip st in first st, dc2tog, dc in each st to last 2 sts, dc2tog, turn – 22 (38, 54) sts.
Row 2: Ch 3, dc in each st to end, turn.
Repeat Rows 1-2 for 0 (1, 3) more times – 22 (36, 48) sts.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 10 (14, 17)”. Fasten off. 
NECKBAND
Join B with slip st in last st, ch 8 (9, 9) for extension. Fasten off.
With B, ch 9 (10, 10).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 7 (8, 8) chs, sc in next 22 (36, 48) sts, sc in 8 (9, 9) chs, turn – 38 (54, 66) sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, ch 2 for button loop, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, skipping ch-2 loop, sc in each sc across, turn.
Repeat Row 3 for 0 (1, 1) time. Fasten off.
EDGING
With right side facing, join A with slip st in first st of Neckband close to Body, sc evenly space around Neckband, working 3 sc in each corner, slip st in last st close to Body. 
Fasten off.
STRAP
Row 1: With right side facing, join A with sc 6 (7, 8½)” from Bottom edge of Skirt, sc in next 2 sts, turn.
Work in sc until Strap measures 11 (12, 12)” or desired length. 
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Pompoms (Make 6)
Wrap B around cardboard 75 times. Slip from cardboard, using 12” length to tie tightly in center. Cut loops and trim ends to make 1½” pompom.
Sew button to neckband opposite button loop. Sew 3 pompoms to center back. Sew both D rings together opposite strap on left side edge.
Weave in ends.
Ankle Straps
With A, ch 4. 
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 chs – 3 sc.
Rows 2-6 (7, 8): Ch 1, sc in each st, turn. 
At end of last row, turn, do not ch, slip st in first 2 sts, ch 18 for Tie. 
Fasten off. 
Second Tie
Join A in 2nd sc at other end of strap, ch 18. Fasten off. 
Sew one pompom to center front of each Strap.
Weave in ends.
Headband
With A, ch 4. 
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 chs, turn – 3 sc.
Rows 2-18 (20, 22): Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Do not cut yarn on last row, turn, slip st in first 2 sts, ch 35 (40, 45) for Tie. 
Fasten off.
Second Tie
Join yarn in 2nd sc at opposite end of Headband, ch 35, (40, 45) for Tie. 
Fasten off.
Sew pompom to center of Headband. 
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver®: 1 (2, 2) skeins 312 Black A
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8], 6mm [US J-10]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
gauge: 3.5 sts = 1” (3 cm); 14 rows = 4” (10 cm) in sc with smallest hook. 3 sts = 1” (3 cm); 9 rows = 4” (10 cm) in sc and dc with largest hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauges.
instructions:
Cape
Row 1: With A and largest hook, ch 6, join yarn to bottom of collar (color A), sc 28 (30, 32) sts across, ch 7; turn—41 (43, 45) sts.
Row 2: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 5 chs, sc in each st across, sc in remaining 6 chs; turn—40 (42, 44) sts.
Row 3: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next st, 2 dc in next st, *[dc in next 6 sts, 2 dc in next st] twice*, dc in next 6 (8, 10) sts, 2 dc in next st, repeat between *, dc in last 2 sts; turn—46 (48, 50) sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in 1st st, sc in each st across; turn.
Row 5: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st, *[dc in next 7 sts, 2 dc in next st] twice*, dc in next 6 (8, 10) sts, 2 dc in next st, repeat between *, dc in last 3 sts; turn—52 (54, 56) sts.
Row 6: Repeat Row 4.
Row 7: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next st, 2 dc in next st, [dc in next 6 sts, 2 dc in next st] 3 times, dc in next 4 (6, 8) sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 6 sts] 3 times, 2 dc in next st, dc in last 2 sts; turn—60 (62, 64) sts.
Row 8: Repeat Row 4.
Row 9: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st, [dc in next 7 sts, 2 dc in next st] 3 times, dc in next 4 (6, 8) sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 7 sts] 3 times, 2 dc in next st, dc in last 3 sts; turn—68 (70, 72) sts.
Row 10: Repeat Row 4.
Row 11: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next st, 2 dc in next st, [dc in next 6 sts, 2 dc in next st] 4 times, dc in next 6 (8, 10) sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 6 sts] 4 times, 2 dc in next st, dc in last 2 sts; turn—78 (80, 82) sts.
Row 12: Repeat Row 4.
Row 13: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next st, [dc in next 7 sts, 2 dc in next st] 4 times, dc in next 6 (8, 10) sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 7 sts] 4 times, 2 dc in next st, dc in last 3 sts; turn—88 (90, 92) sts.
Directions are for sizes 2–3; changes for sizes 4–6 and 8–10 are in parentheses.
Finished Measurements
Chest = 23 (25, 28)” [58 (64, 71) cm].
Cape Length = 12 (14, 18)” [30 (36, 46) cm].
CAPE
Collar
Repeat pattern in contrasting color B for inside of collar.
Left Side
Row 1: With A and smallest hook, ch 13, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across; turn—12 sts
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in 1st st, sc in each st across; turn.
Rows 3-12 (3-14, 3-16): Repeat Row 2.
Row 13 (15, 17): Ch 1, sc in 1st st, sc across to last 2 sts, sc2tog; turn—11 sts.
Row 14 (16, 18): Ch 1, sc2tog, sc across; turn—10 sts.
Rows 15-23 (17-25, 18-27): Repeat Rows 13 and 14—1 st on last row.
Fasten off after last row.
Right Side
Row 1: With A and smallest hook, ch 13, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across; turn—12 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in 1st st, sc in each st across; turn.
Rows 3-12 (3-14, 3-16): Repeat Row 2.
Row 13 (15, 17): Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in remaining sts; turn—11 sts.
Row 14 (16, 18): Ch 1, sc in 1st st, sc across to last 2 sts, sc2tog; turn—10 sts.
Rows 15-23 (17-25, 18-27): Repeat Rows 15 and 16—1 st on last row. 
Fasten off after last row.
With right side facing and working through remaining loops of Row 1, sew left and right collar together.
RED HEART® Super Saver®, Art. E300 available in solid color 7 oz (198 g), 364 yd (333 m); multicolor, heather and print 5 oz (141 g), 244 yd (223 m), flecks 5 oz (141g), 260 yds (238 m) skeins
Designed by Sharon Mann
What you will need:
Red Heart® Super Saver®: 1 (2, 2) skeins 312 Black A; 1 skein 356 Amethyst B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8], 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle, tape measure
Gauge: 3.5 sts = 1” (3 cm); 14 rows = 4” (10 cm) in sc with smallest hook. 3 sts = 1” (3 cm); 9 rows = 4” (10 cm) in sc and dc with largest hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauges.
Continued...
Row 14: Repeat Row 4.
Row 15: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next 3 sts, 2 dc in next st, [dc in next 8 sts, 2 dc in next st] 4 times, dc in next 6 (8, 10) sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 8 sts] 4 times, 2 dc in next st, dc in last 4 sts; turn—98 (100, 102) sts.
Row 16: Repeat Row 4.
Row 17: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next 4 sts, 2 dc in next st, [dc in next 9 sts, 2 dc in next st] 4 times, dc in next 6 (8, 10) sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 9 sts] 4 times, 2 dc in next st, dc in last 5 sts; turn—108 (110, 112) sts.
Row 18: Repeat Row 4.
Row 19: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in each st across. Rows 20-22: Repeat Rows 4 and 19.
Row 23: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next 3 sts, 2 dc in next st, [dc in next 16 sts, 2 dc in next st] twice, dc in next 30 (32, 34) sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 16 sts] twice, 2 dc in next st, dc in last 4 sts; turn—114 (116, 118) sts.
Row 24: Repeat Row 4.
Row 25: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next 4 sts, 2 dc in next st, [dc in next 17 sts, 2 dc in next st] twice, dc in next 30 (32, 34) sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 17 sts] twice, 2 dc in next st, dc in last 5 sts; turn—120, (122, 124) sts.
Row 26: Repeat Row 4.
SIZE 2-3 ONLY
Rows 27-29: Ch 1, sc in 1st st, sc in each st across; turn. Fasten off after last row.
SIZE 6-8 ONLY
Row 27: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next 5 sts, 2dc in next st, [dc in next 18 sts, 2 dc in next st] twice, dc in next 32 sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 18 sts] twice, 2 dc in next st, dc in last 6 sts; turn—(128) sts.
Rows 28-30: Repeat Rows 4 and 19.
Row 31: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next 6 sts, 2 dc in next st, [dc in next 19 sts, 2 dc in next st] twice, dc in next 32 sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 19 sts] twice, 2 dc in next st, dc in last 7 sts; turn—(134) sts.
Rows 32-33: Repeat Row 4. Fasten off after last row.
SIZE 8-10 ONLY
Row 27: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next 5 sts, 2 dc in next st, [dc in next 18 sts, 2 dc in next st] twice, dc in next 34 sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 18 sts] twice, 2 dc in next st, dc in last 6 sts, turn—(130) sts.
Rows 28-30: Repeat Rows 4 and 19.
Row 31: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next 6 sts, 2 dc in next st, [dc in next 19 sts, 2 dc in next st] twice, dc in next 34 sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 19 sts] twice, 2 dc in next st, dc in last 7 sts; turn—(136) sts.
Rows 32-34: Repeat Rows 28-30.
Row 35: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next 7 sts, 2 dc in next st, [dc in next 20 sts, 2 dc in next st] twice, dc in next 34 sts, [2 dc in next st, dc in next 20 sts] twice, 2 dc in next st, dc in last 8 sts; turn—(142) sts.
Rows 36-37: Repeat Row 4. Fasten off after last row.
FINISHING
Neck Tie (make 2)
With A, Ch 50, Fasten off. Sew neck ties to the corner of right and left neck.
Collar
With right side facing, sew A and B collars together. Turn right side out and sew inside collar bottom seam to outside collar. The collar will stand up straight against the neck.

materials: 1 skein each of 722 Pretty ‘N Pink A and 356 Amethyst B for Hat; 1 skein each of 722 Pretty ‘N Pink A, 356 Amethyst B and 254 Pumpkin C for Shawl
RED HEART® Super Saver®: 7 oz (198 g), 364 yd (333 m); multicolor, heather and print 5 oz (141 g), 244 yd (223 m), flecks 5 oz (141 g), 260 yds (238 m) skeins
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5mm [US H-8] for Hat. 6mm [US J-10] for Shawl
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 13” (33 cm) tall and 20” (51 cm) in circumference; Shawl measures 18 (22)” (45.5 [56] cm) long.
gauge: CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given. With smaller hook in Hat pattern, 8 sc and 8 rounds sc = 2” (5 cm). With larger hook in Shawl pattern, 10 sc and 4 rows in tr = 2” (5 cm).
instructions:
Round 1 (right side): Starting at top of hat, With smaller hook and A, ch 2, 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, do not join, place marker at beginning of round, work in a spiral, moving marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Round 3: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 2 sc; repeat from * once – 8 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 3 sc; repeat from * once – 10 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each of next 10 sc.
Round 7: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 4 sc; repeat from * once – 12 sc.
Round 8: Sc in each of next 12 sc.
Round 9: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 5 sc; repeat from * once – 14 sc.
Round 10: Sc in each of next 14 sc.
Round 11: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 6 sc; repeat from * once – 16 sc.
Round 12: Sc in each of next 16 sc.
Round 13: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 7 sc; repeat from * once – 18 sc.
Round 14: Sc in each of next 18 sc.
Round 15: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 5 sc; repeat from * twice – 21 sc.
Round 16: Sc in each of next 21 sc.
Round 17: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 6 sc; repeat from * twice – 24 sc.
Round 18: Sc in each of next 24 sc.
Round 19: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 7 sc; repeat from * twice – 27 sc.
Round 20: Sc in each of next 27 sc.
Round 21: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 8 sc; repeat from * twice – 30 sc.
Round 22: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 9 sc; repeat from * twice – 33 sc.
Round 23: Sc in each of next 33 sc.
Round 24: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 10 sc; repeat from * twice – 36 sc.
Round 25: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 11 sc; repeat from * twice – 39 sc.
Round 26: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 12 sc; repeat from * twice – 42 sc.
Round 27: Sc in each of next 42 sc.
Round 28: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 13 sc; repeat from * twice – 45 sc.
Round 29: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 14 sc; repeat from * twice – 48 sc.
Round 30: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 15 sc; repeat from * twice – 51 sc.
Round 31: Sc in each of next 51 sc.
Round 32: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 16 sc; repeat from * twice – 54 sc.
Round 33: Sc in each of next 54 sc.
Round 34: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 17 sc; repeat from * twice – 57 sc.
Round 35: Sc in each of next 57 sc.
Round 36: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 18 sc; repeat from * twice – 60 sc.
Round 37: Sc in each of next 60 sc.
Round 38: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 19 sc; repeat from * twice – 63 sc.
Round 39: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 20 sc; repeat from * twice – 66 sc.
Round 40: Sc in each of next 66 sc.
Round 41: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 21 sc; repeat from * twice – 69 sc.
Round 42: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 22 sc; repeat from * twice – 72 sc.
Round 43: Sc in each of next 72 sc.
Round 44: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 23 sc; repeat from * twice – 75 sc.
Round 45: *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 24 sc; repeat from * twice – 78 sc.
Round 46: Sc in first 26 sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 25 sc; repeat from * once – 80 sc.
Round 47-48: Sc in each of next 80 sc. Fasten off A.
Round 49: With right side facing, join B with a slip st in first sc, ch 1, sc in first st and in each sc around; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 50-55: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off B.
Round 56: With right side facing, join A with a slip st in first sc, ch 1, sc in first st and in each sc around; join with a slip st in first sc. Do not fasten off.
Brim
Round 57: Ch 1, working in front loops only, *2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 7 sc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc – 90 sc.
Round 58: Ch 1, working in both loops of sts, *2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 8 sc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc – 100 sc.
Round 59: Ch 1, *2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 9 sc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc – 110 sc.
Round 60: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 61: Ch 1, *2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 10 sc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc – 120 sc.
Round 62: Ch 1, *2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 11 sc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc – 130 sc.
Round 63: Ch 1,*2 sc in first st, sc in each of next 12 sc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc – 140 sc. Fasten off A.
Round 64: With right side facing, join B with a slip st in first sc, ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off B.
Weave in ends.
Shawl directions are for size 4. Changes for size 8 are in parentheses.
NOTE: Colors are changed at the end of each row, before pulling through the last 2 loops of the last tr, drop old color and draw through new color and then ch 4 with new color.
Color Sequence: Work in the following color sequence: 1 row each of *C, B, A, B; repeat from * throughout.
With larger hook and C, ch 3; join with a slip st to first ch to form ring.
Row 1: Ch 4, (2 tr, ch 2, 3 tr) in ring, change to B while completing last tr, turn.
Row 2: Ch 4 (counts as tr here and throughout, 2 tr in space between first 2 tr, *tr in next space between sts, rep from * across to next ch-2 space, (2 tr, ch 2, 2 tr) in next ch-2 space; repeat from * across to last space, 3 tr in space between last 2 tr, change to A while completing last st, turn.
Row 3: Repeat Row 2, changing to B while completing last tr, turn.
Rows 4-18 (22): Maintaining color sequence as established, repeat Row 2 (15 [19] times), change to B at end of last row.
Edging: With B, ch 2, hdc evenly around entire Shawl working 3 hdc in each corner and in ch-2 space in center; join with a slip st in first hdc. Fasten off B. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 skeins each 319 Cherry Red A and 316 Soft White B, 1 skein 385 Royal C.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 6.5mm [US K-10.5] and 3.75mm [US F-5]
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Finished Circumference: 18” (20”, 22”), [45.5 (51, 56) cm]
gauge: With larger hook and 2 strands of yarn held together, 12 sc = 4” (10 cm), 11 rows sc = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
CROWN
With larger hook and 2 strands of A held together, ch 4, join with slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, 8 sc in ring—8 dc. Do not join; work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker at the beginning of each round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: * 2 sc in next sc, change to B, 2 sc in next sc, change to A; repeat from * 3 times—16 sc.
Round 3: * 2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc, change to B, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc, change to A; repeat from * 3 times—24 sc.
Round 4: * Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc, change to B, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc, change to A; repeat from * 3 times—32 sc.
Round 5: * Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc, change to B, sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc, change to A; repeat from * 3 times—40 sc.
Round 6: * Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc, change to B, sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc, change to A; repeat from * 3 times—48 sc.
Round 7: * Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc, change to B, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc, change to A; repeat from * 3 times—56 sc.
Round 8: * Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc, change to B, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc, change to A; repeat from * 3 times—64 sc.
Sizes Medium and Large Only
Round 9: * Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc, change to B, sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc, change to A; repeat from * 3 times—72 sc.
CROWN SIDES
Rounds 9-12 (10-13, 10-16): * Sc in next 8 (9, 9) sc, change to B, sc in next 8 (9, 9) sc, change to A; repeat from * 3 times—64 (72, 72) sc.
Round 13 (14, 17): * Sc in next 3 (4, 4) sc, sc2tog, sc in next 3 (3, 3) sc, change to B, sc in next 3 (4, 4) sc, sc2tog, sc in next 3 (3, 3) sc, change to A; repeat from * 3 times—56 (64, 64) sts.
Rounds 14-16 (15-17, 18): * Sc in next 7 (8, 8) sc, change to B, sc in next 7 (8, 8) sc, change to A; repeat from * 3 times—56 (64, 64) sc.
Size Small Only
Round 17: * Sc in next 7 sc, change to B, sc in next 7 sc, change to A, sc in next 7 sc, change to B, sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc, change to A; repeat from * once—54 sts.
Rounds 18-20: * Sc in next 7 sc, change to B, sc in next 7 sc, change to A, sc in next 7 sc, change to B, sc in next 6 sc, change to A; repeat from * once—54 sts. At end of last round, change to C, fasten off A and B.
Size Medium Only 
Round 18: * Sc in next 8 sc, change to B, sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc, change to A; repeat from * 3 times—60 sts.
Rounds 19-21: * Sc in next 8 sc, change to B, sc in next 7 sc, change to A; repeat from * 3 times—60 sc. At end of last round, change to C, fasten off A and B.
Size Large Only
Rounds 19-22: * Sc in next 8 sc, change to B, sc in next 8 sc, change to A; repeat from * 3 times—64 sc. At end of last round, change to C, fasten off A and B.
BAND
(Continue placing a marker at the beginning of each round.)
Rounds 21-27 (22-28, 23-29): With C, sc in each sc around—54 (60, 64) sc. At end of last round, fasten off C.
BRIM
(Continue placing a marker at the beginning of each round).
Round 1 (Wrong Side): With Wrong Side facing, join A with sc in last st of previous round of Band, sc in next 53 (59, 63) sc—54 (60, 64) sc.
Size Small Only
Round 2: [* Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * 4 times, sc in next 2 sc] twice—64 sc.
Size Medium Only
Round 2: * Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * 9 times—70 sc.
Size Large Only
Round 2: [* Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * 4 times, sc in next 2 sc] twice—74 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each sc around—64 (70, 74) sc.
Size Small Only
Round 4: [* Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * 4 times, sc in next 2 sc] twice—74 sc.
Size Medium Only
Round 4: * Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * 9 times—80 sc.
Size Large Only
Round 4: [* Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * 4 times, sc in next 2 sc] twice—84 sc.
Rounds 5-6: Sc in each sc around—74 (80, 84) sc. At end of last round, join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off and weave in loose ends.
STAR (Make 4)
With smaller hook and 1 strand of B, ch 4, join with slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 10 sc in ring—10 sc.
Round 2: * Ch 4, sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch, skip 1 sc **, sc in next sc; repeat from * 3 times, then repeat from * to ** once, slip st in first sc to join. Fasten off, leaving a 10” (25.5 cm) tail for sewing. Referring to photo for placement, sew Stars evenly around Hat Band.
BEARD 
With larger hook and 2 strands of B held together, ch 28.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; ch 1, turn—27 sc.
Row 2 (Wrong Side): Sc in first 2 sc, hdc in next sc, dc in next sc, * Cl, dc in next sc; repeat from * 9 more times, hdc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc—27 sts. Fasten off.
Row 3 (Wrong Side): With Wrong Side facing, skip first 7 sts, join 2 stands of B in 8th st, ch 3, * Cl, dc in next st; repeat from * 5 times (skip last 7 sts); turn—13 sts.
Row 4: Skip first st, slip st in next st, sc in next 9 sts, skip last st, slip st in top of ch-3—11 sts. Fasten off, weave in loose ends.
EAR LOOPS
With Right Side facing, using larger hook and 2 strands of B held together, referring to photo for placement, join yarn at right edge of Beard. Ch 13 (or desired length to fit over ears) and slip st to right edge of Beard. Repeat for the left edge. Weave in loose ends.

materials: RED HEART® “SuperSaver™”: 1 skein each 319 Cherry Red A and 312 Black B.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Finished Chest: 16-19 (20-25, 26-32)”. Finished Length: 10 (14, 17)”.
gauge: 12 sts = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specified gauge.
instructions:
NOTE: Sweater is worked from neck down. 
COLLAR
With B, ch 38 (50, 62).
Row 1 (RS): Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 36 (48, 60) dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in each across. Fasten off. 
BODY
Row 1: With right side facing, skip first 3 (5, 7) sts, join A in next st, ch 3, dc in next 29 (37, 45) dc, turn, leaving last 3 (5, 7) sts unworked – 30 (38, 46) dc. 
Row 2: Ch 3, dc in first st, dc in next and each st to within last st, 2 dc in last st, turn – 32 (40, 48) sts.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in each st across, turn.
Rows 4-16 (22, 28): Repeat Rows 2-3 for 7 (10, 13) times more – 46 (60, 74) sts. 
Fasten off.
EDGING
Row 1: With right side facing, join B with sc at upper Body next to Collar, work 23 (33, 48) sc along side to corner, work 3 sc in corner, work 44 (58, 72) sc along lower edge, work 3 sc in corner, work 24 (34, 39) sc along side to upper Body, ending at lower Collar. 
Row 2: Ch 1, work backwards sc in each st around. 
Fasten off.
PITCHFORK
Center: With B, ch 13 (15, 17).
(Slip st, ch 5, slip st, ch 3, slip st) in 3rd ch from hook, slip st in each ch to end. 
Fasten off.
Side Spokes: With B, ch 10 (12, 14).
Slip st in 3rd ch from hook, slip st in each ch across, ch 3, slip st in last ch. 
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Following photo, sew Pitchfork to Back. Sew button to end of collar. Button slips between sts to close.
Horned Headpiece
Band
With B, ch 16, (18, 20).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 15 (17, 29) sc.
Rows 2-5: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. Fasten off.
Ties
With B, place slip knot on hook, working in edges of rows, pull slip knot through first st, [pull yarn through next st] 4 times, yo, pull yarn through all 5 loops on hook, 
Ch 35, (40, 45). 
Slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in ch across. 
Fasten off. 
Repeat at opposite end for second Tie.
Horns (Make 2)
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 3 sc. 
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around – 6 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each sc around – 6 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times – 9 sc.
Round 5: Sc in each sc around – 9 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times – 12 sc.
Rounds 7-7 (8, 9): Sc in each sc around. On last round, slip st to first st to join.
Fasten off.
Stuff each horn with small amount of A. Sew horns to Band.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver: 1 skein of 512 Turqua A
RED HEART® Boutique™ Swerve™: 1 ball of 9931 Dazzle B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 8 mm [US L-11]
abbreviations: A, B, C, etc = Colors A, B, C, etc
( ) = work instructions in parentheses as indicated.
measurements: Finished Size: 18 (20)” (45.5 (51) cm) circumference
gauge: 10 sc = 4” (10 cm); 10 rows = 4” (10 cm) worked with A and B held together. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
WIG
With A, ch 4; join with slip st to form a ring.
Round 1 (Wrong side): Ch 1, 6 sc in ring, do not join.
Place marker in first sc to indicate beginning of round, move marker as you work— 6 sc.
Round 2: Leaving a 4” (10 cm) end of B, holding B to the back (right side of work), and working over B, work 2 sc in each sc around— 12 sc.
Round 3: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc) around— 18 sc.
Round 4: (Sc in next 2 sc, sc in next sc) around— 24 sc.
Round 5: Sc in first sc, (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc) around to last 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc— 30 sts.
Round 6: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc) around—36 sc.
Round 7: Sc in first 3 sc, (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc) around to last 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc— 42 sts.
Size Medium Only
Round 8: Sc in first 7 sc, (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 13 sc) around to last 7 sc, sc in next 7 sc—45 sts.
All Sizes
Rounds 8-13 (9-15): Sc in each sc around, at end of Round 13 (15), drop B.
Round 14 (16): With A alone, sc in each sc around, slip st in first sc to join. Fasten off.

NOTES
1. Wig is worked in continuous rounds without joining, with the wrong side facing throughout. Place stitch marker to indicate beginning of round and move as rounds are worked.
2. Wig is worked holding A and B together. Stitches are worked with A, catching B with each stitch and carrying it loosely between stitches to form loops.

Special Stitch
Sc = With B held to back of work, insert hook in next sc and under strand of B, with A, Yo and draw up a loop, Yo and draw through both loops on hook.

abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 8 sts = 2½" (6.5 cm); 8 rows = 2" (5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With A, ch 2.
Row 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 3: Repeat Row 2.
Row 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc across, turn—12 sc.
Rows 5–7: Repeat Row 2.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, *sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—18 sc.
Rows 9–11: Repeat Row 2.
Row 12: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 2 sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc; repeat from * across, turn—24 sc.
Rows 13–15: Repeat Row 2.
Row 16: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc, *sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—30 sc.
Rows 17–19: Repeat Row 2.
Row 20: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 4 sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc; repeat from * across, turn—36 sc.
Rows 21–23: Repeat Row 2.
Row 24: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc, *sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—42 sc.
Rows 25–27: Repeat Row 2.
Row 28: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 6 sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc; repeat from * across, turn—48 sc.
Rows 29–31: Repeat Row 2.
Sizes Medium, Large, and Extra-Large only:
Row 32: Ch 1, sc in first 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc, *sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—54 sc.
Rows 33–35: Repeat Row 2.
Row 36: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 8 sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in next 8 sc; repeat from * across, turn—60 sc.
Rows 37–39: Repeat Row 2.
Sizes Large and Extra-Large only:
Row 40: Ch 1, sc in first 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc, *sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—66 sc.
Rows 41–43: Ch 1, sc in each sc around.
Row 44: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 10 sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in next 10 sc; repeat from * across, turn—72 sc.
Rows 45–47: Repeat Row 2.
Sizes Small, Medium and Large only:
Row(s) 32 (40 and 41, 48 and 49): Repeat Row 2.
Size Extra-Large only:
Row 48: Ch 1, sc in first 11 sc, 2 sc in next sc, *sc in next 11 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—78 sc.
Rows 49–51: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Brim
Row 33 (42, 50, 52): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), working in back loops only, dc in first sc, 2 dc in each remaining sc across, turn—96 (120, 144, 156) dc.
Rows 34 and 35 (43 and 44, 51 and 52, 53 and 54): Ch 3, dc in each dc across, turn. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Ear (make 2)
Front
With B, ch 6 (6, 7, 7).
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining sc, turn—5 (5, 6, 6) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. 
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, sc2tog, turn—3 (3, 4, 4) sc. 
Rows 4 and 5 (4 and 5, 4–6, 4–6): Repeat Row 2.
Sizes Small and Medium:
Row 6: Ch 1, sc3tog, turn—1 sc.
Sizes Large and Extra-Large only: 
Row 7: Ch 1, [sc2tog] twice, turn—2 sc. 
Row 8: Ch 1, sc2tog, turn—1 sc. 
All sizes:
Round 7 (7, 9, 9): Ch 1, 3 sc in sc; *work 5 (5, 7, 7) sc evenly sp across ends of rows*; working in opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch, sc in each ch across to last ch, 3 sc in last ch; repeat from * to *; join with slip st in first sc—13 (13, 18, 18) sc and three 3-sc groups. 
Fasten off.
Row 8 (8, 10, 10): With right side of bottom edge facing, join A with sc in center st of last 3-sc group, *sc in each sc across side edge to next 3-sc group*, sc in first st of next 3-sc group, 3 sc in center st of same group; repeat from * to *, sc in first 2 sts of next 3-sc group; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—16 (16, 20, 20) sc and one 3-sc group. 
Row 9 (9, 11, 11): Ch 1, sc in each st across to center st of 3-sc group, 3 sc in center st, sc in each remaining st. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Back
With A, repeat front. 
Nose 
With B, ch 2. 
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Eye (make 2)
With C, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Sizes Small and Medium only:
Round 2: Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, *sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—9 sc.
Round 3: *(2 hdc, ch 1, 2 hdc) in next sc*, sc in next 4 sc; repeat from * to * once; join with slip st in first hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Satin Stitch
Sizes Large and Extra-Large only: 
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: *(Hdc, dc, ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, dc, hdc) in next sc, sc in next 5 sc; repeat from * once; join with slip st in first hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Refer to photograph as guide for placement of pieces.
With end tail, seam back of hat in ends of rows.
Ears With wrong sides held together, sew front and back together around outer edges. Sew bottom edge in place securely through all layers. Sew 2-3 sts at midpoint back of ear to hat to prevent ear from falling forward.
Eyes With A, embroider satin stitch pupil in center of each eye. Pin eyes to hat and sew in place. With A, embroider chain stitches around each eye to enhance. Nose Center nose under eyes and sew in place. With D, embroider whiskers with long stitches on each side of nose.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 376 Burgundy A and 316 Soft White B.
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Hat measures 22” around.
gauge: 12 sts = 4”; 14 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With A ch 66; join with a slip st to first ch taking care that ch is not twisted.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around; do not join but work in continuous rounds – 66 sc. Place marker in last st and move up each round.
Rounds 2-10: Sc in each sc around.
Round 11: [Sc in next 9 sc, sc2tog] 6 times – 60 sc.
Rounds 12-16: Sc in each sc around.
Round 17: [Sc in next 8 sc, sc2tog] 6 times – 54 sc.
Rounds 18-22: Sc in each sc around.
Round 23: [Sc in next 7 sc, sc2tog] 6 times – 48 sc.
Rounds 24-28: Sc in each sc around.
Round 29: [Sc in next 6 sc, sc2tog] 6 times – 42 sc.
Rounds 30-34: Sc in each sc around.
Round 35: [Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog] 6 times – 36 sc.
Rounds 36-40: Sc in each sc around.
Round 41: [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 6 times – 30 sc.
Rounds 42-46: Sc in each sc around.
Round 47: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 6 times – 24 sc.
Rounds 48-52: Sc in each sc around.
Round 53: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 times – 18 sc. 
Rounds 54-56: Sc in each sc around; slip st in next sc. 
Fasten off.
Brim
Round 1: With wrong side facing, join B in any ch of beginning ch; ch 1, sc in each ch around; do not join but work in continuous rounds as before – 66 sc.
Use your crochet skills for a bit of holiday fun. Wearing this Santa hat and beard will make anyone feel like a jolly ol’ elf!
foundation row and in one loop only of the ch-15, [shell, skip 1 st] 16 times, shell in last st – 17 shells. Fasten off.
Row 15: Join yarn to work across the unused loops on the ch-15 only; [shell, skip 1 st] 7 times, shell in last st. Fasten off.
FiniSHinG
Try the hat on and pin beard to brim to get comfortable fit.  
With B and yarn needle, whipstitch beard in place to Row 1 of hat brim.
RED HEART® Super Saver®, Art. E300 available in solid color 7 oz (198 g), 364 yd (333 m); multicolor, heather and print 5 oz (141 g), 244 yd (223 m), flecks 5 oz (141g), 260 yds (238 m) skeins.
note: After Round one the brim will flip “up” and you’ll be working on the right side.
Rounds 2-9: Sc in back loop of each sc around. At end of Round 9, slip st in back loop of next sc; do NOT fasten off.
Round 10: Work Reverse Sc in each sc to marker. Remove marker.
note: Rounds 11-18 are worked in a spiral in the unused loops of Rounds 9-2 in descending order.
Rounds 11-18: Work Reverse Sc in each free loop (the remaining front loop) around. Fasten off.
Ball
Round 1: With B, make an adjustable ring, 6 sc in ring; do not join, place marker and move up each round – 6 sc.
Round 2: [2 sc in back loop of next sc] 6 times – 12 sc.
Round 3: Sc in back loop of each sc around.
Round 4: [Sc2tog in back loops] 6 times – 6 sc. Fasten off leaving long tail. Weave yarn through remaining sc, draw up firmly, and fasten securely.
Rounds 5-8: Join B with Reverse sc in last st of Round 4, working in a spiral toward the first st of Round 1, Reverse sc in each st or free loop around. Fasten off leaving long tail. Fold hat point in half to make it narrower; sew ball onto hat tip.
BEARD AnD MUSTACHE
Starting at Beard with B, ch 33.
Row 1 (Right Side): Working in ridge behind ch only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, 2 sc in next ch, [sc in next 8 ch, 2 sc in next ch] 3 times, sc in last 2 ch; turn – 36 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in first 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in last 3 sc; turn – 40 sc.
Rows 3 and 5: Ch 1, sc in back loop of each sc across; turn.
Rows 4 and 6: Ch 1, sc in front loop of each sc across; turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, working in front loops only, * shell in next sc; repeat from * across; turn – 40 shells.
Now work in free loops of descending rows.
Row 8: Ch 1, working in the free loops of Row 6, shell in each free loop across; turn – 40 shells.
Row 9: Ch 1, working in the free loops of Row 5, [shell in next free loop, skip 1 loop] 19 times, shell in next free loop, sc in last free loop; turn – 20 shells.
Row 10: Repeat Row 9 except work in free loops of Row 4.
Row 11: Repeat Row 9 except work in free loops of Row 3.
Row 12: Repeat Row 9 except work in free loops of Row 2.
Mustache Row 13 (Wrong Side): Ch 1, working in the back loops only of the underside of the foundation ch, [shell, skip next ch] 5 times, ch 15, skip next 13 ch, [shell, skip next ch] 4 times, shell in last ch; turn.
Row 14: Ch 1, working in remaining loops of the same.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Sparkle™: 1 ball each 8931 Pink Grapefruit A, 8930 Watermelon B, 8001 Marshmallow C, and 8570 Grape D
RED HEART® Scrubby Smoothie™: 1 ball each 9235 Lemony E, 9311 White F, and 9373 Brite Pink G
Yarn needle, button, headband, craft glue, small artificial flowers
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
TAIL Belt
With F, ch 76.
Rows 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across – 75 sc.
Rows 2-6: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 35 sts, ch 5, skip 5 sc for tassel hole, sc in next 35 sts. 
Row 8: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc and ch across – 75 sts.
Fasten off.
Sew button to one end of belt, pushing button between sts to secure closed.

Tassels (Make 2)
With A, B, D, E and G, cut 50 strands total, each 28" [71 cm] long. Split into 2 groups of 25 lengths. Cut three 6" [15 cm] lengths of G. Wrap one short length of G around center of one group and knot to secure. Fold in half at tied edge. Repeat to make a second tassel. Position both tassels together. Wrap third length of G around both tassels, 1" [2.5 cm] from ties and knot to secure. Use yarn needle to tuck ends in center of tassel. Push tied ends of tassels through skipped sts in center of belt. 

HORN
Holding one strand of C and F together, ch 13.
Rows 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across – 12 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, skip first sc, sc in next 11 sc – 11 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, skip first sc, sc in next 10 sc – 10 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, skip first sc, sc in next 9 sc – 9 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Row 9: Ch 1, turn, skip first sc, sc in next 8 sc – 8 sc.
Row 10: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Row 11: Ch 1, turn, skip first sc, sc in next 7 sc – 7 sc.
Row 12: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Row 13: Ch 1, turn, skip first sc, sc in next 6 sc – 6 sc.
Row 14: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Row 15: Ch 1, turn, skip first sc, sc in next 5 sc – 5 sc.
Row 16: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Row 17: Ch 1, turn, skip first sc, sc in next 4 sc – 4 sc.
Row 18: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Row 19: Ch 1, turn, skip first sc, sc in next 3 sc – 3 sc.
Row 20: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Row 21: Ch 1, turn, skip first sc, sc in next 2 sc – 2 sc.
Row 22: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. 
Row 33: Ch 1, turn, skip first sc, sc in next sc. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail to sew up horn.
Roll up Horn triangle and sew closed. Sew onto headband.

EARS (make 2)
With F, ch 10.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook, dc in next 2 ch, hdc in next 2 ch, sc in next ch, 3 sc in last ch, turn to work along opposite edge of foundation ch, sc in next ch, hdc in next 2 ch, dc in next 3 ch, dc in first ch of beginning ch-3 – 16 sts. 
Row 2: Ch 3, turn, dc in next 4 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, sc in next st, 3 sc in next st, sc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts, dc in next 4 sts, dc in top of beginning ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Sew onto headband.
Attach flowers with craft glue or sew in place.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 312 Black A, 400 Grey Heather B and 356 Amethyst C.
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures 20” in circumference; 14” tall.
gauge: 5 sc = 1½”; 5 rounds sc = 1½”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Starting at top of hat with A, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook do not join. Work in a 
spiral, marking beginning of each round, moving marker up 
as work progresses – 6 sc.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Round 3: *Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * 
around – 8 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * 
around – 10 sc.
Round 5: *Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * 
around – 12 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: *Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * 
around – 15 sc.
Rounds 8-9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: *Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * 
around – 18 sc.
Rounds 11-12: sc in each sc around.
Round 13: *Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * 
around – 21 sc.
Rounds 14-15: Sc in each sc around.
Round 16: *Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * 
around – 24 sc.
Rounds 17-18: Sc in each sc around.
Round 19: *Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * 
around – 30 sc.
Round 20: Sc in each sc around.
Round 21: *Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * 
around – 36 sc.
Round 22: Sc in each sc around.
Round 23: *Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * 
around – 42 sc.
Round 24: Sc in each sc around.
Round 25: *Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * 
around – 48 sc.
Round 26: Sc in each sc around – 48 sc.
Round 27: *Sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * 
around – 54 sc.
Round 28: Sc in each sc around.
Round 29: *Sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * 
around – 60 sc.
Round 30: Sc in each sc around.
Round 31: *Sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * 
around – 66 sc.
Rounds 32-39: Sc in each sc around. Complete last sc 
with C, drop A to wrong side.
Rounds 40-43: With C, sc in each sc around. Complete 
last sc with A. Fasten off C.
Round 44: With A, sc in each sc around.
Round 45: Working this round in flps only, slip st in first sc, 
ch 3, dc in same st as joining, 2 dc in each sc around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch 3.
Round 46: Ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in each dc around. 
Fasten off.
Braids (Make 2) 
Wrap grey around an 8” cardboard 65 times.  Cut one end.  
Tie center of strands tightly together.  Braid to desired 
length.  Tie at the bottom of braid.  Trim. Sew each side of 
hat just under brim.

materials: RED HEART® Heart & Sole®: 2 balls 3115 Ivory
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Ascot measures 7” [18 cm] wide and 44” [112 cm] long.
gauge: 2 pattern repeats = 3½” [9 cm]; 8 rows = 4” [10 cm] in trefoil lattice pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 45.
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 5th ch from hook (counts as dc, ch 1), * ch 3, skip 4 ch, ([sc, ch 4] 3 times, sc) all in next ch, ch 3, skip 4 ch, (dc, ch 1, dc) all in next ch; repeat from * across; turn – twelve ch-4 spaces and 10 dc.
Row 2: Ch 5 (counts as dc, ch 2), (sc, ch 4, sc) all in first ch-1 space, * ch 3, skip next ch-4 space, (dc, ch 1, dc) all in next ch-4 space, ch 3 **, ([sc, ch 4] 3 times, sc) all in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last ch-1 space, end at **; (sc, ch 4, sc) all in ch-1 space, ch 2, dc in 3rd ch of ch-4; turn – eleven ch-4 spaces and 10 dc.
Row 3: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1), dc in first ch-2 space, * ch 3, ([sc, ch 4] 3 times, sc) all in next ch-1 space, ch 3, skip next ch-4 space **, (dc, ch 1, dc) all in next ch-4 space; repeat from * to last space, end at **; dc in next ch-2 space, ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of ch-5; turn – twelve ch-4 spaces and 10 dc.
Rows 4-88: Repeat Rows 2 and 3, ending with Row 2.
Row 89: Ch 1, sc in first dc, * ch 4, sc in next ch-1 space, ch 4, skip next ch-4 space **, sc in next ch-4 space; repeat from * to last space, end at **; sc in 3rd ch of ch-4 – eight ch-4 spaces. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver®: 3 (4) skeins 356 Amethyst A
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8], 6mm [US J-10]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: 3.5 sts=1” (3 cm); 14 rows = 4” (10 cm) in sc with smallest hook. 3 sts = 1” (3 cm); 9 rows = 4” (10 cm) in sc and dc with largest hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauges.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2012 Coats & Clark
Vampire Cape
The Count will be ever so charming when he 
wears the Vampire Cape you made just for 
him. A stand-up collar will frame his face in 
this easy-to-crochet project.
Cape
Row 1: With A and largest hook, ch 8 (10), 
join yarn to bottom of collar (A), sc 44 (46) sts 
across, ch 9 (11); turn—61 (67) sts
Row 2: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 7 
(9) chs, sc in each st across, sc in remaining 8
(10) chs; turn—60 (66) sts.
Row 3: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next st, *2 dc
in next st, dc in next 5 sts, repeat from * 8 (9)
more times, 2 dc in next st, dc in last 3 sts;
turn—70 (77) sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in 1st st, sc in each st across;
turn.
Row 5: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next 2 sts, *2
dc in next st, dc in next 6 sts, repeat from * 8
(9) more times, 2 dc in next st, dc in last 3 sts;
turn—80 (89) sts.
Row 6: Repeat Row 4.
Row 7: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next 3 sts, *2
dc in next st, dc in next 7 sts, repeat from * 8
(9) more times, 2 dc in next st, dc in last 3 (4)
sts; turn—90 (100) sts.
Row 8: Repeat Row 4.
Row 9: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next 4 sts, *2
dc in next st, dc in next 8 sts, repeat from * 8
(9) more times, 2 dc in next st, dc in last 3 (4)
sts; turn—100 (111) sts.
Row 10: Repeat Row 4.
Row 11: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next st, *2 dc
in next st, dc in next 7 (8) sts, repeat from * 4
more times, 2 dc in next st, dc in next 14 (15)
sts, *2 dc in next st, dc in next 7 (8) sts, repeat
from * 4 more times, 2 dc in next st, dc in last
2 sts; turn—112 (123) sts.
Row 12: Repeat Row 4.
Row 13: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next 2 sts, *2
dc in next st, dc in next 8 (9) sts, repeat from
* 4 more times, 2 dc in next st, dc in next 14
(15) sts, *2 dc in next st, dc in next 8 (9) sts,
repeat from * 4 more times, 2 dc in next st, dc
in last 3 sts; turn—124 (135) sts.
Row 14: Repeat Row 4.
Directions are for size S/M; changes for size 
L/XL are in parentheses.
Finished Measurements
Chest = 34-38 (40-48)” [86-97(102-122) cm].
Cape Length = 24 (26)” [61 (66) cm].
CAPE
Collar
Left Side
Repeat color pattern in contrasting color B for 
inside of collar
Row 1: With A and smallest hook, ch 19, Sc 
in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across; 
turn—18 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in 1st st, sc in each st across; 
turn.
Rows 3-21 (3-23): Repeat Row 2.
Row 22 (24): Ch 1, sc in 1st st, sc across to 
last 2 sts, sc2tog; turn—17 sts.
Row 23 (25): Ch 1, sc2tog, sc across; turn—
16 sts.
Rows 24-38 (26-40): Repeat Rows 22 and 
23—1 st on last row. 
Fasten off after last row.
Right Side
Row 1: With A, ch 19, sc in 2nd ch from hook, 
sc in each ch across; turn—18 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in 1st st, sc in each st across; 
turn.
Rows 3-21 (3-23): Repeat Row 2.
Row 22 (24): Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in remaining sts; 
turn—17 sts.
Row 23 (25): Ch 1, sc in 1st st, sc across to 
last 2 sts, sc2tog; turn—16 sts.
Rows 24-38 (26-40): Repeat Rows 22 and 
23—1 st on last row. 
Fasten off after last row.
With right side facing and working through 
remaining loops of Row 1, sew left and right 
collar together.
RED HEART® Super 
Saver®, Art. E300 
available in solid color 
7 oz (198 g), 364 yd (333 m); 
multicolor, heather and print 5 oz 
(141 g), 244 yd (223 m), flecks 5 oz 
(141 g), 260 yds (238 m) skeins
Designed by Sharon Mann
What you will need:
Red Heart® Super Saver®: 3 (4) 
skeins 356 Amethyst A; 1 skein 
312 Black B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 
5mm [US H-8], 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle, tape measure
Gauge: 3.5 sts=1” (3 cm); 14 
rows = 4” (10 cm) in sc with 
smallest hook. 3 sts = 1” (3 cm); 
9 rows = 4” (10 cm) in sc and dc 
with largest hook. CHECK YOUR 
GAUGE. Use any size hook to 
obtain the gauges.
Continued...
Row 15: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next 3 sts, 
*2 dc in next st, dc in next 9 (10) sts, repeat
from * 4 more times, 2 dc in next st, dc in next
14 (15) sts, *2 dc in next st, dc in next 9 sts,
repeat from * 4 more times, 2 dc in next st, dc
in last 4 sts; turn—136 (147) sts.
Row 16: Repeat Row 4.
Row 17: Ch 1, dc in 1st st, dc in each st
across; turn.
Row 18: Repeat Row 4.
Rows 19-26: Repeat Rows 17 and 18
Row 27: Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next 4 sts,
*2 dc in next st, dc in next 10 (11) sts, repeat
from * 4 more times, 2 dc in next st, dc in next
14 (15) sts, *2 dc in next st, dc in next 10 (11)
sts, repeat from * 4 more times, 2 dc in next
st, dc in last 5 sts; turn—148 (159) sts.
Row 28: Repeat Row 4.
Rows 29-38 (29-40): Repeat Rows 16 and 17.
Row 39 (41): Ch 2, dc in 1st st, dc in next 5
sts, *2 dc in next st, dc in next 11 (12) sts,
repeat from * 4 more times, 2 dc in next st, dc
in next 14 (15) sts, *2 dc in next st, dc in next
11 (12) sts, repeat from * 4 more times, 2 dc in
next st, dc in last 5 sts; turn—160 (171) sts.
Rows 40-51 (42-55): Repeat Rows 16 and 17.
Rows 52-55 (56-60): Ch 1, sc in 1st st, sc in
each st across; turn. Fasten off after last row.
Finishing
Neck Tie (make 2)
Ch 60, Fasten off. Sew neck ties to the corner 
of right and left neck.
Collar
With right side facing, sew A and B collars 
together. Turn right side out and sew inside 
collar bottom seam to outside collar. The collar 
will stand up straight against the neck.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Cotton Big Ball (Ombres: 12 oz/340 g; 608 yds/556 m)
Fruit Punch Ombre (33319) 1 ball or 590 yds/540 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdcbl = Half double crochet in back loop only
Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 indicated spaces. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
Scfl = Single crochet in front loop only
measurements: ONE SIZE TO FIT CHEST MEASUREMENT 12-18 mos 18-19" [45.5-48 cm] Mermaid Sack 21" [53 cm] long (excluding Tailfin)
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Mermaid Sack
Note: Mermaid Sack is worked in one piece from waist edge down.
Ch 90. Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next 2 ch. 5 dc in next ch. Skip next 2 ch.** 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * around, ending last rep at **. Join with sl st to first sc. (Center back).

2nd rnd (ridge rnd): Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 scfl in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.

3rd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Working into rem back loop of each st from 2 rnds below, work 2 dc in first sc. *Skip next 2 sts. 1 sc in next st. Skip next 2 sts.** 5 dc in next st. Rep from * around, ending last rep at **. Work 2 dc in same sp as first 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.

4th rnd (ridge rnd): Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 scfl in each of next 2 dc. *Insert hook into back loop only of next st of last ridge rnd AT SAME TIME working 1 scfl into next st.** 1 scfl in each of next 5 dc. Rep from * around, ending last rep at **. 1 scfl in each of last 2 dc. Join with sl st to first sc.

5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Working into rem back loop of each st from 2 rnds below, *Skip next 2 sts. 5 dc in next st. Skip next 2 sts.** 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around, ending last rep at **. Join with sl st to first sc.

6th rnd (ridge rnd): Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 scfl in each of next 5 dc.** Insert hook into back loop only of next st of last ridge rnd AT SAME TIME working 1 scfl into next st. Rep from * around, ending last rep at **. Join with sl st to first sc.

Rep 3rd to 6th rnds for pat until work from beg measures approx 9½" [24.5 cm], ending on a 6th rnd of pat.

Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.

Beg Shaping Tail: 1st rnd: Ch 2. Skip first st. Working into rem back loop of each st from 2 rnds below, *1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. Skip next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 75 hdc.

2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 2. *1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc.

4th rnd: Ch 2. *(1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc) 13 times. Hdc2tog over next 2 sps. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 70 sts.

5th and 6th rnds: As 2nd and 3rd rnds.

7th rnd: Ch 2. *(1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc) 12 times. Hdc2tog over next 2 sps. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 65 sts.

8th and 9th rnds: As 2nd and 3rd rnds.

10th rnd: Ch 2. *(1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc) 11 times. Hdc2tog over next 2 sps. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 60 sts.

11th and 12th rnds: As 2nd and 3rd rnds.

Cont in this manner, dec 5 sts evenly around next rnd and following 3rd rnds until 25 sts rem. Next 2 rnds: Ch 2. *1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off at end of 2nd rnd. Sew end of Tail closed.

Tailfin: Ch 27.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 26 sc.

2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.

3rd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to last 2 sts. Turn. Leave rem 2 sts unworked.

4th to 15th rows: Rep 2nd and 3rd rows 6 times more. 12 sts rem at end of 15th row.

16th row: Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.

17th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.

18th to 27th rows: Rep 16th and 17th rows 5 times more. 

28th row: Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. 26 sts. Fasten off.

Gather straight edge of Tailfin to fit end of Tail. Sew Tailfin in position.

Bra Top
Shells (make 2)
Ch 12.
1st row: (RS). Working into horizontal ‘bump’ at back of chain, sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 7 ch. Turn. 11 sts.

2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdcbl in each of first 7 sts. 1 scbl in each of next 3 sts. Sl st in last st. Turn.

3rd row: Ch 1. Sl st in first st. 1 scbl in each of next 3 sts. 1 hdcbl in each of last 7 sts. Turn.

Rep last 2 rows 3 times more, then 2nd row once. Do not fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® 'Super Saver®': 1 Skein each 886 Blue A, 316 Soft White B, 312 Black C, and 319 Cherry Red D.
Split-ring stitch marker; yarn needle; small amount of stuffing; two 12mm brown buttons for eyes.
RED HEART® 'Super Saver®': 2 Skeins 319 Cherry Red.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Hat is 18'' circumference. Hood is 32'' around front edge.
gauge: 14 sc = 4”; 14 rows = 4” for hat; 12 sc = 4”; 16 rows = 4” for cape. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: Ribbing With A, ch 11. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 10 sts. Row 2: Ch 1, working in back loops ONLY, sc in each st across; turn. Rows 3-64: Repeat Row 2. Do not turn at end of Row 64. Hat Row 1: Turn to work along row ends of Ribbing, ch 1, sc in each row end; turn – 64 sts. Row 2: Ch 2, dc in each st across; turn. Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn. Rows 4-5: Repeat Rows 2-3. Row 6: Repeat Row 2. Row 7: Ch 1, * sc in next 14 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * across; turn – 60 sts. Row 8: Repeat Row 2. Row 9: Ch 1, * sc in next 8 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * across; turn – 54 sts. Row 10: Repeat Row 2. Row 11: Ch 1, * sc in next 7 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * across; turn – 48 sts. Row 12: Ch 1, * sc in next 6 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * across; turn – 42 sts. Row 13: Ch 1, * sc in next 5 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * across; turn – 36 sts. Row 14: Ch 1, * sc in next 4 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * across; turn – 30 sts. Row 15: Ch 1, * sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * across; turn – 24 sts. Row 16: Ch 1, * sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * across; turn – 18 sts. Row 17: Ch 1, * sc in next st, sc2tog; repeat from * across; turn – 12 sts. Row 18: Ch 1, * sc2tog; repeat from * across – 6 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Ear (Make 2) With A, ch 2. Row 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; turn – 6 sts. Row 2: Ch 1, * sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * across; turn – 9 sts. Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn. Row 4: Ch 1, * sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * across; turn – 12 sts. Row 5: Repeat Row 3. Row 6: Ch 1, * sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * across; turn – 15 sts. Row 7: Repeat Row 3. Row 8: Ch 1, * sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * across; turn – 18 sts. Row 9: Repeat Row 3. Row 10: Ch 1, * sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * across; turn – 21 sts. Row 11: Repeat Row 3. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Snout Top With A, ch 2. Row 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; turn – 6 sts. Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st across; turn – 12 sts. Row 3: Ch 1, * sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * across; turn – 15 sts. Rows 4-8: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn. Row 9: Ch 1, sc in next 5 sts, [2 sc in next st] 5 times; sc in next 5 sts; turn – 20 sts. Row 10: Ch 1, sc in each st across. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Snout Bottom Work same as Snout Top through Row 2. Rows 3-8: Ch 1, sc in each st across. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Nose With C, ch 2. Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 6 sts. Round 2: 2 sc in each st around – 12 sts. Rounds 3-4: Sc in each st around. Fasten off. Eyes (Make 2) With B, work same as for Nose through Round 2. Fasten off. Tongue With D, ch 6. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, 3 sc in last ch, turn to work in opposite side of beginning ch, sc in next 4 sts; turn – 11 sts. Row 2: Ch 1, sc in next 4 sts, [2 sc in next st] 3 times; sc in next 4 sts – 14 sts. FINISHING Using tail, sew sides of Hat together. Fold ear in half and sew bottom together. Sew in place on top of Hat. Repeat for other ear. With C, embroider 10 teeth around Snout Top. Stuff Snout lightly and sew in place on Hat. Repeat for Snout Bottom. Sew tongue in place. Sew Eyes in place above Snout. Sew buttons over Eyes. Weave in ends. RED RIDING HOOD CAPE Hood is 32” around front edge. Ribbing Ch 8. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each st across; turn – 7 sts. Row 2: Ch 1, sc in BACK LOOP ONLY of each st across; turn. Rows 3-126: Repeat Row 2. CAPE Row 1: Turn to work along side of Ribbing, ch 1, sc in each row end; turn – 126 sts. Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as 1st dc), dc in next 27 sts, sc in next 70 sts, dc in last 28 sts; turn. Rows 3-7: Repeat Row 2. Short Row A-Row 8: Ch 3, dc in next 25 sts, hdc in next st, sc in next st, slip st in next st; TURN – 29 sts. Short Row B-Row 9: Skip slip st, sc in next st, hdc in next st, dc in last 26 sts; turn – 28 sts. Row 10: Ch 3, dc in next 25 sts, hdc in next st, sc in next st, sc in same st as slip st from Row 8, sc in next 69 sts, dc in last 28 sts; turn – 126 sts. Rows 11-12: Repeat Rows 8-9. Row 13: Repeat Row 10. Rows 14-19: Repeat Rows 8-13. Rows 20-21: Repeat Row 2. Rows 22-27: Repeat Rows 8-13. Rows 28-30: Repeat Row 2. Rows 31-36: Repeat Rows 8-13. Rows 37-40: Repeat Row 2. Fasten off at end of Row 40. Buttonhole Ch 7; join with a slip st into a ring. Round 1: Ch 1, 12 sc in ring; join – 12 sts. Round 2: Ch 1, hdc in same st as join, * 2 hdc in next st, ch 1, slip st in next st, ch 1, hdc in next st; repeat from * around to last 2 sts; 2 hdc in next st, ch 1, slip st in next st; join. Fasten off. FINISHING Sew back seam. Sew Buttonhole in place on one side of neck. Sew button in place on the other side. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®: 1 skein each 312 Black A
319 Cherry Red (for boy version) or 373 Petal Pink B (for girl version), and 0316 Soft White C
abbreviations: A, B, C etc. = color A, B, C etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Size: Child size 4-6. Finished measurements: Hat circumference measures 18” at base. Belt measures 4” x 54”.
gauge: Hat: 9 sc = 4”; after Round 5 = 3.5” across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge. Gauge not critical for eye patch and sash.
instructions:
HAT
Round 1: With larger hook and A, ch 2; 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 5 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around – 10 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times – 15 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times – 20 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times – 25 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times – 30 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times – 35 sc.
Round 8: [Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times – 40 sc.
Rounds 9-20: Sc in each sc around.
Round 21: [Sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times – 45 sc.
Round 22: [Sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times – 50 sc.
Round 23: [Sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times – 55 sc.
Round 24: [Sc in next 10 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times – 60 sc.
Round 25: [Sc in next 11 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times – 65 sc.
Round 26: [Sc in next 12 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times – 70 sc.
Round 27: [Sc in next 13 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times – 75 sc.
Round 28: [Sc in next 14 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times – 80 sc.
Round 29: [Sc in next 15 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times – 85 sc.
Round 30: [Sc in next 16 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times – 90 sc.
Round 31: [Sc in next 17 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times – 95 sc.
Round 32: [Sc in next 18 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times – 100 sc.
Round 33: [Sc in next 19 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times – 105 sc.
Round 34: [Sc in next 20 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times – 110 sc.
Round 35: [Sc in next 21 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times; join with slip st to first sc – 115 sc.
Joining Rounds
Rounds 36-37: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st to first sc
Fasten off A.
Round 38: Join B with slip st to last sc; ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st to first sc.
Round 39: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st to first sc.
Fasten off B.
Skull
Row 1: With smaller hook and C, ch 3; 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in last ch; turn – 3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn – 5 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 2 times; turn – 7 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn
Row 6: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 4 sc, skip 1 sc, sc in last sc; turn – 5 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 2 sc, skip 1 sc, sc in last sc; turn – 3 sc.
Fasten off, leaving 10” tail for seaming to hat.
Cross Bones (Make 2)
Row 1: With smaller hook and C, ch 2; 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook, slip st to first sc of 4 sc group; do not fasten off.
Row 2: Ch 11, 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook, slip st to first sc of 4 sc group.
Fasten off, leaving 10” tail for seaming to hat.
FINISHING
Hat
First Join: With yarn needle and strand of B, baste yarn to last st worked; skip 26 sc, sew next sc to basted st. Fasten off.
Second Join: With yarn needle and second strand of B, skip 10 sc from first join, baste yarn to next sc; skip 26 sc, sew next sc to basted st. Fasten off.
Third Join: With yarn needle and third strand of B, skip 10 sc from second join, baste yarn to next sc; skip 26 sc, sew next sc to basted st. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
Applique
With yarn needle and strand of C, place bones in an “X” configuration and seam to hat as shown. Layer skull over cross bones and seam to hat. With yarn needle and A, make skull face details as shown.
Weave in ends.
EYE PATCH
Row 1: With larger hook and A, ch 5; skip first ch, sc in next 4 chs; turn – 4 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn – 6 sc.
Rows 3-4: Ch 1, sc in each across; turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; at end of row, ch 30 (first tie made).
Fasten off.
To work second tie, join A with slip st to side of first sc of row 5; ch 30.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
BELT
Row 1: With larger hook and B, ch 11; sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 10 sc.
Rows 2-3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 4: Ch 4 (counts as first tr), skip first sc, tr in each sc across; turn – 10 tr.
Rows 5-7: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Repeat Rows 4-7 19 times.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
RED HEART® “Super Saver®” Art. E300 available in solid color 7 oz (198 g), 364 yd (333 m); multicolor, heather and print 5 oz (141 g), 244 yd (223 m), flecks 5 oz (141g), 260 yds (238 m) skeins.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®, 1 skein 319 Cherry Red
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: rows = 4” (10 cm) in sc.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2012 Coats & Clark
Little Devil 
Headband
Watch out for your little imp when he wears this 
for Halloween! A purchased headband forms 
the base for these easy-to-crochet horns.
Note
Horns are worked from lower edge to tip. 
They are then folded in half and stuffed with 
fiberfill. Lower edge is sewn onto a purchased 
headband. 
Special Stitches
sc2tog = [Draw up a loop in next st] 2 times, 
yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on 
hook.
HORN (Make 2)
Ch 13. 
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch 
to end, turn – 12 sc. 
Rows 2-6: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across, turn. 
Row 7: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc to last 2 sc, 
sc2tog, turn – 10 sc. 
Row 8: Repeat Row 2. 
Row 9: Repeat Row 7 – 8 sc. 
Row 10: Repeat Row 2. 
Rows 11-12: Repeat Row 7 – 4 sc at end of 
Row 12. 
Row 13: Ch 1, [sc2tog] twice, turn – 2 sc. 
Row 14: Ch 1, sc2tog. 
Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Fold each Horn in half and sew side seam, 
leaving bottom open. Lightly stuff with fiberfill 
and sew closed. Position lower edge of each 
Horn evenly spaced apart on headband and 
sew on securely. 
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 skeins 254 Pumpkin A, 1 skein each 312 Black B and 512 Turqua C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5mm [H-8 US] and 5.5mm [I-9 US]

Yarn needle, sewing needle, black sewing thread, straight pins, black netting measuring 18” x 8” (45.5 x 20.5 cm), 2½” (12.5 mm) buttons (for flowers), 1 package medium size beads (sample used Clubhouse Crafts Bright Bubble Bead Mix), 1 package sequins (sample used Mixed Sequins by Advantus Corp, 9 color pack), 1 package craft feathers (sample used Assorted Feathers by ZFP Company)
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat measures 7” (18 cm) diameter across top and 10” (25.5 cm) high.
gauge: 12 sts = 4” (10cm) in pattern; 12 rows = 4” (10cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: Crown and Sides: With 2 strands of A held together and larger hook, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. Round 1: Work 8 sc into ring—8 sc. Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st—16 sc. Round 3: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—24 sc. Round 4: [Sc in next 2 st, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—32 sc. Round 5: [Sc in next 3 st, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—40 sc. Round 6: Sc in each st. Round 7: [Sc in next 4 st, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—48 sc. Round 8: Sc in each st. Round 9: [Sc in next 5 st, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—56 sc. Round 10: [Sc in next 6 st, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—64 sc. Round 11: Sc in each st. Round 12: [Sc in next 7 st, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—72 sc. Rounds 13-16: Sc in each st. Round 17: [Sc in next 7 st, sc2tog] 8 times—64 sc. Rounds 18 and 19: Sc in each st. Brim: Round 33: [Sc in next 6 st, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—64 sc. Round 34: Sc in each st. Round 35: [Sc in next 7 st, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—72 sc. Round 36: Sc in each st. Round 37: [Sc in next 8 st, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—80 sc. Round 38: Sc in each st. Round 39: [Sc in next 9 st, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—88 sc. Round 40: Sc in each st. Fasten off. Hat Band: With larger hook and B, ch 9. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in ch, turn—8 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st, turn. Repeat Row 2 until hat band fits around the base of the top hat. Fasten off, leaving tail for sewing. Flowers: Large Flower: With smaller hook and C, ch 25. Row 1: Work 3 dc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. Fasten off. Small Flower: With smaller hook and A, ch 17. Row 1: Work 3 dc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. Fasten off. Loosely roll each row around in a spiral to form flower. Sew a button and bead in the center of each flower through all layers to hold its shape. Special Stitch(es): sc2tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook. Finishing: Hat band: With black thread and sewing needle, sew three rows of sequins down the center of the hat band. With ending tail threaded through yarn needle and wrong sides held together, sew the hat band seam. Slip the hat band onto the hat; sew in place. Pin flowers and feathers in desired positions and sew onto the hat band. Sew beads around the flowers. Netting: With double thickness of black thread, baste across one long edge of the netting.
