Gently gather the netting by pulling the thread until it fits across the front of hat. Sew the netting under the hat band. Brim: Roll up the sides of the brim up and pull the front and the back of the brim down for a more stylish appearance. With A, tack brim in place if desired. Weave in all ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 254 Pumpkin A, 316 Soft White B, 312 Black C, 235 Lemon D, and 512 Turqua E
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
measurements: Rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Turn your favorite dog into a Halloween monster with a bit of crochet magic! He may not scare anyone, but he will certainly earn his share of treats!
Size Small
Round 11: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 14 sc] 3 times – 48 sts.
Size Medium
Round 11: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 7 sc] 6 times – 54 sts.
All Sizes
Rounds 12-14: Sc in each st around.
Neckband
Ch 11.
Row 1: Sc in second ch from hook and each ch across, skip next sc on hat edge, slip st in next sc on hat edge, ch 1; turn – 10 sc, 1 slip st.
Row 2: Skip slip st, sc in back loop of each sc across, ch 1; turn.
Row 3: Sc in back loop of each sc across, skip next sc on hat edge, slip st in next sc on hat edge, ch 1; turn. 
Rows 4-9: Repeat Row 2-3, 3 times.
Rows 10-27 (30): Repeat Row 2, 18 (21) times. (Rows are not attached to hat – face opening made).
Row 28 (31): Sc in back loop of each sc across, skip next 18 (20) sc on hat edge, slip st in next sc on hat edge, ch 1; turn.
Rows 29-38 (32-43) Repeat Rows 2-3, 10 (12) times.
Row 39 (44) (Joining Row) Working through both thicknesses, slip st in each st across Rows 1 and 38 (43) to join.
Fasten off.
Dog Spats
With A, ch 16.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; ch 1, turn – 15 sc.
Row 2: Sc in back loop of each sc across.
Rows 3-17 (21) Repeat Row 2, 15 (19) times.
Directions are for size Small. Changes for size Medium are in parentheses.
Notes
Hat is worked in a spiral. Do not join unless otherwise indicated.
Neckband is worked in rows and joined as you go to Hat on odd rows except where indicated.
Special Techniques
Adjustable ring method Holding the yarn a few inches from the end, wrap around your finger. Do not remove wrap from finger, insert hook into the wrap and draw up a loop of working yarn. Chain one to secure the loop, and remove ring from finger. Work stitches of first round in the ring. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
Dog Hat
With A, make adjustable ring.
Round 1: 6 sc in ring; pull tight to close; place marker at beginning of round.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around – 12 sts.
Round 3: [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 6 times – 18 sts.
Round 4: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times – 24 sts.
Round 5: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times – 30 sts.
Round 6: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times – 36 sts.
Round 7: Sc in each st around.
Round 8: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sc] 6 times – 42 sts.
Round 9: Sc in each st around.
Round 10: To create Earholes, ch 1, turn, sc in next 14 sc; ch 1, turn, sc in next 14 sc; ch 1, turn, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc] twice, slip st down side of last 2 rows; slip st in next 7 sc, sc in next 14 sc; ch 1, turn, sc in next 14 sc; ch 1, turn, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc] twice, ch 8, skip next 7 sc, sc in next 16 sc, ch 8, skip next 7 sc, sc in next 16 sc.
Row 18 (22) (Joining Row) Working through both thicknesses, slip st in each st across Rows 1 and 17 (21) to join.
Round 19 (23): Rotate to work around edge of cuff, ch 1, work 20 sc evenly around edge – 20 sts.
Note: Begin working back and forth as follows to create paw covers:
Row 20 (24): Work 3 sc in next st, skip next st, slip st in next st; turn.
Row 21 (25): Work 2 sc in each of next 3 sts, skip next st, slip st in next st; turn.
Row 22 (26): [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 3 times, skip next st, slip st in next st; turn.
Row 23 (27): [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 3 times, skip next st, slip st in next st; turn.
Round 24 (28): [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 3 times, sc in next 12 sc, place marker for beginning of round.
Round 25 (29): Sc in each st around.
Fasten off.
Claws (Make 3)
With C, make adjustable ring.
Round 1: Work 4 sc in ring; pull tight to close; place marker at beginning of round – 4 sts.
Round 2: [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] twice – 6 sts.
Round 3: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] twice – 8 sts.
Round 4: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] twice – 10 sts. Fasten off. Do not fasten off last claw.
Work 1 row of slip sts across open edge of claw, folding claw shut. Continue to work slip st across other 2 claws. Fasten off.
Eye Back (Make 2)
With A, make adjustable ring.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in ring; pull tight to close; place marker at beginning of round – 6 sts.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around – 12 sts.
Round 3: [Ch 8, skip next st, slip st in next st] 6 times – 6 ch-8 sps.
Round 4: 3 sc in each skipped st of Round 3 – 18 sts.
Round 5: [Ch 8, skip next st, slip st in next st] 9 times – 9 ch-8 spaces.
Round 6: [3 sc in next skipped st, 2 sc in next skipped st, 3 sc in next skipped st] 3 times – 24 sts.
Round 7: [Ch 8, skip next st, slip st in next st] 12 times – 12 ch-8 spaces.
Round 8: [3 sc in next skipped st, 2 sc in next skipped st] 6 times – 30 sts.
Fasten off.
Eye Front (Make 2)
With A, make adjustable ring.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in ring; pull tight to close; place marker at beginning of round – 6 sts.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each around – 12 sts.
Round 3: [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 6 times – 18 sts.
Rounds 4-7: Repeat Rounds 5 - 8 of Eye Back.
Fasten off.
Eye Balls (Make 2)
With B, make adjustable ring.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in ring; pull tight to close; place marker at beginning of round – 6 sts.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each around – 12 sts.
Round 3: [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 6 times – 18 sts. Slip st in next st. Fasten off.
With C, make adjustable ring.
Round 1: 6 sc in ring; pull tight to close; slip st in next st. Fasten off.
Horn (Make 2)
With D, make adjustable ring.
Round 1: 5 sc in ring; pull tight to close; place marker at beginning of round – 5 sc.
Rounds 2-3: 2 sc in next st, sc in each remaining st around – 7 sc. 
Round 3: Repeat Round 2, changing to E in last st – 8 sc.
Rounds 4-5: Repeat Round 2, changing to D in last st or Round 5 – 10 sc.
Rounds 6-8: Repeat Round 2, changing to E in last st of Round 9 – 13 sc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Assembly: Stuff Horns with Fiberfill. Using photo as a guide, position Horns on sides of Hat and sew in place. Sew black parts of eyeballs to white parts. Sew white parts to Eye Fronts. Sew Eye Fronts to Eye Backs - 1/4 of the way around. Place left and right Eyes together on top of Horns. Complete sewing Fronts to Backs between Eyes and left to right at centers. Continue attaching Eyes to Hat around bases of Eyes. Attach Claws to Spats. Weave in all ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 311 White A, 505 Aruba Sea B, and 995 Ocean D
RED HEART® Boutique Sashay® Mini™: 1 ball 2936 Bubbles C
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
*= repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Wand measures 15” (38 cm) long. Snowflake measures 5” (12.5 cm), stretched.
gauge: 1 snowflake = 5” (12.5 cm), stretched. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SNOWFLAKE (Make 5: 1 with A and 4 with B)
With D, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 5 (counts as dc, ch 2), dc in ring, *ch 2, dc in ring; repeat from * 3 times, ch 2; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch—6 dc and 6 ch-2 spaces.
Round 2: (Slip st, beg 3-dc Cl) in first ch-2 space, *picot, 3-dc Cl in next ch-2 space; repeat from * 4 times, picot; join with slip st to ch of beg 3-dc Cl. Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Saturate snowflakes with white glue or fabric stiffener, stretch and block on sheet of aluminum foil. Allow to dry thoroughly before handling.
Wand 
Cut off the points from the star, leaving a pentagon-shaped piece. With hot glue, adhere a B-colored snowflake to each side. Securing ends with glue, wrap D around wand handle. Tie a long piece of C under wand tip and trim ends as desired.
Tiara 
Trim visor to half of its original width. Holding visor upside down, with hot glue, adhere an A-colored snowflake to the center and a B-colored snowflake on each side.
Special Stitches
Beg 3-dc Cl (beginning 3 double crochet cluster) = Ch 2, yarn over, insert hook in indicated stitch or space, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops on hook (2 loops remain on hook); yarn over, insert hook in same stitch or space, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops, yarn over, draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Picot = Ch 7, slip st in 3rd ch from hook, ch 4.
3-dc Cl (3 double crochet cluster) = Yarn over, insert hook in indicated stitch or space, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops on hook (2 loops remain on hook); [yarn over, insert hook in same stitch or space, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] 2 times, yarn over, draw through all 4 loops on hook.
Notes
1. Take care not to twist chains when making picots and the cluster stitch that follows.
2. Points of star on wand are cut off before adhering snowflakes on each side.
3. Foam visor is trimmed to narrower width and worn upside down.
4. An adult should always operate the hot glue gun.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver”: 1 skein each 319 Cherry Red A, 313 Aran B, 321 Gold C.
Yarn needle, stitch markers, sewing needle and matching thread, two 2” buttons, two 3½” buttons.
abbreviations: A, B, and C = Color A, Color B, and Color C
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Finished Hat Circumference: 22 (24)”.
gauge: 12 sts = 4”; 15 rows = 4” in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With A, ch 3; join with slip stitch in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Work 6 sc in ring—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Rounds 2 and 3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Rounds 5–7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Rounds 9–11: Sc in each sc around.
Round 12: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Rounds 13–15: Sc in each sc around.
Round 16: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Rounds 17–19: Sc in each sc around.
Round 20: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—36 sc.
Rounds 21–23: Sc in each sc around.
Round 24: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—42 sc.
Rounds 25–27: Sc in each sc around.
Round 28: [Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—48 sc.
Rounds 29–31: Sc in each sc around.
Round 32: [Sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—54 sc.
Rounds 33–35: Sc in each sc around.
Round 36: [Sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—60 sc.
Rounds 37–39: Sc in each sc around.
Round 40: [Sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—66 sc.
Size 6 years only
Rounds 41–43: Sc in each sc around.
Round 44: [Sc in next 10 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—72 sc.
All Sizes
Next Round: Slip st in next st, rev sc in each st around; join with slip st in first st. Fasten off.
BEARD AND HAIR 
With B, ch 30.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—29 sc.
Row 2: Ch 5, sc in next st (buttonloop made), [ch 6, skip next st, sc in next st] 2 times, [ch 8, skip next st, sc in next st] 10 times, ch 6, skip next st, sc in next st, ch 6, skip next st, (sc, ch 5, slip st) in last st (buttonloop made), turn—4 ch-6 spaces, 10 ch-8 spaces, and 2 ch-5 buttonloops.
Row 3: Ch 1, skip ch-5 buttonloop, (sc, 5 dc, 4 hdc) in each of next 2 ch-6 spaces, (sc, 7 dc, 4 hdc) in each of next 10 ch-8 spaces, (sc, 5 dc, 4 hdc) in each of next 2 ch-6 spaces, turn; leave buttonloop unworked.
Row 4: Ch 1, working in front of the sts of Row 3 and into the skipped sts of Row 1, sc in first skipped st, *ch 5, sc in next skipped st; repeat from * across, turn—13 ch-5 spaces.
Row 5: Ch 1, (3 sc, dc, 3 sc) in each ch-5 space across, slip st in end of piece. Fasten off.
SUSPENDERS (make 2)
Note: Suspenders are worked from side to side. The first suspender is worked, and a loop is worked across the front edge of the suspender. Then the piece is divided (in Row 6), and the second suspender is worked, and another loop is worked across the front edge of the suspender.
With C, ch 75 (79).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—74 (78) sc.
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
First Front Loop: Working in ends of rows across side of piece, slip st across side edge to corner, ch 10, turn, skip over the side edge and slip st in beginning corner (at end of Row 4), turn, 12 sc in the ch-10 space (front loop made), turn, slip st across side edge again back to beginning corner.
Row 5: Sc in first st of Row 4 and each st across, turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 20 sc, ch 55 (59), turn—20 sc and 55 (59) ch.
Row 7: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch and st across, turn—74 (78) sc.
Rows 8–10: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Second Front Loop: Ch 10, working across side edge, skip ends of first 4 rows, slip st in end of Row 6 (at corner), turn, 12 sc in the ch-10 space, slip st in corner. Fasten off.
Back Tab
Join C with sc in end of Row 1 (at corner), ch 20, sc in 5th ch from hook (buttonloop made), sc in next 15 ch, sc in same space as first sc. Fasten off. Sew button to end of Row 10, opposite buttonloop.
FINISHING
Place hat on child, and hold beard around child’s face and chin. Place markers on hat at each end of beard. Remove hat and sew one small button to inside of hat at each marked location; button beard to hat. Sew large buttons to the outside of trousers to which suspenders will be buttoned. To wear suspenders, loop the back tab through the belt loops at the back of the pair of trousers and button. Bring the front suspenders over the shoulders to the front and slip the front loops over the buttons sewn to the trousers. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Forever Fleece Finer™ (9.9 oz/280 g; 385 yds/352 m)
Main Color (MC) My Sunshine (76003) 2 balls for sizes 12/18 mos and 2 balls for sizes 2/4 yrs
Contrast A Splish Splash (76022) 1 ball for sizes 12/18 mos and 1 ball for sizes 2/4 yrs
Main Color (MC) Petal (76010) 2 balls for sizes 12/18 mos and 2 balls for sizes 2/4 yrs
Contrast A Unicorn (76027) 1 ball for sizes 12/18 mos and 1 ball for sizes 2/4 yrs
Sizes U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) and U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge
Hook and loop fastener dot for waistband
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Picot = Ch 3. Sl st in top of previous stitch.
Sc2tog = (Draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Trfp = (Treble front post) - (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times.
measurements:
Tail: To fit waist measurements:
12/18 mos 21" [53.5 cm]
2/4 yrs 23" [58.5 cm]
Finished measurements:
12/18 mos 3" x 20" [7.5 cm x 51 cm]
2/4 yrs 3"x 27" [7.5 cm x 68.5 cm]
Hat: To fit head sizes:
12/18 mos 18½" [47 cm] circumference
2/4 years 19" [48 cm] circumference
gauge: Tail: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook. Hat: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). When only one number is given, it applies to both sizes.
HAT
Note: Hat is worked from side to side.
With smaller hook and MC, ch 37 (47) loosely.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 36 (46) sc.
**2nd row: Ch 1. Sl st in first sc. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked (sc and sl st). 
Rep last 2 rows 3 times more. 
Next row: As 2nd row. 
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. Working to end of row: (1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sl st) 5 times. Turn. 36 (46) sc.** 
Rep from ** to ** once more.
Shape face opening
Upper part:
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. Sl st first sc. 1 sc in each of next 17 (22) sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
***2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked (sc and sl st). 
3rd row: Ch 1. Sl st in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rows 2 (3) times more.***
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. Working to end of row: (1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sl st) 4 (5) times. Turn. 18 (23) sc. 
Next row: Ch 1. Sl st in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep from *** to *** once more. 
Fasten off.
Lower part:
With WS facing, working across rem sts of Main Body. Skip next 4 (7) sc. Join yarn with sl st to next sc. 
1st row: (WS). Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 13 (15) sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 12 (14) sts. 
3rd row: As 1st row. 11 (13) sts. 
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row 7 (11) times more.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 12 (14) sts. 
Next row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Joining row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc of Lower Part. Ch  4 (7). Working across Upper Part: 1 sc in each sc to last sc. Working to end of row: (1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sl st) 4 (5) times. Turn. 36 (46) sc.
Rep from ** to ** as given above twice more. 
Fasten off. Sew back seam of Hat.
Spikes
With smaller hook and A, ch 35 (41).
First Spike: 1st row:  (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
**2nd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (2 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 6 sc. 
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn.  4 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 2 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.**
***Next Spike:  With RS facing, skip next 2 ch. Join A with sl st to next ch. 
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
Work from ** to ** as given for First Spike.***
Rep from *** to *** to end of chain. 6 (7) Spikes. 
Join Spikes to Hat:  Using photo as reference, align foundation ch of Spikes along center of Hat. 
With A, work sl st through both thicknesses to attach Spikes to Hat. 
Fasten off.
TAIL
Notes:
• Move markers up as you work each row.
• Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
With larger hook and MC, ch 4. 
1st row: (RS). 2 dc in 4th ch from hook. 3 dc. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as st here and throughout). 1 hdc in first dc. Skip next dc. 1 hdc in last dc. Turn. 2 hdc.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout). 1 hdc in first hdc. 2 trfp around next dc 2 rows below. PM on each of last 2 sts. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last hdc. Turn. 6 sts.
4th row: Ch 3. 1 hdc in first st. 2 hdc in next hdc. Skip marked 2 sts. 2 hdc in next hdc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last st. Turn. 8 sts. 
5th row: Ch 3. 1 hdc in first st. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 trfp around each of next 2 trfp 2 rows below. PM on each of last 2 sts. Skip next 4 hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last st. Turn. 8 sts. 
6th row: Ch 3. 1 hdc in first st. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Skip marked 2 sts. 1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last st. Turn. 10 sts.
7th row: Ch 3. 1 hdc in first st. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 1 trfp around each of next 2 trfp 2 rows below. PM on each of last 2 sts. Skip next 4 hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last dc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last st. Turn. 10 sts. 
8th row: Ch 3. 1 hdc in first st. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to marked 2 sts. PM on last st. Skip marked 2 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. 2 hdc in next hdc. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last st. Turn. 
9th row: Ch 3. 1 hdc in first st. 1 hdc in each hdc to 2 hdc before marked st. 1 trfp around each of next 2 trfp 2 rows below. PM on each of last 2 sts. Skip next 4 hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last st. (1 hdc. 1 dc) in last st. Turn. 
Rep 8th and 9th rows, noting side incs, until width measures approx 8" [20.5 cm], ending on a 8th row. 
Next row: (RS). Ch 2. 2 hdc in first st. 1 hdc in each hdc to 2 hdc before marked st. 1 trfp around each of next 2 trfp 2 rows below. PM on each of last 2 sts. Skip next 4 hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last st. 2 hdc in last st. Turn. 
Next row:  Ch 2. 2 hdc in first st. 1 hdc in each hdc to marked 2 sts. PM on last st. Skip marked 2 sts. 1 hdc in each hdc to last st. 2 hdc in last st. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rows, until work along center Trfp line measures approx 25" [63.5 cm], ending on a WS row. 
Proceed as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Sl st in first st. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in each hdc to 2 hdc before marked st. 1 trfp around each of next 2 trfp 2 rows below. PM on each of last 2 sts. Skip next 4 hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. 1 sc in next st. Turn. Leave rem st unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sl st in first st. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in each hdc to marked 2 sts. PM on last st. Skip marked 2 sts. 1 hdc in each st to last 2 sts. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. Leave rem st unworked.
Rep last 2 rows until there are no sts left to work. Fasten off.
Spikes (make 2 pieces alike)
With smaller hook and A, ch 3. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 2 sc in next ch (outer edge). 
Turn. 3 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. (inner edge). Turn. 4 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 
Turn. 5 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. 
Turn. 6 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 
Turn. 7 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. 
Turn. 8 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 
Turn. 9 sc.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. 
Turn. 10 sc.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
10th to 12th rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Turn.
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 13th rows until work measures length to fit along Trfp line of Tail, ending on a 8th row. 
Fasten off.
Join 2 Spike Pieces tog:
Note: Join along outer edges only, leave inner edge unworked. 
Align 2 pieces with RS of 1st piece and WS of 2nd piece tog. With smaller hook, join A with sl st at foundation ch. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work in sc across outer edge (shaped spikes), having (2 sc. Picot. 1 sc) in top of each Spike. Fasten off at end of last Spike. 
Sew each side of Inner edge along corresponding Trfp sts of Tail.
Belt:  With MC and larger hook, ch 16. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 15 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until Belt measures 22 (27)" [ 56 (68.5) cm]. Fasten off. 
Fold Belt in half lengthwise. Join MC with sl st at fold. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work in sc across ends and length of Belt, working 3 sc in corners. Fasten off. 
With WS facing, align top of Tail with joining sc row at center of Belt. Join MC with sl st at right side of Tail. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work in sc to attach Tail to Belt. Fasten off. 
Try on Belt. Mark position of hook and loop fastener. Sew hook and loop fastener to ends of Belt.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein of 235 Lemon A
RED HEART® Vivid™: 2 balls of 6224 Laser Yellow D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6 mm [US J-10] and 5.5 mm [US I-9]
abbreviations: A, B, C, etc = Colors A, B, C, etc
( ) = work instructions in parentheses as indicated
measurements: Finished Size: 18 (20)” (45.5 (51) cm) circumference.
gauge: Rounds 1-4 = 4” (10 cm) diameter in A with larger size hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
If she wants to be a princess, you can complete her look in royal style with this long braided wig. First a hat-like wig and flowers are crocheted. Then the lengths of “hair” are added for an irresistibly cute princess.
All Sizes
Rounds 8-10 (9-12): Ch 3, (ch 1, hdc in next space) around, join with sc to first hdc.
Round 11 (13): Ch 1 (counts as first sc, now and throughout), sc in each hdc and ch-1 space around, join with slip st to first sc— 60(64) sc.
Round 12 (14): Ch 1, (sc2tog, sc in next 4(6) sc) around to last sc, skip last sc, join with slip st to first sc— 50(56) sc.
Rounds 13 and 14 (15 and 16): Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st to first sc, fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
Small Flower (Make 2 in colors of your choice)
Leaving a 4” (10 cm), and with smaller size hook, ch 5; join with slip st to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 1, 10 sc in ring, join with slip st to first sc— 10 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same stitch, ch 3, skip next sc, *sc in next, ch 3, skip next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st to first sc—: 5 ch-3 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 1, *slip st in next ch-3 sp, (3 hdc, sc, slip st) in same ch-3 space; repeat from * around; join with slip st to first slip st; fasten off.
Large Flower (Make 4 in colors of your choice)
Leaving a 4” (10 cm), and with smaller size hook, ch 5; join with slip st to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 1, 10 sc in ring, join with slip st to first sc— 10 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same stitch, ch 3, skip next sc, *sc in next, ch 3, skip next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st to first sc— 5 ch-3 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 1, *slip st in next ch-3 sp, (sc, 3 hdc, sc, slip st) in same ch-3 space; repeat from * around; join with slip st to first slip st.
Directions are for size Small; changes for size Medium are in parentheses
WIG
With A and larger size hook, ch 4; join with slip st to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 3 (counts as hdc plus ch 1, now and throughout), hdc in ring, (ch 1, hdc in ring) 6 times, join with sc to first hdc— 8 ch-1 spaces.
Round 2: Ch 3, hdc in same space, ch 1, hdc in next space, *ch 1, hdc in next space, ch 1, hdc in same space, ch 1, hdc in next space; repeat from * around; join with sc to first hdc— 12 ch-1 spaces.
Round 3: Repeat Round 2: 18 ch-1 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 3, hdc in same space, (ch 1, hdc in next space) twice, *ch 1, hdc in next space, ch 1, hdc in same space, (ch 1, hdc in next space) twice; repeat from * around; join with sc to first hdc— 24 ch-1 spaces.
Round 5: Ch 3, (ch 1, hdc in next space) around, join with sc to first hdc.
Rounds 6 and 7: Repeat Rounds 4 and 5— 30 ch-1 spaces.
Size Medium Only
Round 8: Ch 3, hdc in same space, *(ch 1, hdc in next space) 14 times, ch 1, hdc in next space, ch 1, hdc in same space; repeat from * around, join with sc to first hdc— 32 ch-1 spaces.
Round 4: With right side facing, join next color with sc in any skipped sc on Round 1; ch 5, (sc in next skipped sc, ch 5) around, join with slip st to first sc— 5 ch-5 spaces.
Round 5: Ch 1, *slip st in next ch-5 space, (sc, hdc, 3 dc, hdc, sc, slip st) in same ch-5 space; repeat from * around; join with slip st to first slip st; fasten off.
FINISHING
Wig
Cut elastic to fit head circumference allowing an additional ½” (12.7 mm), overlapping ends ½” (12.7 mm). With sewing needle and matching thread, sew ends together forming a circle. With wrong side of Wig facing, place elastic around edge of Wig, folding Round 14 (16) over elastic. With sewing needle and matching thread, sew Round 14 (16) to Wig, securing elastic.
Hair
Cut 39, 102” (259 cm) lengths of D for hair. With crochet hook and using photo as a guide, loop 13 lengths of D around hdc posts of Wig beginning at Round 14 (16) to form hair. Repeat for Rounds 13 (15) and 12 (14) of Wig. Thread yarn needle with a length of D. Beginning at Round 1 of Wig, weave length through hdc posts in concentric circles to last 3 rounds, then weave yarn back and forth under remaining posts on final 3 rounds.
Tack third row of hair in place by taking one strand of each pair of hair and slipping it under woven base. Style remaining 2 rows of hair in desired shaping, pulling all strands back loosely to form a ponytail at back neck. Cut one 18” (45.5 cm) strand of A and one 18” (45.5 cm) strand of C for hair ties, fold each strand in half and set aside. Tie hair with doubled strand of A. Divide ponytail into 3 groups of 26 strands each and braid loosely. Tie end of braid with doubled strand of C. Trim hair ends even. Using photo as a guide and long yarn ends, tie flowers onto hair.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 334 Buff.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5 mm [US K-10 1/2].
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Finished size: 18 (20)” (45.5 (51 cm) in circumference.
gauge: With 2 strands held together as one, 12 sts and 8 rounds = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), 11 hdc in ring; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2—12 sts.
Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in first st, 2 hdc in each st around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2—24 sts.
Round 3: Ch 2, *FPdc around the post of same st, hdc in same st**, hdc in next 3 sts; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, hdc in next 2 sts; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2—30 sts.
Round 4: Ch 2, *FPdc around the post of next st, hdc in same st**, hdc in next 4 sts; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, hdc in next 3 sts; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2—36 sts.
Round 5: Ch 2, *FPdc around the post of next st, hdc in same st**, hdc in next 5 sts; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, hdc in next 4 sts; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2—42 sts.
Round 6: Ch 2, *FPdc around the post of next st, hdc in same st**, hdc in next 6 sts; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, hdc in next 5 sts; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2—48 sts.
Size L Only
Round 7: Ch 2, *FPdc around the post of same st, hdc in same st**, hdc in next 7 sts; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, hdc in next 6 sts; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2—54 sts.
All Sizes
Round 7 (8): Ch 2, *FPdc around the post of next st, skip top of same st, hdc in next 7 (8) sts, FPdc around the post of next st, hdc in same st**, hdc in next 7 (8) sts; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, hdc in next 6 (7) sts; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2—51 (57) sts.
All Sizes
Round 8 (9): Ch 2, *FPdc around the post of next st, hdc in same st, hdc in next 7 (8) sts, FPdc around the post of next st, skip top of same st**, hdc in next 8 (9) sts; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, hdc in next 8 (9) sts; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2—54 (60) sts.
Rounds 9-11 (10-12): Ch 2, *FPdc around the post of next st, skip top of same st**, hdc in next 8 (9) sts; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, hdc in next 7 (8) sts; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-2—54 (60) sts.
Brim
Round 12 (13): Ch 1, sc in front loop only of each st around; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 13 (14): Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, *sc in next 5 sts**, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in first sc—63 (70) sts.
Round 14 (15): Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 15 (16): Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, *sc in next 6 sts**, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in first sc—72 (80) sts.
Round 16 (17): Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 17 (18): Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, *sc in next 7 sts**, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in first sc—81 (90) sts.
Round 18 (19): Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 19 (20): Slip st in each st around. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 3620 Glowworm A, 312 Black B, and 3950 Charcoal C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5.5mm [I-9 US] and 5.0mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle, wrapping paper tube (sample show is 30” x 1½” (76 x 4 cm), two 1” (25 mm) buttons, fiberfill, adhesive tape, stitch marker
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Cape measures approximately 19 (19½, 20, 21)” [48.5 (49.5, 51, 53.5 cm] wide across lower edge x 11, 12, 14, 15½” [28 (30.5, 35.5, 39.5) cm] long, including tabs. Mask measures approximately 16 (18, 20, 20)” [40.5 (45.5, 51, 51) cm] circumference.
gauge: 14 sts = 4” (10cm) in pattern; 10 rows in hdc = 4” (10cm). Rounds 1-5 of saber = 1 1/2” (4cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CAPE
Note Work color sequence as follows: 7 (8, 9, 10) rows with A, 6 (6, 7, 9) rows with B, 7 (8, 9, 10) rows with A.
With larger and A, ch 56 (59, 61, 64).
Row 1: Hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch across, turn—55 (58, 60, 63) hdc.
Rows 2-4 (4, 8, 12): Ch 2, hdc in each st, turn.
Row 5 (5, 9, 13) (decrease row): Ch 2, hdc in first st, hdc2tog, hdc in each st to last 3 sts, hdc2tog, hdc in last st, turn—53, (56, 58, 61) hdc.
Size 2 only
Rows 6-19: Repeat Row 5—25 hdc.
Size 4 only
Row 6: Ch 2, hdc in each st, turn. 
Row 7: Repeat Row 5—54 hdc. 
Row 8: Ch 2, hdc in each st, turn. 
Rows 9-21: Repeat Row 5—28 hdc.
Size 6 only
Row 10: Ch 2, hdc in each st, turn. 
Rows 11-24: Repeat Row 9—30 hdc.
Size 8 only
Row 14: Ch 2, hdc in each st, turn. 
Rows 15-28: Repeat Row 13—33 hdc.
All sizes
Row 20 (22, 25, 29): Ch 2, hdc in each st; change to B, turn.
First Tab
Row 1: Ch 2, hdc in first 8 (9, 10, 11) sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—8 (9, 10, 11) hdc.
Rows 2-6 (6, 8, 8): Ch 2, hdc in each st, turn.
Fasten off B at end of Row 6 (6, 8, 8).
Directions are for size 2. Changes for sizes 4, 6, and 8 are in parentheses.
CAPE measures approximately 19 (19½, 20, 21)” [48.5 (49.5, 51, 53.5 cm] wide across lower edge x 11, 12, 14, 15½” [28 (30.5, 35.5, 39.5) cm] long, including tabs.
MASK measures approximately 16 (18, 20, 20)” [40.5 (45.5, 51, 51) cm] circumference.
Special Stitches
hdc2tog = [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop] 2 times, yarn over and draw through all 5 loops on hook.
sc2tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Notes
1. In cape, beginning ch-2 does not count as a half double crochet. Do not work last stitch into beginning ch-2.
2. Cape and cuffs are worked in rows; star is worked in joined rounds in any desired colors.
3. Cape is worked in varying bands of 2 colors; be sure to work in correct color sequence for your size.
4. Lightsaber is worked in continuous rounds (spiral) with right side facing; do not join unless instructed. 
5. Although gauge is not critical for the lightsaber, stitching around the tube is intended to be close-fitting. If your tube has a larger diameter than the sample tube, add additional increase rounds until the tube fits into the first rows of lightsaber.
6. To change color, work last stitch of old color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new color and draw through all loops on hook to complete stitch. Proceed with new color. Fasten off old color.
Continued...
Second Tab
Holding cape with first tab to your right, skip next 9 (10, 10, 11) stitches and join B with slip st in next st. 
Row 1: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining and in each remaining st, turn—8 (9, 10, 11) hdc.
Rows 2-6 (6, 8, 8): Ch 2, hdc in each st, turn. 
Do not fasten off at end of Row 6 (6, 8, 8).
Edging
Ch 36, slip st in each ch (neck tie made), sc in each st of last row of second tab; working across ends of rows, sc evenly down outer side of second tab and cape to Row 1; working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each ch; working across ends of rows, sc evenly up opposite side of cape and outer side of first tab to last row of first tab, sc in each st of last row; ch 36, slip st in each ch (neck tie made); working across ends of rows, sc evenly across inner side of first tab to last row of cape, sc in each unworked st of last row; working across ends of rows, sc evenly up inner side of second tab to last row; join with slip st in first st. Fasten off.
MASK
Eye Opening (make 2) 
With larger hook and B, ch 15; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. 
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1 (does not count as a st), work 25 hdc into ring; join with slip st to first hdc—25 hdc. Fasten off, leaving 6” (15 cm) tail on 2nd eye opening for sewing.
With wrong sides of eye openings held together and sewing through both thicknesses, whipstitch 3 sts together (the first and 3rd stitches sewn are “joined sts”).
Face
Round 1: With right side facing, join B with sc in first joined st on left eye opening (if you are right-handed; right eye opening if you are left-handed), sc in next 22 st, sc in next joined st of same eye opening, sc in first joined st of 2nd eye opening, sc in next 22 st, sc in last joined st; join with slip st in first st—48 sc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc), hdc in next 10 sts, 2 hdc in next st, place marker in first hdc made of 2 hdc, 2 hdc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 9 sts, sc in next 2 st, sc in next 9 sts, 2 sc in next st, 2 hdc in each of next 2 sts, place marker in last hdc made, hdc in last 11 sts; join with slip st to beginning ch-2; change to A. 
Note Move markers up in Round 3.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining and in each st; join with slip st to first st. Fasten off. 
Band
With right side facing, join A with sc at first marked hdc.
Row 1: Sc in next 3 hdc, turn—4 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st, turn.
Repeat last row until band measures 8 (10, 12, 12)” [20.5 (25.5, 30.5, 30.5) cm] or desired length, ending with a wrong side row. 
Do not fasten off. Being careful not to twist band, with wrong sides together, hold last row of band to opposite side of mask with first st of band at 2nd marked st; working through both thicknesses, join with slip st through 4 st of band. Fasten off.
CUFFS (make 2)
With larger hook and A, ch 7 (9, 11, 13). 
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch and each ch, turn—6 (8, 10, 12) sc. 
Rows 2-8 (8, 9, 9): Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st, turn.
Rows 9-20 (9-20, 10-22, 10-22): Ch 1, sc in each st, turn. 
Holding first and last rows with wrong sides together, slip st through back loops only of Row 1 and both loops of last row. Fasten off. 
STAR
Note If star is to be sewn to cape, leave long beginning and end tails.
With larger hook and A, ch 2. 
Round 1: Work 5 sc in first ch; join with slip st to first st—5 sc. 
Rounds 2 and 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st; join with slip st to first st—20 sc at end of Round 3. 
Note Points of star are made from rows worked within Round 4.
Round 4: *Sc in next 4 st (first row made), turn; ch 1, sc2tog twice (2nd row made), turn; ch 1, sc2tog, do not turn; ch 1, working in ends of rows, slip st in each row, slip st in base of 4th st of first row; repeat from * 4 times; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
LIGHTSABER
Top
With smaller hook and A, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in first ch—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st—12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—18 sc. 
Note At this point, rounds should be slightly larger than the end of your wrapping paper tube. If it is not, work an increase round.
Increase Round: *Sc in next 2 st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—24 sc.
If necessary, add additional increase rounds by working *sc into next 3 st, 4 st, 5 st…, 2 sc in next st; then repeating from * around.
Next Round: Sc in each st. 
Next Round: Working in back loops only, sc in each st. 
Next Round: Sc in each st.
Repeat last round until lightsaber is 5” (12.5 cm) shorter than length of tube; change to C.
Repeat last round until one round extends past end of tube; join with slip st in first st.
Fasten off.
Bottom
With smaller hook and C, ch 2.
Repeat Rounds 1-3 and any Increase Rounds necessary to match diameter of last round of top. 
Last Round: Sc in next 9 st, ch 10, sc in next 9 st; join with slip st in next st. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
With right sides together, whipstitch bottom to top through 5 sc opposite ch-10 loop. Using photograph as a guide, sew button for closure on bottom approximately 1½” (4cm) from lower edge. Sew extra button above this for decoration. 
Band 
With smaller hook and B, ch 5.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each st across, turn—4 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st.
Repeat Row 2 until band is long enough to fit around tube snugly. 
With wrong sides held together, working through inner loop of first row and outer loop of last row, slip st in each st. Fasten off.
Slide band into place to cover color change. 
Whipstitch if desired. 
FINISHING
Cape 
Block cape lightly, if needed. Center star on B-colored band on cape; with beginning tail, backstitch center of star first, then sew points with end tail.

materials: 3 2-inch (5 cm) squares of felt in assorted colors
hot glue gun or fabric glue
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures: 7" (18 cm) in diameter.
gauge: 12 sts = 4" (10 cm); 15 rows = 4" (10 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Skull Top
With A, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next st, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 5 times; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first st, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 5 times, 2 sc in next st, sc in last st; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 3 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 5 times; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc. 
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts] 5 times, 2 sc in next st, sc in last 2 sts; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc. Do not fasten off. Continue in turned rows.
Bottom
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 6 sts, sc2tog; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—8 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 4 sts, sc2tog, turn—6 sc.
Rows 4 and 5: Repeat Row 2. 
Do not fasten off. Continue in rounds.
Border
Round 1: Ch 1, working in ends of rows, sc in each row across first edge of bottom; working in unworked sts of Round 6, sc in next st, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] 4 times, 2 sc in next st; working in ends of rows, sc in each row across other edge of bottom, ch 1, sc in each st of Row 5, ch 1; join with slip st in first sc—47 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING 
Skull
Print template shown below. For each skull, cut forehead flower, nose, and 2 eyes from felt. Apply a small amount of glue on center back of each piece. Referring to photo as a guide, position pieces on skull and, with B and straight stitches, sew each piece in place. With B, embroider straight stitch teeth.
Weave in ends.
FLOWERS
Carnation (make 3: 1 each with C, D, and E)
Ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as first hdc), 9 hdc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—10 hdc. 
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc), 2 hdc in same st as join, 3 hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—30 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 4 (counts as hdc, ch 2), hdc in same st as join, [ch 2, hdc] twice in each st around, ch 2; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch—60 hdc and 60 ch-2 spaces. Fasten off.
Large Flower (make 2: 1 each with C and E) 
Round 1 (right side): Work same as Round 1 of Carnation.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as first dc), working in front loops only, dc in same st as join, 2 dc in next st, [(ch 2, slip st, ch 2, dc) in next st, 2 dc in next st] 4 times, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc, 4 slip sts, 9 ch-2 spaces.
Round 3: Working in back loops only, slip st in same st as join, ch 2 (counts as first hdc), hdc in same st, 2 hdc in each st and ch around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—68 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 2, working in front loops only, dc in same st as join, 2 dc in next st, [(ch 2, slip st, ch 2, dc) in next st, 2 dc in next st] around, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off.
Small Flower (make 3: 1 each with D, E, and F) 
Work same as Rounds 1–3 of Large Flower. Fasten off.
FINISHING FLOWERS
Weave in ends.
HAT
With B, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc. 
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next st, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 5 times; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc. 
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 5 times, sc in next st; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Rounds 5-10: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Brim
Round 11: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 3 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 5 times; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc. 
Round 12: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, [sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st] 5 times, sc in last 2 sts; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc.
Round 13: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 5 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] 5 times; join with slip st in first sc—42 sc. 
Round 14: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts, 2 sc in next st, [sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st] 5 times, sc in last 3 sts; join with slip st in first sc—48 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING HAT
Referring to photograph as a guide, arrange flowers and skull on the hat as desired and glue in place.

hot glue gun or fabric glue
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hat measures: 6" (15 cm) in diameter.
gauge: 12 sts = 4" (10 cm); 15 rows = 4" (10 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
Skull
With A, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next st, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 5 times; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first st, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 5 times, 2 sc in next st, sc in last st; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 3 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 5 times; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
