Bottom
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 6 sts, sc2tog; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—8 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. 
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 4 sts, sc2tog, turn—6 sc.
Rows 4 and 5: Repeat Row 2. Do not fasten off. Continue in rounds.
Border
Round 1: Ch 1, working in ends of rows, sc in each row across first edge of bottom; working in unworked sts of Round 6, sc in next st, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] 4 times, 2 sc in next st; working in ends of rows, sc in each row across other edge of bottom, ch 1, sc in each st of Row 5, ch 1; join with slip st in first sc—47 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING SKULL
Print template shown below. For each skull, cut forehead flower, nose, and 2 eyes from felt. Apply a small amount of glue on center back of each piece. Referring to photo as a guide, position pieces on skull and, with B and straight stitches, sew each piece in place. With B, embroider straight stitch teeth.
Weave in ends.
FLOWERS
Carnation
With C, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as first hdc), 9 hdc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—10 hdc. 
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc), 2 hdc in same st as join, 3 hdc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—30 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 4 (counts as hdc, ch 2), hdc in same st as join, [ch 2, hdc] twice in each st around, ch 2; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch—60 hdc and 60 ch-2 spaces. Fasten off.
Large Flower
Round 1 (right side): With E, work same as Round 1 of Carnation.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as first dc), working in front loops only, dc in same st as join, 2 dc in next st, [(ch 2, slip st, ch 2, dc) in next st, 2 dc in next st] 4 times, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc, 4 slip sts, 9 ch-2 spaces.
Round 3: Working in back loops only, slip st in same st as join, ch 2 (counts as first hdc), hdc in same st, 2 hdc in each st and ch around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—68 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 2, working in front loops only, dc in same st as join, 2 dc in next st, [(ch 2, slip st, ch 2, dc) in next st, 2 dc in next st] around, ch 2; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off.
Small Flower (make 2: 1 each with C and D)
Work same as Rounds 1–3 of Large Flower. Fasten off.
FINISHING FLOWERS
Weave in ends.
HAT
With B, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc. 
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next st, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 5 times; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc. 
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 5 times, sc in next st; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 3 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 5 times; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc. 
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, [sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st] 5 times, sc in last 2 sts; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 5 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] 5 times; join with slip st in first sc—42 sc. 
Fasten off.
FINISHING HAT
Referring to photograph as a guide, arrange flowers and skull on the hat as desired and glue in place. Glue or sew elastic band to wrong side of hat.

pattern_name: It’s a Hoot Owl Hat & Cape
materials: RED HEART® 'Super Saver®': 1 skein each 334 Buff A
Crochet Hooks: 5.5mm [US I-9], 4mm [US G-6], and 3.75mm [US F-5]
abbreviations: A, B, C; etc. = color A, B, C; etc.
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Capelet = 18” wide at shoulder; Hat = 18” circumference x 7” high.
gauge: Hat: 16 sts = 4”; 12 rows = 4” in hdc with middle size hook. Capelet: 12 sts = 4” in hdc with largest hook.
instructions:
Capelet
Row 1: Beginning at neck edge, with A and largest hook, ch 31; working in the back bumps only sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 30 sc.
Row 2: Ch 2, hdc in first 5 sc, [2 hdc in next sc, hdc in next sc] 10 times, hdc in last 5 sts; turn – 40 hdc.
Row 3: Ch 2, hdc in first 5 hdc, [hdc in next 9 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 3 times, hdc in last 5 hdc; turn – 43 hdc.
Row 4: Ch 2, hdc in first 5 hdc, [hdc in next 2 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 11 times, hdc in last 5 hdc; turn – 54 hdc.
Row 5: Ch 2, hdc in first 5 hdc, [hdc in next 10 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 4 times, hdc in last 5 hdc; turn – 58 hdc.
Row 6: Ch 2, hdc in first 5 hdc, [hdc in next 11 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 4 times, hdc in last 5 hdc; turn – 62 hdc.
Row 7: Ch 2, hdc in first 5 hdc, [hdc in next 12 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 4 times, hdc in last 5 hdc; turn – 66 hdc.
Row 8: Ch 2, hdc in first 5 hdc, [2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in next 6 hdc] 8 times, hdc in last 5 hdc; turn – 74 hdc.
Row 9: Ch 2, hdc in first 12 hdc, [2 dc in next hdc, dc in next hdc] 7 times, hdc in next 22 hdc, [2 dc in next hdc, dc in next hdc] 7 times, hdc in last 12 hdc; turn – 88 sts.
Row 10: Ch 2, hdc in first 12 hdc, dc in next 21 dc, hdc in next 22 hdc, dc in next 21 dc, hdc in last 12 hdc; turn.
Rows 11 and 12: Repeat Row 10.
Rows 13 and 14: Ch 2, hdc in each st across; turn.
Fasten off.
Capelet Feathers
With right side facing and largest hook, join A at upper left neck edge; ch 1, working across row ends: work 20 sc evenly spaced down left edge; working along the bottom edge: slip st in the first hdc, [ch 7, hdc in 3rd ch from hook and next 3 ch, slip st in the next ch, sc in the next 3 hdc of bottom edge] 29 times, ch 7, hdc in 3rd ch from hook and next 3 ch, slip st in the next ch; working across row ends: work 20 sc evenly spaced up right edge – 30 feathers. 
Fasten off.
Capelet Edging and Tie Straps
Left Tie and Edging
With largest hook and C, ch 39; sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, sc in first sc of left side edging, [skip next sc, 5 dc in next sc, skip next sc, slip st in next sc] 5 times down left edge; slip st in first st of lower edge; work across feathers: * hdc in next 4 ch of ch-7, 2 hdc in next ch, 5 dc in ch-2 space at tip, 2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in next 4 sts of feather **, sc in next 3 sc between feathers; repeat from * across, end at **; slip st in last st; working up right side edge: sc in first sc, [skip next sc, 5 dc in next sc, skip next sc, slip st in next sc] 5 times; ch 39 for 2nd tie; sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; slip st to top edge. Fasten off.
Hat
With middle size hook and A, ch 72; join with a slip st in first ch to form a ring being careful that ch is not twisted. Work in continuous rounds without joining. Mark last st of each round and move marker up each round.
Rounds 1-3: Sc in each st around – 72 sc.
Rounds 4-20: Hdc in each st around.
Top Seam: Fold hat flat. Working in the front loop of the top layer and the back loop of the bottom layer, sc in each stitch across. Fasten off. 
Feather Tufts (Make 2)
With smallest hook and A, [ch 7, working in back bumps only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 5 ch] 3 times. Fasten off leaving yarn tail for sewing.
Tuft Edging
With right side facing and smallest hook, join C in first sc of first tuft, working around the tuft [sc in first 5 sts, 5 sc in next st, sc in 5 spaces along opposite side] 3 times. Fasten off leaving yarn tail for sewing.
Shape Feathers
With C yarn tail, thread yarn needle. Insert needle through the bottom left and right edges of all 3 feathers and pull tightly so that a fold is formed in the edge. Repeat until desired effect is achieved. Use remaining yarn to attach to corners of hat as pictured.
Beak
With smallest hook and D, ch 14; join with slip st to form a ring taking care that ch is not twisted. Work in continuous rounds same as for Hat.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around – 14 sc.
Round 2: [Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog] twice – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] twice – 10 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] twice – 8 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] twice – 6 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] twice – 4 sc.
Fasten off leaving long yarn tail. Thread yarn tail in needle and weave through remaining sc to close opening. 
Round 8: Working on opposite side of starting ch, join D in any ch; ch 1, sc in same ch and in each ch around – 14 sc.
Round 9: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] twice, sc in next 2 sc, [sc in next sc, sc2tog] twice – 10 sc.
Round 10: [Sc2tog] 5 times – 5 sc.
Fasten off, weaving tail through sts to close hole, leaving yarn tail for attaching beak to face.
Eyes (Make 2)
Round 1: With smallest hook and F, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join.
Round 2: 2 Sc in each sc around; join with a slip st in next sc – 12 sc. Fasten off.
Round 3: With right side facing join B in back loop of any sc; working in back loops only, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join in first sc – 18 sc. Fasten off.
Round 4: Join E in back loop of any sc; working in back loops only, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 9 times; join – 27 sc.
Round 5: Ch 2, [hdc in next 2 sc, 2 hdc in next sc] 9 times; join – 36 hdc. Fasten off.
Round 6: Join F in front loop of any st; slip st in front loop of each st around; join. Fasten off. Place marker or scrap piece of yarn in last st completed. Set eye aside and repeat Rounds 1-6 for second eye.
Round 7: At marker, join B in remaining back loop of Round 5 to work behind sts of Round 6; ch 2, ** [hdc in next 5 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 6 times; join – 42 hdc.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in first 3 hdc, [hdc in next 3 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 4 times, sc in next 3 hdc **, ch 1; locate marked st of 2nd eye and repeat from ** to **.
Round 9: Continue around the bottom of both eyes: sc in each st to first sc of Round 8; join. Fasten off.
Round 10: Join C in back loop of same st as joining; * sc in next 2 sts, hdc in next 3 sts, dc in next 5 sts, [2 dc in next st] twice, dc in next 5 sts, hdc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st *, 2 sc in ch-1 space between the eyes; repeat between * and * for 2nd eye; slip st in each st around to beginning of Round 10; join. Fasten off.
Finishing
Center eye motif on hat as pictured; sew in place. With B, embroider one French Knot off center in each eye. Sew beak centered below the eyes as shown. Sew feather tufts to corners of hat. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Fashion Crochet Metallics, Size 5: 2 balls 410S Silver/Silver
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Finished Size: 5¾” (14.5 cm) tall x 21½” (54.5 cm) in circumference. One size fits most adults.
gauge: 28 sts = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
CROWN
Ch 150, and without twisting, slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, working in back bars of ch sts, sc in each ch around – 150 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with a slip st in first sc – 150 sc.
Round 3: Ch 5 (counts as dc, ch 2), skip next 2 sc, *dc in next sc, ch 2, skip next 2 sc; repeat from * around, join with a slip st in 3rd ch of beg ch-5 – 50 ch-2 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first st, *2 sc in next ch-2 space, sc in next dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, join with a slip st in first sc – 150 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in each of first 8 sc, *ch 5, skip next 5 sc, dc in each of next 5 sc, ch 5, skip next 5 sc**, sc in each of next 15 sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, sc in each of last 7 sc, join with a slip st in first sc – 10 ch-5 spaces; 5 pattern repeats.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in each of first 7 sc, *ch 5, skip next sc, dc in next ch-5 space, dc in each of next 2 dc, ch 1, skip next dc, dc in each of next 2 dc, dc in ch-5 space, ch 5, skip next sc**, sc in each of next 13 sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, sc in each of last 6 sc, join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in each of first 6 sc, *ch 5, skip next sc, skip next ch-5 space, dc in each of next 3 dc, ch 5, dc in next ch-1 space, ch 5, dc in each of next 3 dc, ch 5, skip next ch-5 space, skip next sc**, sc in each of next 11 sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, sc in each of last 5 sc, join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in each of first 5 sc, *ch 5, skip next sc, skip next ch-5 space, dc in each of next 3 dc, ch 3, sc in next ch-5 space, ch 10, sc in ch-5 space, ch 3, dc in each of next 3 dc, ch 5, skip next ch-5 space, skip next sc**, sc in each of next 9 sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, sc in each of last 4 sc, join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 9: Ch 1, sc in each of first 4 sc, *ch 5, skip next sc, skip next ch-5 space, dc in each of next 3 dc, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, 25 dc in next ch-10 space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, dc in each of next 3 dc, ch 5, skip next ch-3 space, skip next sc**, sc in each of next 7 sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, sc in each of the last 3 sc, join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 10: Ch 1, sc in each of first 3 sc, *ch 5, skip next sc, skip next ch-3 space, dc in each of next 3 dc, ch 3, dc in next dc, [ch 3, skip next 2 dc, dc in next dc] 8 times, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, dc in each of next 3 dc, ch 5, skip next ch-5 space, skip next sc**, sc in each of next 5 sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, sc in each of last 2 sc, join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 11: Ch 1, sc in each of first 2 sc, *ch 5, skip next sc, skip next ch-5 space, dc in each of next 3 dc, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, dc in next dc, [3 dc in next ch-3 space, dc in next dc] 8 times, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, dc in each of next 3 dc, ch 5, skip next ch-5 space, skip next sc**, sc in each of next 3 sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, sc in each of last sc, join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 12: Ch 5 (counts as dtr) *skip next ch-5 space, dc in each of next 3 dc, ch 3, dc in next dc, [ch 3, skip next 3 dc, V-st in next dc] 7 times, ch 3, skip next 3 dc, dc in next dc, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, dc in each of next 3 dc**, skip next sc**, dtr in next sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-5.
Round 13: Ch 3 (counts as dc), *dc3tog over next 3 sts, (ch 3, sc) in each of next 2 ch-3 spaces, ch 3, [(2 dc, picot cluster, 2 dc) in next V-st, ch 2, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 2] 6 times, (2 dc, picot cluster, 2 dc) in next V-st,(ch 3, sc) in each of next 2 ch-3 spaces, ch 3, dc3tog over next 3 dc**, dc in next dtr; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3. Fasten off.
Finishing
Weave in ends. Starch and block to fit.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 722 Pretty n’ Pink MC and 672 Spring Green CC.
abbreviations: [] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Bloom will fit a medium size dog with a neck measurement from 11-15” [28-38 cm]. Finished circumference = 13” [33 cm].
gauge: 12 sc = 4” [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COLLAR
Row 1: With CC, join leaves as follows: with right side facing and holding leaf point down, join yarn to upper right corner; ch 1, skipping the slip st row (Row 6) sc in the side of next 4 rows, skip 2 rows, sc in the side of the next 4 rows; [pick up next leaf and work across in same manner] 4 times; turn – 40 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across changing to MC in last sc; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sc, with right side facing hold a petal on top of work and skipping slip st row as before, [working through both thicknesses of petal and Collar, sc in next 4 rows on petal, skip 2 rows on petal (do not skip sc on Collar), sc in next 4 rows on petal] 4 times, sc in last 4 sc on Collar; turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 5: [Hold a petal on top of work, [working through both thicknesses of petal and Collar, sc in next 4 rows on petal, skip 2 rows on petal (do not skip sc on Collar), sc in next 4 rows on petal] 5 times; turn.
Rows 6-10: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew last row of Collar to first row to form a long tube. With 2 strands of CC, make a chain 36” (91 cm) long. Trim ends, thread chain through tube. Weave in all loose ends.
PETAL (Make 9)
With MC, ch 8.
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook and in next 3 ch, 6 dc in last ch, working on opposite side of beginning ch, dc in next 5 ch; turn – 16 sts.
Row 2: Ch 2, skip first dc, dc in next 4 dc, [2 dc in next dc] 6 times, dc in next 5 dc; turn – 23 sts.
Row 3: Ch 2, skip first dc, dc in next 4 dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc] 6 times, dc in last 5 sts (4 dc and top of ch-2); turn – 28 sts.
Row 4: Ch 2, skip first dc, dc in next 4 dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next 2 dc] 6 times, dc in last 5 sts; turn – 34 sts.
Row 5: Ch 2, skip first dc, dc in next 4 dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next 3 dc] 6 times, dc in last 5 sts; turn – 40 sts.
Row 6: Slip st in each st across. Fasten off.
LEAF (Make 5)
With CC, ch 8.
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 3rd ch from hook and in next 4 ch, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) all in last ch, working on opposite side of beginning ch, dc in next 5 ch; turn.
Row 2: Ch 2, skip first dc, dc in next 7 dc, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) all in ch-1 space, dc in next 8 dc; turn.
Row 3: Ch 2, skip first dc, dc in next 10 dc, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) all in ch-1 space, dc in last 11 sts (10 dc and top of ch-2); turn.
Row 4: Ch 2, skip first dc, dc in next 13 dc, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) all in ch-1 space, dc in last 14 sts; turn.
Row 5: Ch 2, skip first dc, dc in next 16 dc, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) all in ch-1 space, dc in last 17 sts; turn.
Row 6: Slip st in each st across. Fasten off.

materials: 1 skein of 512 Turqua RED HEART® Super Saver®
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5 mm [I-9 US]
abbreviations: () = work directions in parentheses into same st
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Crown measures: 18 (19½, 21)” (45.5 [49.5, 53.5] cm) in circumference.
gauge: 15 sts = 4½” (11.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CROWN
Ch 60 (65, 70), being careful not to twist chain, join with slip st in first ch to form a circle. 
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in each ch around; join with slip st in first sc – 60 (65, 70) sc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts a dc), dc in each of next 2 sts, ch 2, skip next 2 st, *dc in each of next 3 sts, ch 2, skip next 2 sts; repeat from * around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2 – 12 (13, 14) ch-2 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in next dc, *(2 hdc, dc, picot, dc, 2 hdc) in next ch-2 space**, skip next dc, sc in next dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, join with slip st in first sc – 12 (13, 14) shells. 
Round 4: Working sts loosely, *slip st in each st to next picot, skip next picot, working behind picot, slip st in next dc; repeat from * around, ending with slip st in each st to beginning; join with slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver: 1 skein of 726 Coral A
RED HEART® Vivid: 1 ball of 6273 Crazy Coral B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6 mm [US J-10]
abbreviations: A, B, C, etc = Colors A, B, C, etc
( ) = work instructions in parentheses as indicated
measurements: Finished Size: 18 (20)” (45.5 (51) cm) circumference
gauge: Rounds 1-4 = 4” (10 cm) diameter in A. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Create a wonderful wig for a child to wear at Halloween or when playing dress up. First a hat-like piece is crocheted and then fringe is added to create the “hair”.
All Sizes
Rounds 8-9 (9-10): Ch 3, (ch 1, hdc in next space) around, join with sc to first hdc.
Round 10 (11): Ch 1 (counts as first sc, now and throughout), sc in each hdc and ch-1 space around, join with slip st to first sc—60 (64) sc.
Round 11 (12): Ch 1, (sc2tog, sc in next 4 (6) sc) around to last sc, skip last sc, join with slip st to first sc— 50 (56) sc.
Round 12 (13): Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st to first sc, fasten off.
FINISHING
Cut several 8” (20.5 cm) lengths of B to form hair. Beginning at top of hat, attach lengths around every hdc post throughout using Fringe Knot.
Fringe Knot: Fold 8” length of yarn in half, use crochet hook to pull folded end through stitch; remove hook, insert the two ends through the loop and pull ends to tighten.
Directions are for size Small; changes for size Medium are in parentheses.
Special Stitch
Sc2tog = (insert hook in next dc, Yo and pull up a loop) twice, Yo and pull through 3 loops on hook (1 stitch decrease).
WIG
With A, ch 4; join with slip st to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 3 (counts as hdc plus ch 1, now and throughout), hdc in ring, (ch 1, hdc in ring) 6 times, join with sc to first hdc— 8 ch-1 spaces.
Round 2: Ch 3, hdc in same space, ch 1, hdc in next space, *ch 1, hdc in next space, ch 1, hdc in same space, ch 1, hdc in next space; repeat from * around; join with sc to first hdc— 12 ch-1 spaces.
Round 3: Repeat Round 2—18 ch-1 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 3, hdc in same space, (ch 1, hdc in next space) twice, *ch 1, hdc in next space, ch 1, hdc in same space, (ch 1, hdc in next space) twice; repeat from * around; join with sc to first hdc— 24 ch-1 spaces.
Round 5: Ch 3, (ch 1, hdc in next space) around, join with sc to first hdc.
Rounds 6 and 7: Repeat Rounds 4 and 5— 30 ch-1 spaces.
Size Medium Only
Round 8: Ch 3, hdc in same space, *(ch 1, hdc in next space) 14 times, ch 1, hdc in next space, ch 1, hdc in same space; repeat from * around, join with sc to first hdc— 32 ch-1 spaces.

materials: RED HEART® “SuperSaver™”: 1 skein each 971 Camouflage A and 406 Medium Thyme B
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Finished Chest: 16-19 (20-25, 26-32)”. Finished Length: 10 (14, 17)”.
gauge: 12 sts = 4” using 5.5mm [US I-9] hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specified gauge.
instructions:
LOWER BODY
With A and 5.5mm [US I-9] hook, ch 20 (38, 50).
Row 1 (RS): Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 18 (36, 48) dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), 2 dc in first st, dc in each st to last st, 3 dc in last st, turn – 22 (40, 52) dc.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in each st across, turn.
Row 4: Ch 3 (counts as dc), 2 dc in first st, dc in each st to last st, 3 dc in last st, turn – 26 (44, 56) dc.
Row 5: Ch 3, dc in each st across, turn.
Row 6: Ch 3 (counts as dc), 2 dc in first st, dc in each st to last st, 3 dc in last st, turn – 30 (48, 60) dc.
Rows 7-10 (12, 14): Ch 3, dc in each st across, turn.
Row 11 (13, 15)-14 (18, 20): Ch 2, dc in next st (counts as dcto2tog), dc in each st to last 2 sts, dc2tog – 22 (36, 48) dc.
Rows 15 (19, 21)-16 (22, 28): Ch 3, dc in each st across. Do not fasten off.
Shape Neck
Using separate length of A, join yarn to first st of last row, ch 8 (9, 9) for Collar.
Fasten off.
Row 1: With right side facing, insert hook in last st of last row worked, ch 9 (10, 10) for Collar, sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch, sc in next 22 (36, 48) dc, sc in next 8 (9, 9) ch, turn – 38 (54, 66) sts.
Rows 2-2 (4, 4): Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Shape Collar
Row 1: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each st to last st, 2 sc in last st, turn – 40 (56, 68) sc.
Rows 2-6 (8, 8): Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each st to last sc, 2 sc in last sc – 50 (70, 82) sc.
Fasten off.
POCKET
With B and 5.5mm [US I-9] hook, ch 13 (15, 17).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 12 (14, 16) sc.
Rows 2-12 (14, 16): Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Do not fasten off.
Edging
Round 1: With right side facing, ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc evenly spaced around, working 3 sc in each corner, sc in first corner, slip st to first st to join. Fasten off.
Pocket Flap
With A and 5.5mm [US I-9] hook, ch 14 (16, 18).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 13 (15, 15) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc3tog, sc in each st to last 3 sts, sc3tog – 9 (11, 11) sc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Body Edging
Row 1: With right side facing, join B at upper Body next to neck with sc, work 31 (43, 49) sc along side to lower corner, work 3 sc in corner, work 15 (34, 46) sc along lower edge, work 3 sc in corner, work 32 (44, 50 ) sc along edge to upper neck. Fasten off.
Collar Edging
Round 1: With right side facing, join B in first sc of Body Edging, sc in next 7 (8, 8) sc, work 3 sc in corner of Collar, working in edges of neck rows, work sc, ch 4 for button loop, slip st in last sc made, sc in next 1 (2, 2) sc along edge of collar, work 3 sc in corner of Collar, work 48 (68, 80) sc to next Collar corner, work 3 sc in corner, work 5 (7, 7) sc along edges of Collar, work 3 sc in corner, work 7 (8, 8) sc to last st of Body Edging, slip st to first st to join. Fasten off.
Flap Edging
Round 1: Working in opposite edge of beginning ch, join A in first ch with sc, sc again in same ch, sc in next 12 (14, 14) ch, work 3 sc in corner, work 3 sc along side edge, work 3 sc in corner, sc in next 3 (4, 4) sc, ch 4 for button loop, slip st in same st as last sc, sc in next 3 (4, 4) sc, sc in same st as beginning sc, slip st to first sc to join. Fasten off.
Sew Pocket Flap on top edge of Pocket. Sew Pocket to center of Body.
Sew buttons opposite button loops.
D-Ring Tab
Row 1: Place marker on left side 6 (7, 8½)” from bottom edge. Using 5.5mm [US I-9] hook, join A with sc in 3rd st above marker, sc in next 2 sts, turn.
Rows 2-4: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Fasten off, leaving an 8” tail.
Fold tab over both D rings and sew end to inside edge of Body.
Strap
Row 1: With right side facing, join A with sc in opposite D-Ring Tab, sc in next 2 sts, turn.
Work even in sc until Strap measures 11 (12, 12)” or desired length.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
CAP
Note: Work Size Small using 4mm [US G-6] hook, Size Medium using 5mm [US H-8] hook, and Size Large using 5.5mm [US I-9] hook.
Round 1: With A, ch 2, work 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join. Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around – 16 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 24 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 32 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 40 sc.
Round 6: Working in back loop only, sc in each sc around, sl st to first st to join.
Rounds 7-10: Ch 3 (counts as dc), working in both loops, dc in each st around, slip st to top of beginning ch. Fasten off.
Shape Bill
Row 1: With right side facing and working around bottom of Cap, join A in 16th sc after first st, sc in next st, hdc in next 3 sts, dc in next 2 sts, 3 dc in next st, dc in next 2 sts, hdc in next 3 sts, sc in next 2 sts, turn – 17 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 7 sts, 2 sc in each of next 3 sts, sc in last 7 sts, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, work in sc around outer edge of Cap and Bill, slip st to first st to join. Fasten off.
Ties (Make 2)
Join A at side of hat, ch 40. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Mask measures 7½” (19 cm) long.
gauge: Gauge is not important for this project.
instructions:
MASK (all versions)
Round 1: With desired main color, make mock padding cord ring, working 13 sc around both rings, join with slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st, ch 2, sc in next sc, [ch 1, sc in next sc] 7 times, (bottom side of mask) ch 2, sc in next sc, [ch 1, sc in next sc] 3 times, ch 1, join with slip st in first sc.

Side A Eye Piece
Row 1: Slip st in ch-2 space, ch 35, slip st in same space.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, 49 sc in ch-35 space, join with slip st in ch-2 space.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 9 sc, hdc in next 3 sc, dc in next 8 sc, [2 dc in next sc, dc in next sc] 4 times, 2 dc in next sc, dc in next 8 sc, hdc in next 3 sc, sc in next 9 sc, slip st in ch-2 space. Fasten off, weave in ends.

Side B Eye Piece
Join same color in next ch-2 space, follow instructions for side A, do not fasten off.

Eye Bridge
Row 1: Turn, slip st up to and in 3rd sc on Side B, ch 1, turn, sc in same sc, [ch 1, dc in next ch-1 space on ring] 4 times, ch 1, sc in 3rd sc on next eye piece.
Row 2: Slip st in next sc, ch 1, turn, sc in next ch-1 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-1 space] 4 times, join with slip st in next sc on eye piece.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, [2 sc in next ch-3 space, picot in last sc made, sc in same space] 4 times, join with slip st in 4th sc on eye piece. Do not fasten off, Do not turn.

Side A Eye Piece
Row 4: Sc in next sc, ch 2, skip next sc, dc in next sc, ch 1, dc in next sc, ch 1, skip next hdc, dc in next hdc, ch 1, skip next hdc, dc in next dc, [ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next dc] 2 times, dc in next dc, 2 cdc worked in next 4 dc, 10 cdc increases worked in next 10 dc, 3 cdc worked in next 6 dc, dc in next 2 dc, ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next hdc, dc in next hdc, ch 1, skip next hdc, dc in next sc, [ch 1, skip next sc, dc in next sc] 3 times, ch 2, skip next sc, slip st in next sc, slip st in ch-2 space on ring.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, 3 sc in next ch-2 space, [2 sc in ch-1 space] 6 times, sc in next 30 dc, hdc in next 2 dc, dc in next 2 dc, [puff st in next ch-1 space, dc in next dc] 3 times, puff st in next ch-1 space, hdc in next dc, 2 sc in next ch-1 space, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, slip st in joining between eye piece and nose bridge.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 3 sc, picot in last sc made, sc in next sc, sc in next hdc, sc in next puff st, sc in next dc, sc in next puff st, picot in last sc made, sc in next dc, sc in next puff st, sc in next dc, ch 7, turn, skip next 5 sc, sc in next sc, slip st in next sc, ch 1, turn, [4 sc in ch-7 space, picot in last sc made] 2 times, 3 sc in same space, sc in same dc on eye piece, sc in next puff st, sc in next 2 dc, sc in next 2 hdc, sc in next 2 sc, ch 3, turn, skip next 2 sc, dc in next sc, ch 3, dc in same sc, ch 3, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc, slip st in next sc, ch 1, turn, 2 sc in next ch-3 space, picot in last sc made, sc in same space, 3 sc in next ch-3 space, picot in last sc made, 2 sc in next ch-3 space, picot in last sc made, sc in same space, sc in next sc, sc in front loop only on next 21 sc, (place marker in back loop of first and 21st sc worked in front loop), sc in next 20 sc, slip st in next ch-1 space on ring.
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 4 sc, picot in last sc made, sc in next 3 sc, picot in last sc made, sc in next 5 sc, picot in last sc made, sc in next 3 sc, ch 7, turn, skip next 5 sc, sc in next sc, slip st in next sc, ch 1, turn, [4 sc in ch-7 space, picot in last sc made] 2 times, 3 sc in same space, sc in next 8 sc, ch 3, turn, skip next 2 sc, dc in next sc, ch 3, dc in same sc, ch 3, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc, slip st in next sc, ch 1, turn, [2 sc in next ch-3 space, picot in last sc made, sc in same space] 3 times, slip st in same sc on eye piece. Fasten off, weave in ends.
Row 8: Join same color thread in sc shared by arch on top of mask, working down the side, ch 1, sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 9 sc, ch 9, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch st, dc in same sc, [skip next ch st, dc in next ch st] 3 times, rotate to work in sc on mask, skip next sc, hdc in next sc, sc in next 13 sc, slip st in next sc, turn, sc in next 11 sc, ch 7, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch st, dc in same sc, [skip next ch st, dc in next ch st] 2 times, rotate to work in sc on mask, skip next sc, hdc in next sc, sc in next 12 sc, slip st in next sc, turn, sc in next 10 sc, ch 7, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch st, dc in same sc, [skip next ch st, dc in next ch st] 2 times, rotate to work in sc on mask, skip next sc, hdc in next sc, [sc in next 3 sts, picot in last sc made] 2 times, sc in next sc, slip st in same st as thread join at beginning of row. Fasten off, weave in ends.

Side B Eye Piece
Row 4: With wrong side facing, join thread in same sc eye piece is slip stitched in on upper edge, sc in next sc, ch 2, skip next sc, dc in next sc, ch 1, dc in next sc, ch 1, skip next hdc, dc in next hdc, ch 1, skip next hdc, dc in next dc, [ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next dc] 2 times, dc in next dc, 2 cdc worked in next 4 dc, 10 cdc increases worked in next 10 dc, 3 cdc worked in next 6 dc, dc in next 2 dc, ch 1, skip next dc, ch 1, dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next hdc, dc in next hdc, ch 1, skip next hdc, dc in next sc, [ch 1, skip next sc, dc in next sc] 2 times, ch 2, skip next sc, slip st in next sc, slip st in ch-2 space on ring.
Row 5: Repeat row 5 from side A.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 3 sc, picot in last sc made, sc in next sc, sc in next hdc, sc in next puff st, sc in next dc, sc in next puff st, picot in last sc made, sc in next dc, sc in next puff st, sc in next dc, ch 7 turn, skip next 5 sc, sc in next sc, slip st in next sc, ch 1, turn, [4 sc in ch-7 space, picot in last sc made] 2 times, 3 sc in same space, sc in same dc on eye piece, sc in next puff st, sc in next 2 dc, sc in next 2 hdc, sc in next 2 sc, ch 3, turn, skip next 2 sc, dc in next sc, ch 3, dc in same sc, ch 3, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc, slip st in next sc, ch 1, turn, 2 sc in next ch-3 space, picot in last sc made, sc in same space, 3 sc in next ch-3 space, picot in last sc made, 2 sc in next ch-3 space, picot in last sc made, sc in same space, sc in next sc, sc in back loop only on next 21 sc, (place marker in front loop of first and 21st sc worked in back loop), sc in next 20 sc, slip st in next ch-1 space on ring.
Rows 7 and 8: Repeat rows 7 and 8 from side A.

Nose Piece
With right side facing, join thread in last sc next to lower section of the ring on eye piece, working toward the ring, ch 1, sc in same st, sc in next 2 ch-1 spaces on ring, picot in last sc made, [sc in next sc, picot in last sc made] 2 times, sc in next ch-1 space, sc in next sc on the next eye piece. Fasten off, weave in ends.

Strap Piece Sides A and B
Row 1: Join thread in first marked free loop on row 6, ch 1, sc in same st, working in the free loop across, sc in next 20 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog worked in next 2 sc, sc in next 5 sc, ch 7, skip next 7 sc, sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog worked in next 2 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog worked in next 2 sc, sc in next sc, picot in last sc made, sc in next 2 sc, picot in last sc made, sc in next sc, 9 sc in ch-7 space, [sc in next 2 sc, picot in last sc made] 2 times, sc2tog worked in next 2 sc. Fasten off, weave in ends.

EMBELLISHMENTS
Version 1
Flower (make 2)
With desired contrast color, ch 4, slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 12 sc in ring, join with slip st in front loop of first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, working in front loop only around, sc in same sc, ch 3, sc in same sc, ch 3, *sc in next sc, ch 3, sc in same sc, ch 3; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, weave in ends.

Leaf 1 (make 2)
With desired contrast color, ch 10, holding last loop of each st on hook, 2 tr in 4th ch from hook, yo, draw through all loops on hook, ch 2, slip st in top of cluster just made, ch 4, slip st in the ch st at base of leaf, slip st in next 3 ch, ch 3, holding last loop of each st on hook 2 tr in same ch, yo, draw through all loops on hook, ch 4, slip st in same ch, slip st around base of leaf just made, slip st in next 2 ch. Fasten off, weave in ends.

Leaf 2 (make 2)
With desired contrast color, ch 5, 2 tr in 4th ch from hook, yo, draw through all loops on hook, ch 2, slip st in top of cluster just made, ch 4, slip st in the ch at base of leaf, slip st in next ch. Fasten off, weave in ends.
Sew beads and embellishments in place before stiffening.

Version 2
Flower (make 6)
With desired contrast color, ch 4, slip st to form a ring. [Ch 2, 3 dc in ring, ch 2, slip st in ring] 5 times. Fasten off, weave in ends.
Leaves (make 4)
Work as for Leaf 2, Version 1.
Sew beads and embellishments in place before stiffening.

Version 3
Star Flower (make 2)
With desired contrast color, ch 4, 2 tr in 4th ch from hook, yo and draw through all loops on hook, ch 3, slip st in top of cluster just made, ch 3, slip st in base of the tr cluster, [ch 3, 2 tr in same st as last petal, yo and draw through all loops on hook, ch 3, slip st in top of cluster just made, ch 3, slip st in same st as last petal] 4 times. Fasten off, weave in ends.

Stiffening
Using paint brush, apply fabric stiffener following manufacturer’s instructions. Pin to wig head to shape and allow to dry, making sure side pieces lay next to head.

Strap
Measure and cut elastic, allowing 1” (2.5 cm) on each end for hem. Hem each end. Sew one half of each snap in place on each end of elastic, and second half of each snap approximately 1½” (3.8 cm) away. Slide ends of the elastic through the holes on the side of the mask and fasten snaps to secure. (If desired, elastic and simply be tied and omit snaps).

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 312 Black
½ yard (.5 mm) ¼” or ½” wide black elastic
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Mask measures 16½” wide x 4½” long (42 x 11.5 cm)
gauge: 10 sts = 4” (10 cm); 7 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: Beginning at the top, ch 40. Row 1 (right side): Dc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first dc), 2 dc in next 2 ch, dc in next 7 ch, hdc in next 4 ch, sc in next 10 ch, hdc in next 4 ch, dc in next 7 ch, 2 dc in last 3 ch, turn—44 sts. Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in first st, 2 dc in next st, dc in next 11 sts, hdc in next 4 sts, sc in next 10 sts, hdc in next 4 sts, dc in next 11 sts, 2 dc in next st, 2 dc in top of beginning ch, turn—48 sts. Row 3: Ch 3, dc in first st, 2 dc in next dc, dc in next 15 sts, ch 10, skip next 5 sts, hdc in next 4 sts, ch 10, skip next 5 sts, dc in next 15 sts, 2 dc in next dc, 2 dc in top of beginning ch, turn—42 sts and 2 ch-10 spaces. Row 4: Ch 3, dc in first st, 2 dc in next st, dc in next 17 sts, 10 hdc in first 10-ch space, hdc in next 4 sts, 10 hdc in next 10-ch space, dc in next 17 sts, 2 dc in next st, 2 dc in top of beginning ch, turn—66 sts. Row 5: Ch 3, dc in first st, 2 dc in next st, dc in next 19 sts, hdc in next 24 sts, dc in next 19 sts, 2 dc in next st, 2 dc in top of beginning ch, turn—70 sts. Round 6: Ch 3, dc in first st, (2 dc, picot, dc) in next st, hdc in next st, sc in next st, *slip st in next st, sc in next st, hdc in next st, (2 dc, picot, dc) in next st, hdc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * once, sc in next 17 sts, hdc in next st, dc in next st, (2 dc, picot, dc) in next st, hdc in next st, sc in next 17 sts, **sc in next st, hdc in next st, (2 dc, picot, dc) in next st, hdc in next st, sc in next st, slip st in next st; repeat from ** once, sc in next st, hdc in next st, (2 dc, picot, dc) in next st, 2 dc in top of beginning ch, sc in end of each row, sc in next 16 sts, hdc in next st, (2 dc, picot, dc) in next st, hdc in next st, sc in next 6 sts, hdc in next st, (2 dc, picot, dc) in next st, hdc in next st, sc in remaining sts across, sc in end of each row; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off. FINISHING: Weave in ends. Insert wire through wrong side of mask and bend to spread out the wings. With sewing needle and thread, sew elastic band to wrong side at outer edges of eye holes, adjusting to fit as needed.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 skeins 319 Cherry Red.
Crochet Hooks: For Cape: 10mm [US N-15] and 5mm [US H-8]; For Hat: 8mm [US L-11].
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Cape hem width = 48”. Cape length = 15”. Hat circumference (unfolded) = 20”. Hat height with unfolded brim = 9.5”.
gauge: Cape: 12.5 sts = 4”; 18 rows = 4” in slip st with largest hook. Hat: 14 sts = 4”; 19 rows = 4” in slip st with middle size hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauges.
instructions:
CAPE
Row 1 (Wrong Side): With largest hook ch 45; slip st in back horizontal bar of each ch across; turn—45 slip sts.
Row 2: Slip st in back loops only to last 9 sts; turn, leaving remaining sts unworked—36 slip sts.
Continue working in back loops only until instructed otherwise.
Row 3: Skip 1 st, slip st across; turn—35 slip sts.
Rows 4-7: Repeat Rows 2 and 3—15 slip sts on final row.
Row 8: Slip st across, slip st in each row and skipped slip st in Rows 2-7 below; turn—45 slip sts.
Row 9: Slip st across; turn—45 slip sts. One Short Row Wedge made.
Repeat Rows 2-9 until a total of 20 Wedges have been completed, and then repeat Rows 2-8 once more.
Fasten off.
Hem
Row 1: With right side facing and smallest hook, join yarn at lower left corner to begin working along lower hem; ch 1, work 168 sc across; turn.
Rows 2 and 3: Now working in both loops throughout, ch 1, sc across; turn. Do not fasten off at end of Row 3 but pivot to work Trim.
Right Front Trim and Tie
Ch 1, with right side still facing and working across ends of Hem rows and sts of Right Front Edge, sc to last 9 sts, ch 30, slip st in each ch across for tie, sc in last 9 sts. Fasten off.
Left Front Trim and Tie
With right side facing, join yarn at upper left corner to begin working along Left Front Edge; ch 1, sc in first 9 sts, ch 30, slip st in each ch across for tie, sc in each st down edge and across row ends of Hem. Fasten off.
HAT
Row 1 (Wrong Side): With middle size hook, ch 33; slip st in back horizontal bar of each ch across; turn—33 slip sts.
Row 2: Slip st in back loops only to last 2 sts; turn, leaving remaining sts unworked—31 slip sts.
Row 3: Skip 1 st, slip st across; turn—30 slip sts.
Rows 4-11: Repeat Rows 2 and 3—18 slip sts on final row.
Row 12: Slip st across, slip st in each row and skipped slip st in Rows 2-11 below; turn—33 slip sts.
Row 13: Slip st across, turn—33 slip sts. One Short Row Wedge made.
Repeat Rows 2-13 once more and then repeat Rows 2-12 once more.
First Opening For Horn-Next Row: ** Slip st across 10 sts, ch 5, skip next 5 sts, slip st across remaining sts; turn.
Next Row: Slip st to ch-5 space, slip st in each ch, slip st to last 2 sts; turn, leaving remaining sts unworked; turn—31 sts. **
Repeat Rows 3-13 as for first Short Row Wedge and then repeat Rows 2-12 once more.
Second Opening For Horn: Work same as First Opening for Horn from ** to **.
Repeat Rows 3-13 as for first Short Row Wedge. Repeat Rows 2-13 once more and then repeat Rows 2-12 once more. Fasten off, leaving 10” tail for seaming.
Loosely baste the sides of rows at top of hat and cinch securely, seam hat.
Horns (Make 2)
Row 1: Ch 7, slip st in back horizontal bar of each ch across; turn—7 slip sts.
Row 2: Slip st in back loops only to last st; turn, leaving last st unworked—6 slip sts.
Row 3: Skip 1 st, slip st across; turn—5 slip sts.
Rows 4 and 5: Repeat Rows 2 and 3—3 slip sts on final row.
Row 6: Repeat Row 2—2 slip sts.
Row 7: Slip st across, slip st in each row and skipped slip st in Rows 2-6 below; turn—7 slip sts.
Row 8: Repeat Row 3—6 slip sts.
Rows 9-12: Repeat Rows 2 and 3—2 slip sts on final row.
Row 13: Repeat Row 7. Fasten off, leaving 10” tail for seaming.
Seam horn, then sew to Opening in hat. Repeat for opposite horn.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each Pumpkin 431, Black 12, Hot Pink 332
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Mask measures approx. 3 ¾” (9 ½ cm) long x 8” (20 ¼ cm) wide, excluding ties.
gauge: 23 sc = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain your gauge.
instructions:
Center Seam
Whipstitch 3 sts between markers together, remove markers. Continue with edging on left eye circle.

Edging and joining center circle
Round 1: Ch 6, dtr5tog, ch 6, skip next st, slip st in next st, [ch 4, skip 3 sts, slip st in next st] 5 times, ch 2, slip st in any ch-2 space on Center Circle, ch 2, skip next 3 sts on Eye Circle, slip st in next st on Eye Circle, ch 2, slip st in next ch-2 sp to the left on Center Circle, ch 2, skip next 3 sts on Eye Circle, slip st in next st on Eye Circle, ch 3, tr in Center Seam, skip next dc on Center Circle, slip st in next dc on Center Circle, ch 3, skip next 4 sts on next Eye Circle, slip st in next st, [ch 2, slip st in next ch-2 space on Center Circle, ch 2, skip next 3 sts on Eye Circle, slip st in next st] twice, [ch 4, skip next 3 sts on Eye Circle, slip st in next st] 5 times, ch 6, skip next st, dtr5tog, dtr in next st, ch 6, slip st in next st, [ch 5, skip next 3 sts, slip st in next st, picot, slip st in same st as last slip st made] 7 times, ch 5, skip next 3 sts, slip st in next st, 4 tr in Center Seam, skip next 2 sts, slip st in next st, [ch 5, skip next 3 sts, slip st in next st, picot, slip st in same st as last slip st made] 7 times, ch 5, slip st in last st, ch 6, join with slip st in top of dtr5tog.

Round 2: Ch 1, sc in dtr5tog, (ch 6, slip st, picot, slip st) in next ch-6 sp and each of next 4 ch-4 spaces, ch 6, slip st in next ch-5 space, [(slip st, picot, slip st, ch 6) in next unworked ch-2 space on Center Circle] 3 times, (slip st, picot, slip st) in next ch-2 space on Center Circle, slip st in next ch-5 space, [(ch 6, slip st, picot, slip st) in next ch-5 space] 4 times, (ch 6, slip st, picot, slip st) in next ch-6 space, ch 6, sc in dtr5tog, (ch 6, slip st, picot, slip st) in next ch-6 space and in each of next 7 ch-5 spaces, ch 6, slip st in next ch-5 space, [tr in next tr, ch 1] 3 times, tr in next tr, slip st in next ch-5 space, (ch 6, slip st, picot, slip st) in each of next 7 ch-5 spaces and in next ch-6 space, ch 6, join with slip st in beginning sc.

Row 3: (Ch 4, 6 tr) in sc, (ch 6, slip st, picot, slip st) in each of next 7 ch-6 spaces, ch 6, [(tr, picot) 5 times, tr] in next ch-6 space, (ch 6, slip st, picot, slip st) in each of next 7 ch-6 spaces, ch 6, (6 tr, ch 4, slip st) in next sc. Fasten off.

Tie
Make tie 48” (122 cm) long. With right side of Mask facing, wrap tie from front to back through first ch-6 space of last row, then pull tie from back to front through last ch-6 space at opposite side. Center strand goes behind head for wearing support. Pull ends of Tie from front to back around 6 tr and ch 4 at each end.

FINISHING
Weave in ends.

Stiffen Mask
With wrong side of Mask facing, brush fabric stiffener onto Mask. Wrap Mask around the Styrofoam® head form. Form the Mask, pinning it in place with rustproof pins. Brush fabric stiffener onto right side of Mask and let dry completely.

materials: RED HEART® “SuperSaver™”: 1 skein each 332 Ranch Red A, 400 Grey Heather B and 774 Light Raspberry C.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Finished Chest: 16-19 (20-25, 26-32)”. Finished Length: 10 (14, 17)”.
gauge: 12 sts = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specified gauge.
instructions:
CAPE
With A, ch 20 (38, 50).
Row 1 (RS): Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 18 (36, 48) dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), 2 dc in first st, dc to last st, 3 dc in last st, turn – 22 (40, 52) dc.
Rows 3-5: Repeat Row 2 – 34 (52, 64) dc.
Work 3 (2, 5) rows in dc.
Shape Upper Cape
Row 1: Ch 2, dc in next st (counts as dc2tog), dc to last 2 sts, dc2tog, turn – 32 (50, 62) dc.
Row 2: Ch 3, dc in each st across, turn.
Repeat Rows 1-2 for 5 (6, 8) more times – 22 (38, 46) dc.
Fasten off.
EDGING
Round 1: With right side facing, join A with sc in lower bottom right corner, sc in same st, work 32 (45, 54) sc to upper corner, work 3 sc in corner, work 20 (36, 42) sc across upper edge, work 3 sc in corner, work 32 (45, 54) sc to first sc, sc in same st as first 2 sc, slip st in first st to join.
Fasten off.
Round 2: Join B with slip st in first st of previous round, ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in each st around; slip st to top of beginning ch.
Round 3: *[Dc, ch 1, dc] 3 times around post of next dc, turn work to left, [ch 1, dc] 3 times around post of next dc, turn work to left, ch 1; repeat from * around; slip st to first st to join.
Fasten off.
RIGHT TIE
Row 1: Join B with in 3rd (4th, 3rd) sc below neck corner on right side, sc in next 2 (3, 3) sts, turn – 3 (4, 4) sc. turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until Tie measures 8 (9, 10)”.
Fasten off.
LEFT TIE
Row 1: Join B in sc at upper neck edge on left side, sc in next 2 (3, 3) sts, turn – 3 (4, 4) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until Tie is same length as first Tie.
Fasten off.
VISOR
With B, ch 21.
Row 1 (RS): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 20 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across.
Fasten off.
Row 3: With right side facing, skip first 3 sc, working in back loops only, join with sc in next st, sc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts, dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next 2 sts, dc in next 2 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, sc in next 2 sts, slip st in next st, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, skip slip st, skip next sc, working in both loops, sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next 2 sts, sc in next 6 sts skip next sc, slip st in next st, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, skip slip st, skip next sc, sc in next 14 sc, skip next sc, slip st in slip st from previous row.
Fasten off.
Flower (Make 2)
With C, ch 2, [ch 7, slip st in 2nd ch from hook] 11 times.
Fasten off.
Sew one Flower to Visor.
Ties
Join yarn in end of Row 1 of Visor, ch 30 for Tie. Repeat at other end of Row.
Fasten off.
PURSE
With B, ch 13 (15, 17).
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 11 (13, 15) dc.
Rows 2-10 (12, 12): Ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in each dc across, turn. Do not fasten off.
Flap
Rows 1-3: Ch 2, dc in next dc (counts as dc2tog), dc in each st to last 2 sts, dc2tog, turn – 5 (7, 9) sts.
Do not fasten off. Mark center st.
Edging
Sc evenly around edge, working 2 sc in each lower corner, to 1 st before marked st, ch 7 to form loop, skip center st, sc around to first st, slip st to first st to join.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
With wrong side facing, fold up bottom of Purse to beginning of Flap. Sew sides together through top loops of each sc.
Purse Strap
Join B with slip st in side seam st, make a ch 14 (18, 24)” or desired length, join with a slip st to opposite side seam. Sew Flower to Front opposite loop.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 512 Turqua A, 3955 Wildflower B, 316 Soft White C, and 312 Black D.
Yarn needle, polyester fiberfill, stitch marker.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Hood Height: 7½ (8½)" [19 (21.5) cm], not including Antennas. Hood Width: 13½ (15)" [34 (38) cm], not including Collar.
instructions:
Collar (Make 2)
Join B with slip st in first row. Work sts into row ends along front edge of Hood.
Row 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc throughout), dc in next 8 sts (10); ch 3, turn – 9 (11) sts.
Row 2: Dc in next 7 sts (9); ch 3, turn – 8 (10) sts.
Row 3: Dc in next 6 sts (8); ch 3, turn – 7 (9) sts.
Row 4: Dc in next 5 sts (7); ch 3, turn – 6 (8) sts.
Row 5: Dc in next 4 sts (6); ch 3, turn – 5 (7) sts.
Row 6: Dc in next 3 sts (5); ch 3, turn – 4 (6) sts.
Row 7: Dc in next 2 sts (4); ch 3, turn – 3 (5) sts.
Row 8: Dc in next st (3); ch 3, turn – 2 (4) sts.
Row 9: Dc in next st (2); ch 3, turn – 2 (3) sts.
Row 10: Dc in next st; ch 3, turn – 2 sts.
Rows 11-22 (25): Repeat Row 10, slip st after last st of last repeat. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Antenna (Make 2)
Note: Add stuffing as work progresses for best results.
With C, ch 2.
Round 1: 5 sc in first ch – 5 sts.
Round 2: 2 sc in each st around – 10 sts.
Round 3: *2 sc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around – 15 sts.
Round 4: *2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around – 20 sts.
Round 5: *2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts; repeat from * around – 25 sts.
Rounds 6-8: Sc in each st around.
Round 9: *Sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around – 20 sts.
Round 10: *Sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around – 15 sts.
Round 11: *Sc in next st, sc2tog; repeat from * around, changing to A in last st – 10 sts.
Fasten off C.
Rounds 12-21: With A, sc in each st around; join with a slip st to first sc after working last st of last repeat. Finish stuffing firmly. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Eye (Make 2)
With D, ch 2.
Round 1: 5 sc in first ch; join with a slip st to first sc – 5 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Using photo as a guide, sew Eyes to Antennas between Rounds 5 – 7. Sew Antennas to Hood approximately 6 (8) rows from top. Weave in ends.
Instructions are for Babies size 6-12 months. Changes for size 12-24 months, are in parentheses.
Notes
1. Ch-2 at the beginning of the row counts as a hdc throughout the pattern.
2. Unless otherwise indicated, do not join rounds; instead, place marker in first st of 2nd round and move up as work progresses.
3. When changing colors, work last st of old color until 2 loops are left on hook, drop old color, yarn over with new color and complete st. Fasten off old color.
Special Stitches
sc2tog = [Draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
hdc2tog = [Yarn over, draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 5 loops on hook.
HOOD
With A, ch 54 (62).
Row 1: Hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each ch across; ch 2, turn – 52 (60) sts.
Row 2: Hdc in each st across; ch 2, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 7½ (8½)" [19 (21.5) cm].
Next Row: Hdc in next 15 (19) sts, [hdc2tog] 10 times, hdc in next 16 (20) sts, slip st in next st – 32 (50) sts.
Do not fasten off. Fold Hood in half, with Right Sides facing; join top edges together by sc or sewing. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 skeins 0316 White
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Collar measures 24” (61 cm) x 7” (18 cm)
gauge: 8 sc = 4” (10 cm); 15 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COLLAR
Bottom Ruffle
Row 1: 50 fdc, turn – 50 sts.
Rows 2-4: Ch 3 (counts as first dc throughout), [2 dc in next st, dc in next st] across, dc in last st; turn – 164 sts.
Rows 5-7: Ch 3, [2 dc in next st, dc in next st] across; turn – 550 sts.
Edging: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st, picot] 5 times; *2 sc in next st; turn, working into edge sts just worked, skip 3 picot, hdc in sc of next picot; turn, continue working into Row 7 sts, [sc in next st, picot, 2 sc in next st] 3 times, sc in next st, picot; turn, working into edge sts just worked, skip 5 picot, hdc in same sc as last picot; turn, continue working into Row 7 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st, picot] 2 times; repeat from * across, slip st in first st to join – 275 picot. Fasten off.
Top Ruffle
Row 1: 50 fdc; turn.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in first st, 2 dc in next st and in each st across; turn – 100 dc.
Rows 3-4: Ch 3, [3 dc in next st, dc in next st] across, 3 dc in last st – 400 dc.
Edging: Ch 7, slip st in 3rd ch from hook, (tr, dc) in first dc, skip 2 sts, [sc in next 2 sts, picot] 5 times, sc in next st; turn, working in base of foundation row, hdc in base of 3rd st of foundation row, turn; *[sc in next st, picot, sc in next st] 5 times, skip 2 sts, (dc, tr, picot, 2 tr, dc) in next st, skip 2 sts, [sc in next st, picot, sc in next st] 5 times; turn working in base of foundation row, skip 2 sts, hdc in next st, turn; repeat from * across. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Neckband: Place Top Ruffle on top of Bottom Ruffle with foundation row sts aligned. Working through thicknesses, join new yarn with sl st in first st, ch 2 (counts as first hdc), hdc in next st and each st across foundation row; work 10 fsc, slip st in first fsc to secure button loop; working along ends of rows and through both thicknesses where ruffles overlap, sc evenly across side edge to neck; ch 1, turn, rev sc along neck edge. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Sew button opposite button loop.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 512 Turqua A, 722 Pretty ‘n Pink B, 1 skein 3620 Glowworm C.
RED HEART® Boutique Sashay®: 1 ball 1959 Twist D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5 mm [US H-8] (for bra top and skirt), and 6.5 mm [US K-10.5] (for boa)
1yd (1m) of netting to match C (for skirt)
sewing needle and thread to match netting
one ½” (13mm) headband (shown: Bow-tique-Horizon Group USA)
three packages shell and fish charms (Bead Landing Oceanside Charms)
one package of Bling Bling Beads (#SUL 51576, Clubhouse Crafts, Advantus Corp.)
one package of large and small sequins
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: To Fit Chest: 23 (25, 26)” (58.5 (63.5, 66) cm) Finished Chest: 22 (24, 25)” (56 (61, 63.5) cm) Note: Bra top will stretch for a snug fit. Finished Skirt Waist: 22 (25, 28)” (56 (63.5, 71) cm), before tightening with drawstring Finished Skirt Length: 16 (17, 19)” (40.5 (43, 48.5) cm), not including netting Note: Netting adds about 8” (20.5 cm) to finished length.
gauge: 16 sts = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm), in single crochet. 4 shells = 5” (12.5 cm); 10 rows = 4” (10 cm), in shell pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BRA TOP
With middle size hook and A, ch 13 (15, 15). Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—12 (14, 14) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first st, *ch 1, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * to last st, sc in last st, turn—5 (6, 6) ch-1 spaces and 7 (8, 8) sc.
Rows 3–26 (28, 28): Ch 1, sc in first st, *ch 1, skip next st, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last st, sc in last st, turn.
Row 27 (29, 29): Ch 1, sc in first st, *ch 1, skip next st, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last st, 2 sc in last st, turn—5 (6, 6) ch-1 spaces and 8 (9, 9) sc.
Row 28 (30, 30): Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, *ch 1, skip next st, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last st, sc in last st, turn.
Additional Material Needed
...
Attach Netting: Cut three 9 x 52” (23 x 132 cm) strips of netting (or desired length and width). Place the strips on top of each other and sew a line of basting stitches about ½” (13 mm) below and parallel to one long edge (top edge). Pull gently on the ends of the basting thread to gather the top of the netting until it fits around the lower edge of the mermaid skirt. Pin the top of the netting just under the lower edge of the skirt and sew in place, sewing from the wrong side. If needed, trim netting to desired length. BOA Note: See Notes at beginning of pattern for how to work with C. With largest hook and C. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch (opening in mesh) from hook, [skip next opening, sc in next opening] 5 times, turn—6 sts.
Row 2: Ch 2, sc in each st across, turn. Repeat last row until boa is desired length. Fasten off. FINISHING Embellishments Note: Select and arrange beads and charms as desired. Sew beads and charms to front of top edge of bra between straps. Sew a bead to the tip of each shell of the waist shell trim. Sew beads evenly spaced around lower edge of crocheted skirt. Sew large sequins evenly spaced over the netted skirt. Weave in ends. Wear the finished mermaid costume over a leotard. If desired, the bra top can be basted to the shoulders and chest of the leotard.

materials: RED HEART® "Super Saver®": 4 1/2 Ounces No. 376 Burgundy
RED HEART® "Super Saver®": 4 Ounces No. 376 Burgundy
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Scarf measures 6" wide x 68" long without fringe.
gauge: 11 stitches = 3"; 16 rows = 4" in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With Burgundy, ch 23.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 3rd ch from hook, * ch 1, skip next ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across; turn.
Row 2: Ch 2, skip first sc, * sc in next ch-1 sp, ch 1, skip next sc; rep from * to last sp; sc in ch-2 sp; turn.
Rep Row 2 for pattern, working 16 rows or 4" of each color until 17 stripes in all have been completed. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Add fringe same as for Knitted Scarf.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 skeins 312 Black A and 1 skein 316 White B
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Hat measures 7” diameter across top x 10” tall (18 x 25.5 cm) after crown is shaped.
gauge: 12 sts = 4” (10 cm); 12 rounds = 4” (10 cm) with 2 strands held together in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com
