Round 10: *Sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st; 
repeat from * 7 times—64 sc.
Round 11: Sc in each st around.
Round 12: *Sc in next 7 sts, 2 sc in next st; 
repeat from * 7 times—72 sc.
Rounds 13–16: Sc in each st around.
Round 17: *Sc in next 7 sts, sc2tog; repeat 
from * 7 times—64 sc.
Rounds 18 and 19: Sc in each st around.
Round 20: *Sc in next 6 sts, sc2tog; repeat 
from * 7 times—56 sc.
Rounds 21–32: Sc in each st around.
Brim
Round 33: *Sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st; 
repeat from * 7 times—64 sc.
Round 34: Sc in each st around.
Round 35: *Sc in next 7 sts, 2 sc in next st; 
repeat from * 7 times—72 sc.
Round 36: Sc in each st around.
Round 37: *Sc in next 8 sts, 2 sc in next st; 
repeat from * 7 times—80 sc.
Round 38: Sc in each st around.
Round 39: *Sc in next 9 sts, 2 sc in next st; 
repeat from * 7 times—88 sc.
Round 40: Sc in each st around. Fasten off.
Band
With A, ch 10.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc 
in each ch across, turn—9 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first st; *change to B, dc in 
next st; change to A, sc in next st; repeat from 
* 3 times, turn.
Row 3: With A, ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Repeat Rows 2 and 3 until band fits around
base of hat near brim, ending with Row 2.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Hat measures 7” diameter across top x 10” 
tall (18 x 25.5 cm) after crown is shaped.
Special Stitch
sc2tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over 
and pull up a loop] twice, yarn over and draw 
through all 3 loops on hook.
Notes
1. Hat is worked in continuous rounds with
right side facing at all times. Place marker 
for beginning of round and move marker up 
as each round is completed.
2. Hat is made with 2 strands of yarn held
together; band is made with one strand.
3. To change color, work last stitch of old
color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new
color and draw through all loops on hook
to complete stitch. Proceed with new color.
Carry color not in use under the working
strand and up wrong side until next
needed.
HAT
Crown and Sides
With 2 strands of A held together, ch 4; join 
with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 8 sc in ring—8 sc. 
Place marker for beginning of round and move 
marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st—16 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat 
from * 7 times—24 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; 
repeat from * 7 times—32 sc.
Round 5: *Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; 
repeat from * 7 times—40 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each st around.
Round 7: *Sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st; 
repeat from * 7 times—48 sc.
Round 8: Sc in each st around.
Round 9: *Sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st; 
repeat from * 7 times—56 sc.
RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 
skeins 312 Black A and 1 skein 
316 White B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 
5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
GAUGE: 12 sts = 4” (10 cm); 
12 rounds = 4” (10 cm) with 2 
strands held together in single 
crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. 
Use any size hook to obtain the 
gauge.
RED HEART® Super 
Saver®, Art. E300 
available in solid color 
7 oz (198 g), 364 yd 
(333 m); multicolor, heather and 
print 5 oz (141 g), 244 yd (223 m), 
flecks 5 oz (141g), 260 yds (238 
m) skeins
Designed by Sharon Mann
What you will need:
Continued...
RHC0136-018923M | LAST UPDATED: AUGUST 1, 2019
CROCHET  
SKILL LEVEL
BEGINNER
SHOP KIT
TOP HAT SOPHISTICATE  | CROCHET    1 of 2
FINISHING
With wrong sides held together, sew the hat 
band seam. Using photograph as a guide, slip 
the band over hat close to brim, placing the 
seam at the back of the crown. Tack band in 
place if desired.
Shape the crown by pushing the center of the 
crown in about 1” (2.5 cm).
Roll up the sides of the brim. Pull the front 
and the back of the brim down for a more 
stylish appearance. With A, tack brim in place 
if desired. 
Weave in ends.
ABBREVIATIONS 
A, B = Color A, Color B; ch = chain; dc = 
double crochet; sc = single crochet; st(s) = 
stitch(es); * = repeat whatever follows the * as 
indicated.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 324 Bright Yellow
Stitch-lock markers, pink ¼” [0.6 cm] diameter craft beads
3” [8 cm] length of 5⁄8” [1.6 cm] sew-on Velcro®, sewing thread to match yarn, sewing needle, yarn needle
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
sc2tog = draw up a loop in next 2 sts, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Bead-picot = ch 1, slide bead up to hook, ch 1, enclosing bead, ch 1, insert hook under front loop and vertical bar of last sc, pull yarn through all loops.
measurements: Crown measures 4” [10 cm] high and will fit up to 20” [50 cm] circumference.
gauge: 13 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 18 rows = 4¼” [11 cm] in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CROWN
Ch 72.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Sc in 2nd ch and each ch across; turn – 71 sc.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 4: Slip st in 26 sc, ch 1, sc2tog in same and next sc, sc in next 18 sc, sc2tog; turn leaving remaining sts unworked – 20 sc.
Rows 5-12: Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sc, sc across to last 2 sc, sc2tog over last 2 sc; turn – 4 sc at end of Row 12.
Row 13: Ch 1, [sc2tog over next 2 sc] twice; turn – 2 sc.
Row 14: Ch 1, sc2tog – 1 sc. Fasten off.
Edging
Place marker in tip of point; starting at marker, place a marker every 1½” [4 cm] along both sides of triangle and along top of band. String beads onto yarn with yarn needle. 
Row 1: With right side facing, join yarn with slip st to first slip st of Row 4, ch 1, * sc evenly to next marker, sc in marked st, bead-picot **; repeat from * to point of triangle, (2 sc, bead-picot, sc) all in point; repeat from * to end of band, end at **; sc to end of band. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Ombres: 2 oz/56.7 g; 95 yds/86 m) Summer Splash Ombre (02743) 7 balls or 590 yds/540 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Hdcbl = Half double crochet in back loop only
Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 indicated spaces. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
Scfl = Single crochet in front loop only
measurements: ONE SIZE TO FIT CHEST MEASUREMENT 12-18 mos 18-19" [45.5-48 cm]
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Mermaid Sack
Note: Mermaid Sack is worked in one piece from waist edge down.
Ch 90. Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next 2 ch. 5 dc in next ch. Skip next 2 ch.** 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * around, ending last rep at **. Join with sl st to first sc. (Center back).

2nd rnd (ridge rnd): Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 scfl in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Working into rem back loop of each st from 2 rnds below, work 2 dc in first sc. *Skip next 2 sts. 1 sc in next st. Skip next 2 sts.** 5 dc in next st. Rep from * around, ending last rep at **. Work 2 dc in same sp as first 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
4th rnd (ridge rnd): Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 scfl in each of next 2 dc. *Insert hook into back loop only of next st of last ridge rnd AT SAME TIME working 1 scfl into next st.** 1 scfl in each of next 5 dc. Rep from * around, ending last rep at **. 1 scfl in each of last 2 dc. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Working into rem back loop of each st from 2 rnds below, *Skip next 2 sts. 5 dc in next st. Skip next 2 sts.** 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around, ending last rep at **. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd (ridge rnd): Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 scfl in each of next 5 dc.** Insert hook into back loop only of next st of last ridge rnd AT SAME TIME working 1 scfl into next st. Rep from * around, ending last rep at **. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep 3rd to 6th rnds for pat until work from beg measures approx 9½" [24.5 cm], ending on a 6th rnd of pat.
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.

Beg Shaping Tail: 1st rnd: Ch 2. Skip first st. Working into rem back loop of each st from 2 rnds below, *1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. Skip next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 75 hdc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 2. *1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *(1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc) 13 times. Hdc2tog over next 2 sps. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 70 sts.
5th and 6th rnds: As 2nd and 3rd rnds.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *(1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc) 12 times. Hdc2tog over next 2 sps. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 65 sts.
8th and 9th rnds: As 2nd and 3rd rnds.
10th rnd: Ch 2. *(1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc) 11 times. Hdc2tog over next 2 sps. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 60 sts.
11th and 12th rnds: As 2nd and 3rd rnds.
Cont in this manner, dec 5 sts evenly around next rnd and following 3rd rnds until 25 sts rem.
Next 2 rnds: Ch 2. *1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Fasten off at end of 2nd rnd. Sew end of Tail closed.

Tailfin: Ch 27. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 26 sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. 3rd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st to last 2 sts. Turn. Leave rem 2 sts unworked. 4th to 15th rows: Rep 2nd and 3rd rows 6 times more. 12 sts rem at end of 15th row. 16th row: Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. 17th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. 18th to 27th rows: Rep 16th and 17th rows 5 times more. 28th row: Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. 26 sts. Fasten off. Gather straight edge of Tailfin to fit end of Tail. Sew Tailfin in position.

Bra Top
Shells (make 2)
Ch 12.
1st row: (RS). Working into horizontal ‘bump’ at back of chain, sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 7 ch. Turn. 11 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdcbl in each of first 7 sts. 1 scbl in each of next 3 sts. Sl st in last st. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sl st in first st. 1 scbl in each of next 3 sts. 1 hdcbl in each of last 7 sts. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 3 times more, then 2nd row once. Do not fasten off.

Edging: Working across base of Shell with WS facing, ch 2. 2 hdc in same sp as last sl st. Work 5 hdc to opposite corner. 2 hdc in corner. Fasten off (first Shell only).
Join Shells: Do not fasten off 2nd Shell. Ch 2. Join with sl st to corner of Edging of first Shell. Sl st back in each of 2 ch. Fasten off. Stitch top corners or Shells tog at center front.
Neck Ties: With RS facing, join yarn at side edge of Shell Edging. Work a chain 17" [43 cm] long. Sl st back into each ch to end of chain. Fasten off. 
Side Ties: With WS of Shell facing, join yarn with sl st in 4th st down from top edge and 2 rows in from outer edge. Work chain as for Neck Ties.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 512 Turqua MC, 316 Soft White A, 312 Black B, 235 Lemon C, 254 Pumpkin D
abbreviations: dec (decrease) = draw up a loop in next 2 sc, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Hat measures 14” (36 cm) in diameter along bottom ribbing. Spats measure 6” (15 cm) long x 4” (10 cm) high at heel. Mittens measure 6½” (17 cm) long x 6” (15 cm) in diameter.
gauge: 14 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 16 rows = 4” [10 cm] in sc.
instructions:
Neckband
Row 1: Ch 14, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 12 ch, skip first sc of hat, slip st in next sc on hat; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, skip slip st, sc in back loops of 13 sc; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in back loops of 13 sc, skip next sc of hat, slip st in next sc on hat; turn.
Rows 4-15: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 six times.
Rows 16-40 (Not attached to hat): Ch 1, sc in back loops of 13 sc; turn.
Row 41: Repeat Row 3.
Rows 42-55: Repeat last 2 rows 7 times.
Row 56: Join to beginning ch by working a row of slip st through both thicknesses. Fasten off.
Eye Back (Make 2)
With MC, make ring.
Round 1: 6 sc in ring. Work in continuous rounds same as for Hat.
Round 2: [Inc] 6 times – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Ch 8, skip next sc, slip st in next sc] 6 times.
On all even numbered rounds, hold ch-loops at front.
Round 4: [3 Sc in skipped sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Round 5: [Ch 8, skip next sc, slip st in next sc] 9 times.
Round 6: [3 Sc in skipped sc, 2 sc in next skipped sc, 3 sc in next skipped sc] 3 times – 24 sc.
Round 7: [Ch 8, skip next sc, slip st in next sc] 12 times.
Round 8: [3 Sc in skipped sc, 2 sc in next skipped sc] 6 times – 30 sc.
Round 9: [Ch 8, skip next sc, slip st in next sc] 15 times.
Round 10: [3 Sc in skipped sc, 2 sc in next skipped sc] 7 times, 3 sc in next skipped sc – 38 sc.
Round 11: [Ch 8, skip next sc, slip st in next sc] 19 times.
HAT
With MC, make ring.
Round 1: 6 Sc in ring. Do not join but work in continuous rounds. Place marker in first st and move up each round.
Round 2: [Inc] 6 times – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Inc, sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Round 4: [Inc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Round 5: [Inc, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times – 30 sc.
Round 6: [Inc, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times – 36 sc.
Round 7: [Inc, sc in next 5 sc] 6 times – 42 sc.
Round 8: [Inc, sc in next 6 sc] 6 times – 48 sc.
Round 9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: [Inc, sc in next 7 sc] 6 times – 54 sc.
Round 11: Repeat Round 9.
Round 12: [Inc, sc in next 8 sc] 6 times – 60 sc.
Rounds 13-14: Repeat Round 9.
Round 15: [Inc, sc in next 9 sc] 6 times – 66 sc.
Rounds 16-24: Repeat Round 9. Continue with Neckband.
YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
RED HEART® Super Saver®, Art. E300 available in solid color 7 oz (198 g), 364 yd (333 m); multi color, heather and print 5 oz (141 g), 244 yd (223 m), flecks 5 oz (141 g), 260 yd (238 m) skeins
Designed by Linda Cyr
What you will need:
RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 512 Turqua MC, 316 Soft White A, 312 Black B, 235 Lemon C, 254 Pumpkin D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9].
Fiberfill, yarn needle.
GAUGE: 14 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 16 rows = 4” [10 cm] in sc. CHECK Continued...
Round 12: [3 sc in skipped sc, 2 sc in next skipped sc] 9 times, 3 sc in next skipped sc – 48 sc. Fasten off.
Eye Front (Make 2)
Work same as for Hat through Round 4 – 24 sc.
Rounds 7-12: Work same as for Eye Back.
Eye Balls (Make 2)
With A, work same as Hat through Round 3 – 18 sc. Slip st in next sc. Fasten off.
Pupil
With B, make ring; 6 sc in ring; slip st in next sc. Fasten off.
Horns (Make 2)
With C, make ring.
Round 1: 5 Sc in ring. Work in continuous rounds as before.
Rounds 2 and 3: Inc, sc in each sc around – 7 sc at end of Round 3.
Rounds 4 and 5: With D, repeat last round twice – 9 sc.
Rounds 6-8: With C, repeat last round 3 times – 12 sc.
Rounds 9-18: Repeat Rounds 4-8 twice more – 22 sc. Fasten off.
SPATS (Make 2)
With MC, ch 12.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 11 sc.
Rows 2-33: Ch 1, sc in back loop of each sc across; turn.
Fold piece in half, lining up beginning and ending edges.
Work a row of slip st through both layers to join and form cuff into a tube.
Upper (Right Side): Ch 1, working around edge of cuff, sc in each row end around; join with a slip st in first sc – 33 sc.
Row 1: Ch 1, 3 sc in first sc, skip next sc, slip st in next sc; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, inc in next 3 sc, skip next sc, slip st in next sc; turn.
Row 3: [Inc, sc in next sc] 3 times, skip next sc, slip st in next sc; turn.
Row 4: [Inc, sc in next 2 sc] 3 times, skip next sc, slip st in next sc; turn.
Row 5: [Inc, sc in next 3 sc] 3 times, skip next sc, slip st in next sc; turn.
Row 6: [Inc, sc in next 4 sc] 3 times, skip next sc, slip st in next sc; turn.
Row 7: [Inc, sc in next 5 sc] 3 times, sc in next 20 sc; do not join but work in continuous rounds – 41 sc. Mark beginning of round.
Round 1: Sc in next 4 sc, [inc, sc in next 3 sc] 4 times, sc in each sc around – 45 sc.
Round 2: Sc in next 6 sc, inc, sc in next 3 sc, inc, sc in next 4 sc, inc, sc in next 3 sc, inc, sc in each sc around – 49 sc.
Round 3: Sc in next 8 sc, inc, sc in next 3 sc, inc, sc in next 5 sc, inc, sc in next 3 sc, inc, sc in each sc around; slip st in next sc – 53 sc. Fasten off.
Toe Claws
With C, make ring.
Round 1: 3 Sc in ring. Mark beginning of round.
Round 2: [Inc] 3 times – 6 sc.
Round 3: [Inc, sc in next sc] 3 times – 9 sc.
Round 4: [Inc, sc in next 2 sc] 3 times – 12 sc.
Round 5: [Inc, sc in next 3 sc] 3 times – 15 sc. Fasten off.
Make another 2 claws in same manner, EXCEPT do not fasten off last claw; fold claw to close the open edge and slip st through both layers across; continue to work slip st across other 2 claws in the same manner. Fasten off.
MITTENS (Make 2)
Row 1: With MC, ch 8; sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn.
Rows 2-20: Ch 1, sc in back loop of each sc across; turn.
Fold piece in half, lining up beginning and ending edges.
Work a row of slip st through both layers to join and form cuff into a tube. Now work in row ends in continuous rounds as follows:
Round 1: [Inc, sc in next 4 rows] 4 times – 24 sc.
Rounds 2-4: Sc in each sc around.
Thumb Opening-Round 5: Ch 5, skip next 5 sc, sc in each sc around.
Round 6: Sc in next 5 ch, sc in each sc around.
Rounds 7-14: Sc in each sc around.
Round 15: [Dec, sc in next 4 sc] 4 times – 20 sc.
Round 16: [Dec, sc in next 3 sc] 4 times – 16 sc.
Round 17: [Dec, sc in next 2 sc] 4 times – 12 sc.
Round 18: [Dec, sc in next sc] 4 times – 8 sc.
Round 19: [Dec] 4 times – 4 sc. Fasten off leaving long yarn tail. Weave yarn through remaining sc and gather to close top. 
Thumb
Round 1: Attach yarn at right edge of thumb opening; work 5 sc across bottom edge of opening, sc in side of opening, 5 sc across top of opening, sc in side of opening – 12 sc.
Rounds 2-6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: [Dec, sc in next sc] 4 times – 8 sc.
Round 8: [Dec] 4 times – 4 sc. Fasten off leaving long yarn tail. Weave yarn through remaining sc and gather to close tip.
Claws
With C, make ring.
Round 1: 4 sc in ring. Mark beginning of round.
Round 2: [Inc, sc in next sc] twice – 6 sc.
Round 3: [Inc, sc in next 2 sc] twice – 8 sc.
Round 4: [Inc, sc in next 3 sc] twice – 10 sc.
Round 5: [Inc, sc in next 4 sc] twice – 12 sc. Fasten off.
Make another 2 claws in same manner, EXCEPT do not fasten off last claw; fold claw to close the open edge and slip st through both layers across; continue to work slip st across other 2 claws in the same manner. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Stuff Horns with fiberfill. Position Horns on sides of Hat and sew in place. Sew Pupils to Eyeballs. Sew Eyeballs to Eye Fronts. With wrong sides together, sew Eye Fronts to Eye Backs ¼ of the way around. Place left and right Eyes together between Horns. Complete sewing Fronts to Backs between Eyes and left to right at centers. Continue attaching Eyes to Hat around bases of Eyes. Attach claws to mittens and spats as shown.
ABBREVIATIONS: A, B, C, D = color A, B, C, D; ch = chain; MC = main color; mm = millimeters; sc = single crochet; st(s) = stitch (es); [] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.

pattern_name: Radiant Defender Crochet Super Hero Mask
materials: Red Heart® Super Glow™ (1.8 oz/50 g; 50 yds/46 m) Glow Worm Green (2003) 1 ball or 50 yds/46 m
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc3tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 3 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Mask measures approx 7½" [19 cm] across and 19" [48 cm] circumference including Band (will stretch to fit). Designed to fit Child 6 to 10 years.
gauge: 20 sc and 23 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
MASK
Eye Opening (make 2)
Ch 25. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1 (does not count as st). 42 hdc into ring. Join with sl st to first hdc. 42 hdc. Fasten off, leaving 6" [15 cm] tail on 2nd eye opening for sewing.
With WS of Eye Openings held tog and sewing through both thicknesses, whipstitch 3 sts together (first and 3rd sts sewn are “joined sts”).
Face
1st rnd: (RS). Join yarn with sl st in first joined st on left eye opening. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. 1 sc in each of next 39 hdc. 1 sc in next joined hdc of same Eye Opening. 1 sc in first joined hdc of 2nd Eye Opening. 1 sc in each of next 39 hdc. 1 sc in last joined hdc. Join with sl st in first sc. 82 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc). 1 hdc in each of next 17 sc. 2 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 2 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. 2 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 2 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in each of last 17 sc. Join with sl st to first hdc (top of ch-2). 92 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 hdc in same st as join. 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 hdc in same st as join. 1 hdc in each of next 19 hdc. (2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc) 4 times. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 27 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. (1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc) 4 times. 1 hdc in each of last 20 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.
Band
With RS facing, PM at middle at each side of Mask.
1st row: Beg at first marker, count back 2 sts and join yarn with sl st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts, removing marker. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep last row until Band measures 11½" [29 cm] or desired length to fit snuggly, ending with a WS row. Fasten off. Being careful not to twist Band, hold last row of Band to opposite side of Mask centered over st marker. Working through both thicknesses, whipstitch Band to secure in place. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ Perfect Phasing™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Contrast A Crimson (43002) 1 ball or 55 yds/50 m
Contrast B Deep Black (43001) 1 ball or 62 yds/57 m
Size U.S. K/10½ [6.5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Hot glue gun and glue sticks
abbreviations: Dsc2tog = Working vertically, draw up a loop in side of next sc. Draw up a loop in next unworked sc of previous round. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Usc2tog = Draw up a loop in next sc. Working vertically, draw up a loop in side of next sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Horn: Approx 5" [12.5 cm] tall x 2½" [6.5 cm] diameter at base. Rose: Approx 3½" [9 cm] in diameter.
gauge: 9 sc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
HORNS
See diagram on page 3.
With B, beg using magic ring method, demonstrated here.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 7 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 21 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 5th row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
6th row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Do not turn.
7th rnd: (WS). Ch 1. (Working vertically, draw up a loop in side of next sc. Draw up a loop in next unworked sc of previous rnd. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – Dsc2tog (downward sc2tog) made. PM on Dsc2tog. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. Draw up a loop in next sc. (Working vertically, draw up a loop in side of next sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – Usc2tog (upward sc2tog) made. Working into rem sts of 6th row, 1 sc in each st to marked st. Join with sl st to marked st. Turn. 17 sts.
8th row: (RS) Ch 1. Skip first st. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Turn.
9th row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in next sc. Dsc2tog. PM on Dsc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Usc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to marked st. Join with sl st to marked st. Turn. 14 sts.
10th row: Ch 1. Skip first st. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
11th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. Dsc2tog. PM on Dsc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Usc2tog. 1 sc in each st to marked st. Join with sl st in marked st. Turn. 10 sts.
12th row: Ch 1. Skip first st. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Turn.
13th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 3 times. Dsc2tog. Sc2tog. Usc2tog. Join with sl st to first st. Turn. 6 sts.
14th and 15th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. 16th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st) twice. Fasten off.
Using hot glue, attach Horns to each side of Headband as shown in photo.
ROSES (make 2).
With A, ch 14.
1st row: (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) all in 3rd ch from hook. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 dc) in each ch to end of ch. Turn.
2nd row: Sl st in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. 5 hdc. 1 sc) in same ch-2 sp. [(1 sc. 5 hdc. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. [(1 hdc. 5 dc. 1 hdc) in next ch-2 sp] 4 times. [(1 dc. 5 tr. 1 dc) in next ch-2 sp] 4 times. Fasten off.
Coil Roses into Rose shape and secure to Headband as shown in photo using hot glue.

materials: RED HEART® Fashion Crochet, size 5: 2 balls 90G Gold/Gold
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Finished Sizes: 15 (17½, 20, 22½)” (38 [44.5, 51, 57] cm) in circumference, blocked. 4” (10 cm) tall (all sizes).
gauge: 28 sts = 4” (10 cm). Height of 6-row pattern repeat = 2¼” (5.5 cm) unblocked. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
CROWN
Ch 9.
Row 1 (wrong side): Dc in 4th ch from hook, ch 2, skip next ch, 3 dc in next ch, ch 2, skip next 2 ch, dc in last ch, turn.
Row 2 (right side): Ch 5 (counts as dc, ch 2 here and throughout), skip next ch-2 space, dc in next dc, ch 2, 3 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, dc in each of last 2 dc, turn.
Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in next dc, ch 2, 3 dc in ch-2 space, ch 2, skip next 2 dc, dc in next dc, ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, dc in next dc, ch 2, skip next 2 ch, dc in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5, turn.
Row 4: Ch 5, skip next ch-2 space, [dc in next dc, ch 2] 3 times, 3 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, dc in each of last 2 dc, turn.
Row 5: Ch 3, dc in next dc, ch 2, 3 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, skip next 2 dc, dc in next dc, [ch 2, dc in next dc] 3 times, ch 2, skip next 2 ch, dc in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5, turn.
Row 6: Ch 5, skip next ch-2 space, [dc in next dc, ch 2] 5 times, 3 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, dc in each of last 2 dc, turn.

Row 7: Ch 3, dc in next dc, ch 2, 3 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, skip next 2 dc, dc in next dc, turn, leaving remaining sts unworked.
Rows 8-36 (42, 48, 54): Repeat Rows 2-7 (4 [5, 6, 7] times; then repeat Rows 2-6 once. Fasten off.

Assembly
Sew last row to bottom of first row to form a tube. Weave in ends.

Top Edging
Round 1: With right side facing, join yarn with a slip st in first row-end dc at the end of Row 1 (on point side of crown), ch 1, *(3 sc, picot) in each of first 5 row-end sts, [3 sc, picot] twice in next ch-5 space, (3 sc, picot) in each of next 5 ch-2 spaces, repeat from * around, join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

Bottom Edging
Attach thread around any dc on the bottom edge of the crown with right side facing.
Round 1: With right side facing, join yarn with a slip st in any row-end dc on straight edge of crown, ch 1, 3 sc in each row-end st around, join with a slip st in first sc – 108 (126, 144, 162) sc.
Round 2: Ch 5, skip next 2 sc, *dc in next sc, ch 2, skip next 2 sc; repeat from * around, join with a slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5 – 36 (42, 48, 54) ch-2 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, *2 sc in next ch-2 space, sc in next dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, join with a slip st in first sc.
Rounds 4-5: Repeat Rounds 2-3.
Rounds 6-7: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

Finishing
Weave in ends. Starch and block crown to the head circumference of the person who will wear the crown. Be sure to measure head at the position where you wish to place the crown.

Note
6-row repeat = Can be stretched from 2½-3” (6.5-7.5 cm). You may vary the size of the crown by how much you stretch out the points during blocking.

materials: Bernat® Softee Cotton™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 254 yds/232 m) Golden (69013) or 1 1 ball
Size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit approx head circumference: Child 18½" [47 cm], Adult 21" [53.5 cm]
gauge: 13 dc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands of yarn held together.
instructions:
The instructions are written for Child size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written Child (Adult). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes.

CROWN
With 2 strands of yarn, ch 64 (72) (multiple of 8 ch). See diagram on page 2.
Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first ch. 64 (72) sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 2. Skip next 3 dc. 5 tr in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 3 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * around omitting sc at end of last rep. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: *2 dc in next tr. Ch 1. (1 dc. Ch 3. Sl st in first of 3 ch – small picot made. 1 dc) all in next tr. Ch 1. (1 tr. Ch 5. Sl st in first of 3 ch – large picot made. 1 tr) all in next tr. Ch 1. (1 dc. Small picot. 1 dc) all in next tr. Ch 1. 2 dc in next tr. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 624 Tea Leaf A, 235 Lemon B, 706 Perfect Pink C, and 724 Baby Pink D.
abbreviations: A, B, C, D = color A, B, C, D
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: One size fits ages 2 to 6.
gauge: 6 sts = 1½”; 2 rounds = 1¼” in dc measured on base of hat. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Hat Base
Round 1: With B ch 5; join with a slip st to form a ring; ch 3, 11 dc in ring; join with a slip st in top of ch-3 – 12 sts.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same st as joining, 2 dc in each dc around; join in top of ch-3 – 24 sts.
Round 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in next dc, [dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc] 11 times; join – 36 sts.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, [dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc] 11 times; join – 48 sts.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc, [dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in next dc] 11 times; join – 60 sts. Fasten off.
Leaf (Make 2)
Row 1 (Right Side): With A ch 12; slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, (slip st, ch 2, 2 dc) all in next ch, dc in next 2 ch, hdc in next 3 ch, 3 sc in last ch, working on opposite side of ch, hdc in next 3 ch, dc in next 2 ch, 3 dc in next ch; turn.
Row 2: Ch 2, 2 dc in first dc, dc in next 4 sts, hdc in next 3 sts, sc in next st, 3 sc in next st, sc in next st, hdc in next 3 sts, dc in next 4 sts, (2 dc, hdc) in top of ch-2; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next 11 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 10 sts, skip next st, slip st in last st. Fasten off.
Flower for Hat (Outside petals)
Row 1 (Right Side): With C ch 36; sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 35 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, * (sc, ch 7, sc) all in next sc **, sc in next 3 sc, repeat from * to last 2 sc, end at **; sc in last 2 sc; turn – 9 petals.
Row 3: Ch 1, skip first 2 sc, * (2 dc, 10 tr, 2 dc) in next ch-7 loop **, skip next 2 sc, sc next sc, skip next 2 sc; repeat from * to last sc, end at **; slip st in last sc. Fasten off. Sew ends of rows together to form a circle.
Inside Petals
Row 1: With D ch 22; sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 21 sc.
Row 2 (Right Side): Ch 1, working in back loops only across, * slip st in next sc, ch 1, (hdc, dc, tr) in next sc, (tr, dc, hdc) in next sc, ch 1; repeat from * across; slip st in same sc as last hdc; do NOT turn. Fasten off.
Row 3: With right side facing, join D in first front loop unworked on Row 2; working in front loops only across, ch 1, [(sc, hdc, dc) in next sc, (dc, hdc, sc) in next sc, slip st in next sc] 7 times. Fasten off. Sew ends of rows together to form a circle.
Vine (Make 3)
With A ch 25; 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. Fasten off.
Hat Finishing
Weave in ends. Sew leaves and vines in place to hat base and then assemble flower and sew in place.
Ties (Optional)
Attach A to a st on last round of Hat Base; ch 75; slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. Fasten off. Repeat tie on opposite side of base.
Collar
Row 1 (Right Side): With A ch 41; sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 40 sc.
Row 2: Ch 3, dc in first sc, 2 dc in each sc across; turn – 80 sts.
Vines-Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 5 dc, [ch 15, 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 13 ch, sc in next 5 dc] 15 times working last sc in top of ch-3. Fasten off.
Collar Tie
With A ch 60, with right side facing, sc across remaining loops of beginning ch of collar, ch 60. Fasten off.
Small Flowers (Make 2 each in B, C and D)
Round 1: Ch 5; join with a slip st to form a ring; ch 3, 11 dc in ring; join with a slip st to front loop of ch-3 – 12 sts.
Round 2: Ch 1, working in front loops only, 3 hdc in same st as joining, slip st in next dc, [3 hdc in next dc, slip st in next dc] 5 times.
Round 3: Ch 1, working in back loops only, slip st in first st, 4 dc in next dc, [slip st in next dc, 4 dc in next dc] 5 times; slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.
Center Flower
Round 1: With B ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join but work in continuous rounds. Mark first st of round and move marker up each round.
Round 2: 2 Sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Round 4: Working in front loops only, sc in each sc around.
Round 5: [(Sc, dc) in next sc] 18 times; slip st in first sc – 36 sts. Fasten off.
Round 6: Join C in first back loop on Round 4; ch 1, 2 sc in each back loop around – 36 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next sc, ch 1, skip next sc, 5 dc in next sc, ch 1, skip next sc] 9 times; join in first sc. Fasten off.
Stem (Make 2)
With A ch 31; sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 4 ch, [ch 5, sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch, hdc in last ch, working on original ch again, sc in next 5 ch] 5 times. Fasten off.
Collar Finishing
Weave in ends. With wrong sides together sew 2 stems together so that there are matching leaves on each side as shown. Sew Center Flower to top of stem and then to center front collar. Sew 3 small flowers in 3 different colors to collar on each side of Center Flower, evenly spaced.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 324 Bright Yellow A, 256 Carrot B, 312 Black C, and 316 Soft White D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5.5mm [US I-9] and 6.5mm [US K-10.5]
Yarn needle, two 1” (25.4 mm) buttons, one 11⁄8” (28.6 mm) Buckle (Dritz brand, #150-35 shown), stitch markers, 8 D-rings ¾” (1.9 cm) (Dritz brand, #117-34-35 shown)
abbreviations: A, B, C = Yarn A, B, and C
gauge: 12 sts = 4” (10 cm); 8 rows = 3” (7.6 cm) in dc
instructions:
Edging
Round 1: With right side still facing, ch 1, work sc evenly around entire cape, taking care to keep work flat and working (sc, ch 1, sc) in each out-facing corner; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Round 2: Join C in any sc; ch 1, sc in each sc around and work 3 sc in each corner ch-1 space; join. Fasten off.
Round 3: Join B in any sc; slip st in each sc around; join. Fasten off.
Finishing
With A and needle, sew buttons to the center of the WRONG SIDE of Row 54 on each shoulder of cape. Buttons will not be visible when fastened onto tunic. Buttons insert into buttonholes on tunic.
TUNIC
Notes
1. Work over contrasting color when it is not in use only in the multi-colored section. Do not carry C into the D section.
2. Change colors as required, working last sc before color change until 2 loops remain on hook, drop color in use, pick up next color to be used and draw through 2 loops on hook.
3. All sts are worked in the FRONT LOOP only.
With larger hook and C, ch 31 (31, 37, 37).
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 30 (30, 36, 36) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in front loops throughout, 3 C sc, [3 D sc, 3 C sc] twice, 15 (15, 21, 21) D sc; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, 15 (15, 21, 21) D sc, 3 C sc, [3 D sc, 3 C sc] twice; turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, [3 D sc, 3 C sc] 2 (2, 3, 3) times, 18 D sc; turn.
Directions are for Size 2; changes for Sizes 4, 6, and 8 are in parentheses.
CAPE
With larger hook and A, ch 56 (59, 62, 65).
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 55 (58, 61, 64) sc. Now work in front loops only throughout.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc to last 2 sc, sc2tog; turn – 53 (56, 59, 62) sc.
Rows 4-6: Repeat Row 2.
Row 7: Repeat Row 3 – 51 (54, 57, 60) sc.
Rows 8-43: Repeat Rows 4-7, 9 times – 33 (36, 39, 42) sc.
Row 44: Repeat Row 2.
Row 45: Repeat Row 3 – 31 (34, 37, 40) sc.
Row 46: Repeat Row 2.
Row 47: Repeat Row 3 – 29 (32, 35, 38) sc.
Row 48: Repeat Row 2.
Divide for Neck-Right Shoulder
Row 49: Ch 1, sc in first 6 sc; TURN – 6 sc.
Rows 50-55: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Fasten off at end of Row 55.
Left Shoulder
Row 49: With right side facing, skip center 17 (20, 23, 26) sc, join yarn in front loop of next sc; ch 1, sc in same sc and in each sc to end; turn – 6 sc.
Rows 50-55: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Do NOT fasten off at end of Row 55, but pivot to work Edging.
RED HEART® Super Saver®, Art. E300 available in solid color 7 oz (198 g), 364 yd (333 m); multicolor, heather and print 5 oz (141 g), 244 yd (223 m), flecks 5 oz (141 g), 260 yds (238 m) skeins.
With tail and yarn needle, pinch the gauntlet flat at the elbow edge; sew 2 or 3 stitches together to form a 'point'. Sew more or less for best fit.
GAUNTLETS (Make 2)
Sizes 2 (4) use smaller hook,
Sizes (6, 8) use larger hook.
With B, ch 20; join with a slip st in first ch to form a ring, taking care not to twist.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in next 20 ch; do not join but work in continuous rounds. Place a marker in the first st of round and move marker up each round.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Thumb Opening-Round 3: Ch 5, (move first marker to first ch) skip first sc, sc in 19 sc.
Round 4: 5 Sc in ch-5 space, sc in next 19 sc – 24 sc.
Round 5: Sc in each sc around.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 4 times – 20 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 4 times – 16 sc.
Rounds 8-9: Sc in each sc around.
Rounds 10-17: 2 Sc in first sc, sc in each sc around – 24 sc at end of Round 17.
Round 18: [Sc in next sc, ch 2, skip next 2 sc] 8 times.
Round 19: 2 Sc in first sc, sc in each sc and ch around – 25 sc.
Rounds 20-21: 2 Sc in first sc, sc in each sc around – 27 sc. Fasten off leaving a 6” (18 cm) tail.
GAUNTLET STRAP
With smaller hook and A, ch 33; sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. Fasten off leaving 6” (15 cm) tail. With tail and yarn needle, sew two D-rings held together on one end of the strap. Weave strap into the ch-2 spaces of Round 18 of gauntlet.
LEG ARMOR (Make 2)
Sizes 2 (4) use smaller hook.
Sizes (6, 8) use larger hook.
With B, ch 17.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 16 sc.
Rows 2-4: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc to last 2 sc, sc2tog; turn – 10 sc at end of Row 4.
Rows 5-6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Rows 7-9: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc to last sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn – 16 sc.
Rows 10-19: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 20: Ch 1, sc in first sc, [ch 2, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc] 5 times; turn.
Row 21: Ch 1, sc in each sc and ch across; turn – 16 sc.
Rows 22-23: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Do not fasten off at end of Row 23 but pivot to work edging.
Edging
With right side still facing, ch 1, sc evenly around all 4 sides, working 3 sc in corners; join in first sc. Fasten off.
Leg Armor Strap
With smaller hook and A, ch 33; sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. Fasten off leaving 6” (18 cm) tail. With tail and yarn needle, sew two D-rings held together on one end of the strap. Weave strap into the ch-2 spaces of Row 20.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 722 Pretty ‘n Pink A, 356 Amethyst B, and 324 Bright Yellow C
Yarn needle, sewing needle and matching thread, straight pins (if needed)
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Cape measures 19 (19½, 20, 21)” [48.5 (49.5, 51, 53.5 cm] wide across lower edge x 11, 12, 14, 15½” [28 (30.5, 35.5, 39.5) cm] long, including tabs. Headband measures 16 (18, 20, 20)” [40.5 (45.5, 51, 51) cm] circumference. Belt measures approximately 21 (21½, 22½, 23½)” [53.5 (54.5, 56, 59.5) cm] circumference. Legwarmer measures 8” (20.5cm) circumference x 11½ (12½, 13, 15)” [29 (32, 33, 38) cm] long.
gauge: 14 sts = 4” (10cm) in pattern; 10 rows in hdc = 4” (10cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com ©2013 Coats & Clark RedHeart.com Page 1 of 3 Caped Heroine with Leg Warmers She may be wearing pink, but she’ll feel as powerful as an action heroine in this crocheted costume set. We’ve included a cape, headband, cuffs, belt, stars and legwarmers for a complete superhero ensemble. 5. To change color, work last stitch of old color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new color and draw through all loops on hook to complete stitch. Proceed with new color. Fasten off old color. CAPE Note Work color sequence as follows: 7 (8, 9, 10) rows with A, 6 (6, 7, 9) rows with B, 7 (8, 9, 10) rows with A. With A, ch 56 (59, 61, 64). Row 1: Hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch across, turn—55 (58, 60, 63) hdc. Rows 2-4 (4, 8, 12): Ch 2, hdc in each st, turn. Row 5 (5, 9, 13) (decrease row): Ch 2, hdc in first st, hdc2tog, hdc in each st to last 3 sts, hdc2tog, hdc in last st, turn—53, (56, 58, 61) hdc. Size 2 only Rows 6-19: Repeat Row 5—25 hdc. Size 4 only Row 6: Ch 2, hdc in each st, turn. Row 7: Repeat Row 5—54 hdc. Row 8: Ch 2, hdc in each st, turn. Rows 9-21: Repeat Row 5—28 hdc. Size 6 only Row 10: Ch 2, hdc in each st, turn. Rows 11-24: Repeat Row 9—30 hdc. Size 8 only Row 14: Ch 2, hdc in each st, turn. Rows 15-28: Repeat Row 13—33 hdc. All sizes Row 20 (22, 25, 29): Ch 2, hdc in each st; change to B, turn. Directions are for size 2. Changes for sizes 4, 6, and 8 are in parentheses Cape measures 19 (19½, 20, 21”) [48.5 (49.5, 51, 53.5 cm] wide across lower edge x 11, 12, 14, 15½” [28 (30.5, 35.5, 39.5) cm] long, including tabs. Headband measures 16 (18, 20, 20)” [40.5 (45.5, 51, 51) cm] circumference. Belt measures approximately 21 (21½, 22½, 23½)” [53.5 (54.5, 56, 59.5) cm] circumference. Legwarmer measures 8” (20.5cm) circumference x 11½ (12½, 13, 15)” [29 (32, 33, 38) cm] long. Special Stitches hdc2tog = [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop] 2 times, yarn over and draw through all 5 loops on hook. sc2tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook. Notes 1. In cape and legwarmers, beginning ch-2 does not count as a half double crochet. Do not work last stitch into beginning ch-2. 2. Cape, headband, belt, and cuffs are worked in rows; star is worked in joined rounds in any desired colors. 3. Ribbing of legwarmers is made in rows then leg continues in joined rounds. Ties are optional. 4. Cape is worked in varying bands of 2 colors; be sure to work in correct color sequence for your size. pattern; 10 rows in hdc = 4” (10cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge. RED HEART® Super Saver®, Art. RHC0336-019946M | LAST UPDATED: AUGUST 1, 2019 CROCHET SKILL LEVEL EASY SHOP KIT CAPED HEROINE WITH LEG WARMERS | CROCHET 1 of 3 Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com ©2013 Coats & Clark RedHeart.com Page 2 of 3 Continued... First Tab Row 1: Ch 2, hdc in first 8 (9, 10, 11) sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—8 (9, 10, 11) hdc. Rows 2-6 (6, 8, 8): Ch 2, hdc in each st, turn. Fasten off B at end of Row 6 (6, 8, 8). Second Tab Holding cape with first tab to your right, skip next 9 (10, 10, 11) stitches and join B with slip st in next st. Row 1: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining and in each remaining st, turn—8 (9, 10, 11) hdc. Rows 2-6 (6, 8, 8): Ch 2, hdc in each st; change to C, turn. Edging Ch 36, slip st in each ch (neck tie made), sc in each st of last row of second tab; working across ends of rows, sc evenly down outer side of second tab and cape to Row 1; working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each ch; working across ends of rows, sc evenly up opposite side of cape and outer side of first tab to last row of first tab, sc in each st of last row; ch 36, slip st in each ch (neck tie made); working across ends of rows, sc evenly across inner side of first tab to last row of cape, sc in each unworked st of last row; working across ends of rows, sc evenly up inner side of second tab to last row; join with slip st in first st. Fasten off. HEADBAND With C, ch 8. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch, turn—7 sc. Rows 2-24 (28, 30, 30): Ch 1, sc in each st, turn. Row 25 (29, 31, 31): Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each st, turn—8 sc. Row 26 (30, 32, 32): Ch 1, sc in each st, turn. Rows 27-32 (31-36, 33-38, 33-38): Repeat last 2 rows 3 times—11 sc. Row 33 (37, 39, 39): Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st, turn—10 sc. Row 34 (38, 40, 40): Ch 1, sc in each st, turn. Rows 35-40 (39-44, 41-46, 41-46): Repeat last 2 rows 3 times—8 sc. Rows 41-65 (45-73, 47-77, 47-77): Ch 1, sc in each st, turn. Last Row: With wrong sides of Row 1 and Row 65 (73, 77, 77) together and working through both thicknesses, slip st in each st. Fasten off. Edging Join B in any st in back of headband along top edge, working across ends of rows, sc evenly spaced around; join with slip st in first st. Fasten off. Repeat for bottom edge. BELT With B, ch 9. Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch and each ch across, turn—8 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st; change to A, turn. Rows 3 and 4: Repeat Row 2; change to B at end of Row 4. Rows 5 and 6: Repeat Row 2; change to A at end of Row 6. Rows 7-66 (70, 74, 78): Repeat Rows 2-6 fifteen [sixteen, seventeen, eighteen] times; change to C at end of last row. First Front Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in each st, turn. Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in each st to last st, 2 sc in last st, turn—10 sc. Row 3: Repeat Row 1. Row 4: Repeat Row 2—12 sc. Rows 5-8: Repeat Rows 1 and 2 two more times—16 sc. Fasten off. Second Front With wrong side of belt facing, join C with sc in first set of loops of foundation ch. Row 1: Working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each ch, turn—8 sc. Repeat Rows 2-8 of first front but do not fasten off at end of Row 8. Edging Ch 1, *working across ends of rows, sc evenly spaced to next corner, (sc, ch 1, sc) in next corner, sc in each st of row to next corner, (sc, ch 1, sc) in next corner; repeat from * once; join with slip st in first st. Fasten off. Ties *Join B to any corner ch-1 space, ch 20, slip st in each ch. Fasten off. Repeat from * 3 times. Join A to center st of first front edge, ch 20, slip st in each ch; repeat for second front edge. Fasten off. LEGWARMER (make 2) Bottom ribbing With B, ch 8. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—7 sc. Row 2: Working in back loops only, sc in each st. Repeat last row 15 (17, 19, 21) times. Joining Row: Holding wrong sides of first and last rows together, ch 1, working through back loops only of both thicknesses, slip st in each st, turn. Leg Pivot ribbing so ends of rows are facing. Round 1: Ch 1, working across ends of rows, work 24 sc evenly spaced; join with slip st to first st—24 sc. Round 2: Ch 2, hdc in each st; join with slip st to first st—24 hdc. Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each st; join with slip st to first st; change to A. Rounds 4 and 5: Ch 2, hdc in each st; join with slip st to first st; change to B. Rounds 6 and 7: Ch 2, hdc in each st; join with slip st to first st; change to A. Sizes 2, 6, and 8 only Rounds 8-19 (23, 27): Repeat Rounds 4-7 three [four, five] times. Rounds 20 and 21 (24 and 25, 28 and 29): Repeat Rounds 4 and 5 once. Size 4 only Rounds 8-23: Repeat Rounds 4-7 four times. All sizes Round 22 (24, 26, 30): With B, ch 3 (counts as first dc), dc in each st around; join with slip st to top of beginning ch-3. Round 23 (25, 27, 31): Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st to first st. Round 24 (26, 28, 32): Ch 1, (sc, ch 3) in each st; join with slip st to first st. Fasten off. Tie (make 2 – optional) With A, ch 61, slip st in 2nd ch and each ch. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Weave through Round 22 (24, 26, 30). CUFFS (make 2) With C, ch 7 (9, 11, 13). Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch and each ch, turn—6 (8, 10, 12) sc. Rows 2-8 (8, 9, 9): Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st, turn. Rows 9-20 (9-20, 10-22, 10-22): Ch 1, sc in each st, turn. Holding first and last rows with wrong sides together, slip st through back loops only of Row 1 and both loops of last row. Fasten off. STAR (make 2 in any color or as many as needed) Leaving long tail for sewing, ch 2. Round 1: Work 5 sc in first ch; join with slip st to first st—5 sc. Rounds 2 and 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st; join with slip st to first st—20 sc at end of Round 3. Note Points of star are made from rows worked within Round 4. Round 4: *Sc in next 4 st (first row made), turn; ch 1, sc2tog twice (2nd row made), turn; ch 1, sc2tog, do not turn; ch 1, working in ends of rows, slip st in each row, slip st in base of 4th st of first row; repeat from * 4 times; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing. Note: If sewing to a t-shirt, weave in ends. FINISHING Block cape lightly, if needed. Center star on B-colored band on cape; with beginning tail, backstitch center of star first, then sew points with end tail. Sew to center of headband, if desired, in same manner as cape. Weave in all ends. If using on a t-shirt, pin stars in desired location and sew down using matching thread.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®, Art. E300
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Cape measures 19 (19½, 20, 21)” [48.5 (49.5, 51, 53.5 cm] wide across lower edge x 11, 12, 14, 15½” [28 (30.5, 35.5, 39.5) cm] long, including tabs. Mask measures 16 (18, 20, 20)” [40.5 (45.5, 51, 51) cm] circumference.
gauge: 10 rows in hdc = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CAPE
With A, ch 56 (59, 61, 64).
Row 1: Hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch across, turn—55 (58, 60, 63) hdc.
Rows 2-4 (4, 8, 12): Ch 2, hdc in each st, turn.
Row 5 (5, 9, 13) (decrease row): Ch 2, hdc in first st, hdc2tog, hdc in each st to last 3 sts, hdc2tog, hdc in last st, turn—53, (56, 58, 61) hdc.
1. In the cape, beginning ch-2 does not count as a half double crochet. Do not work last stitch into beginning ch-2.
2. Eye openings and face of the mask and the star are worked in joined rounds with right side facing. Band of mask is worked in turned rows.
3. Star is made in your choice of color.
4. To change color, work last stitch of old color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new color and draw through all loops on hook to complete stitch. Proceed with new color. Fasten off old color.

Size 2 only
Rows 6-19: Repeat Row 5—25 hdc.

Size 4 only
Row 6: Ch 2, hdc in each st, turn.
Row 7: Repeat Row 5—54 hdc.
Row 8: Ch 2, hdc in each st, turn.
Rows 9-21: Repeat Row 5—28 hdc.

Size 6 only
Row 10: Ch 2, hdc in each st, turn.
Rows 11-24: Repeat Row 9—30 hdc.

Size 8 only:
Row 14: Ch 2, hdc in each st, turn.
Rows 15-28: Repeat Row 13—33 hdc.

All sizes:
Row 20 (22, 25, 29): Ch 2, hdc in each st; change to B, turn.

First Tab
Row 1: Ch 2, hdc in first 8 (9, 10, 11) sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—8 (9, 10, 11) hdc.
Rows 2-6 (6, 8, 8): Ch 2, hdc in each st, turn. Fasten off B at end of Row 6 (6, 8, 8).

Second Tab
Holding cape with first tab to your right, skip next 9 (10, 10, 11) stitches and join B with slip st in next st.
Row 1: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining and in each remaining st, turn—8 (9, 10, 11) hdc.
Rows 2-6 (6, 8, 8): Ch 2, hdc in each st, turn. Do not fasten off at end of Row 6 (6, 8, 8).

Edging
Ch 36, slip st in each ch (neck tie made), sc in each st of last row of second tab; working across ends of rows, sc evenly down outer side of second tab and cape to Row 1; working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each ch; working across ends of rows, sc evenly up opposite side of cape and outer side of first tab to last row of first tab, sc in each st of last row; ch 36, slip st in each ch (neck tie made); working across ends of rows, sc evenly across inner side of first tab to last row of cape, sc in each unworked st of last row; working across ends of rows, sc evenly up inner side of second tab to last row; join with slip st in first st. Fasten off.

MASK
Eye Opening (make 2) With B, ch 15; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1 (does not count as a st), work 25 hdc into ring; join with slip st to first hdc—25 hdc. Fasten off, leaving 6” (15 cm) tail on 2nd eye opening for sewing.
With wrong sides of eye openings held together and sewing through both thicknesses, whipstitch 3 sts together (the first and 3rd stitches sewn are “joined sts”).
Face Round 1: With right side facing, join B with sc in first joined st on left eye opening (if you are right-handed; right eye opening if you are left-handed), sc in next 22 st, sc in next joined st of same eye opening, sc in first joined st of 2nd eye opening, sc in next 22 st, sc in last joined st; join with slip st in first st—48 sc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc), hdc in next 10 sts, 2 hdc in next st, place marker in first hdc made of 2 hdc, 2 hdc in next st, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 9 sts, sc in next 2 st, sc in next 9 sts, 2 sc in next st, 2 hdc in each of next 2 sts, place marker in last hdc made, hdc in last 11 sts; join with slip st to beginning ch-2; change to A. Note: Move markers up in Round 3.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining and in each st; join with slip st to first st. Fasten off. 
Band With right side facing, join A with sc at first marked hdc.
Row 1: Sc in next 3 hdc, turn—4 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st, turn.
Repeat last row until band measures 8 (10, 12, 12)” [20.5 (25.5, 30.5, 30.5) cm] or desired length, ending with a wrong side row. Do not fasten off. Being careful not to twist band, with wrong sides together, hold last row of band to opposite side of mask with first st of band at 2nd marked st; working through both thicknesses, join with slip st through 4 st of band. Fasten off.

CUFFS (make 2)
With C, ch 7 (9, 11, 13).
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch and each ch, turn—6 (8, 10, 12) sc.
Rows 2-8 (8, 9, 9): Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st, turn.
Rows 9-20 (9-20, 10-22, 10-22): Ch 1, sc in each st, turn. 
Hold first and last rows with wrong sides together, working through both thicknesses, slip st in each st. Fasten off. 

STAR
Notes: If star is to be sewn to cape, leave long beginning and end tails. If sewing to a t-shirt as shown, weave in all ends. With desired color, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 5 sc in first ch; join with slip st to first st—5 sc. 
Rounds 2 and 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st; join with slip st to first st—20 sc at end of Round 3. 
Note: Points of star are made from rows worked within Round 4.
Round 4: *Sc in next 4 st (first row made), turn; ch 1, sc2tog twice (2nd row made), turn; ch 1, sc2tog, do not turn; ch 1, working in ends of rows, slip st in each row, slip st in base of 4th st of first row; repeat from * 4 times; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Block cape lightly, if needed. If star is sewn to cape, with beginning tail, backstitch center of star first, then sew points with end tail. Weave in all ends. If sewing to a t-shirt, pin down stars in desired location. Using matching thread sew star to t-shirt.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 skeins 321 Gold.
Stitch markers, yarn needle, 1” [2.5 cm] diameter shank button, sewing needle, thread to match yarn.
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Cape neck circumference 17” [43 cm]; length 34” [86 cm].
gauge: 14 sts = 4½” [11 cm]; 11 rows = 8” [20 cm] in dc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Round 1: With right side facing join yarn to marked dc on bottom edge of cape; ch 1, sc in same dc and next dc, 3 sc in last dc, 2 dc in next 19 row ends, 3 sc in next 6 row ends, 2 sc in next 20 row ends, 3 sc in next ch, [sc in each ch to next marker, 2 dc in marked ch] 3 times, sc in each ch to last ch, 3 sc in last ch, 2 sc in next 20 row ends, 3 sc in next 6 row ends, 2 sc in next 19 row ends, 3 sc in top of next dc, sc in each st across bottom edge of cape; join with a slip st to first sc – 360 sts.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same sc as joining, ch 2, skip next 2 sc, **(sc, ch 5, sc) in corner sc, * ch 2, skip next 2 sc ***, sc in next sc, ch 3, skip 2 next sc ****, sc in next sc; repeat from * to next corner, end at ***; repeat from ** around, end at ****; join; turn – 124 ch-spaces.
Round 3 (Wrong Side): Slip st in next 3-ch space, ch 2, (2dc-cl, ch 3, 3dc-cl) in 3-ch space, * skip next ch-2 space, (3dc-cl, ch 3, 3dc-cl) in next 3-ch space; repeat from * to next corner, ([3dc-cl, ch 3] twice, 3 dc-cl) all in corner 5-ch space; repeat from * around; join to first 2dc-cl; turn – 132 dc-cl.
Round 4 (Right Side): Slip st in next 3dc-cl, * ([sc, ch 2] 4 times, sc) all in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around; join. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. With sewing needle and thread to match yarn, sew button to wrong side of fabric at end of Row 6 of cape, opposite button loop.
Special Abbreviations
dc2tog (worked over 2 sts) = [Yo and draw up a loop in next st, yo and draw through 2 loops] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
2dc-cl = [Yo and draw up a loop, yo and draw through 2 loops] twice in space, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
3dc-cl = [Yo and draw up a loop, yo and draw through 2 loops] 3 times in space, yo and draw through all 4 loops on hook.
CAPE
Ch 61.
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 4th ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 59 sts. Place marker in the center (30th) dc and move up each row.
Rows 2-5: Ch 2, dc2tog over first 2 dc, dc in each st to marked dc, dc2tog over marked dc and next dc, dc to last 2 sts; dc2tog; turn – 47 dc at end of Row 5.
Row 6: Ch 3, skip first dc, dc in each dc to last dc; yo and draw up a loop in last dc, yo and draw through 2 loops, [yo] 3 times and draw up a loop in the same dc, [yo and draw through 2 loops] 3 times, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook; turn – 47 dc. The dtr part of the last st forms the button loop.
Rows 7-23: Ch 3, dc in first dc (Increase made) and each dc to marked dc, 2 dc in marked dc, dc in each dc to last dc, 2 dc in last dc; turn – 98 dc. Remove marker.
Rows 23-45: Ch 3, skip first dc, dc in each dc across; turn. Fasten off at end of Row 45. Place markers in 96th dc of Row 45 and in foundation ch 15, 30, and 45.
Edging
Note: Do not work around the dtr portion of the ddc-dtr st at end of Row 6, but work around the dc portion.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 Skein each No. 0312 Black CA, No. 0932 Zebra CB and No. 0320 Cornmeal CC
abbreviations: CA, CB, etc = Color A, Color B, etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: To Fit Chest: 18 (23, 28)”. To Fit Neck: 16 (18, 20)”. To Fit Length: 10 (12, 16)”.
gauge: 12 sts = 4”; Rows 1-9 = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: BODY: With CA, ch 50 (65, 74). Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 3rd chain from hook, * skip next ch, 2 dc in next ch; rep from * to last 1 (0, 1) ch; dc in last 1 (0, 1) ch; turn – 48 (63, 72) sts. Row 2: With CB, ch 1, sc in first 2 dc; * [yo and draw up a lp, yo and draw through 2 lps] twice all in next dc, yo and draw through 3 lps on hook – dc cl made; sc in next 2 dc; rep from * to last dc; sc in last dc; turn. Row 3: With CC, ch 1, sc in each st across; turn. Row 4: With CC, ch 2, dc in first sc, * skip next sc, 2 dc in next sc; rep from * to last sc; dc in last sc; turn. Row 5: With CC, ch 1, sc in each dc across; turn. Row 6: With CA, ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Row 7: With CA, rep Row 4. Row 8: With CB, rep Row 2. Rows 9-18 (9-24, 9-30): Rep Rows 3-8 one (2, 3) more times, then rep Rows 3-6 once more. Fasten off. Row 19 (25, 31): With right side facing, skip first 6 (9, 12) sc, join CA in next sc; ch 2, dc in same sc, [skip next sc, 2 dc in next sc] 17 (22, 23) times, dc in next 1 (0, 1) sc; turn – 36 (45, 48) dc. Row 20 (26, 32): Ch 1, sc in each dc across. Fasten off. NECKBAND-Right Side-Row 1: With right side facing, join CC in first sc of last long row; ch 1, sc in 8 (10, 10) sc; turn. Rows 2-12 (2-12, 2-16): Work in sc, working 3 more rows with CC, then 4 rows CA, then 4 rows CC, then 0 (0, 4) rows CA. Buttonhole Row 13 (13, 17): Ch 1, sc in first sc, [ch 2, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 1 (2, 2) sc] twice, sc in last sc; turn. Row 14 (14, 18): Ch 1, sc in first sc, [2 sc in sp, sc in next 1 (2, 2) sc] twice, sc in last sc. Fasten off. Neckband-Left Side-Row 1: With right side facing, skip center 20 (25, 28) sc of last long row, join CC in next sc; ch 1, sc in last 8 (10, 10) sc; turn. Rows 2-12 (2-12, 2-16): Work in sc and work 3 more rows with CC, then 4 rows CA, then 4 rows CC, then 0 (0, 4) rows CA. Fasten off. Neck Edging: With right side facing, join CB to Right Neckband; ch 1, sc evenly around entire neck edge. Fasten off. Sew buttons to Left Neckband to correspond to buttonholes. Sew body seam. WINGS (Make 2): With CC, ch 4; join with a sl st to form a ring. Rnd 1: 6 Sc in ring; do not join but work in continuous rnds. Rnd 2: 2 Sc in each sc around – 12 sc. Rnd 3: [Sc in sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc. Rnd 4: [Sc in 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; TURN – 24 sc. Shape Bottom of Wing-Row 5: Ch 1, skip first sc, [sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next st] 4 times, sc in next 3 sc; turn – 23 sc. Row 6: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in each sc to end; turn – 22 sc. Row 7: Ch 2, dc in first 4 sc, [2 dc in next sc, dc in next 5 sc] 3 times; turn – 25 sc. Size Small Only: Turn to work 12 sc evenly across bottom of wing. Fasten off. Medium and Large-Row 8: Ch 2, hdc in first 6 dc, 2 hdc in next dc, [hdc in next 2 dc, 2 hdc in next dc] 4 times, hdc in last 6 dc – 30 hdc. Turn to work (14, 14) sc evenly across bottom of wing. Fasten off. With wrong sides together, sew the bottoms of the 2 wings together. Weave a chenille stem through the sts of Row 7 or 8 on each wing. Trim and bend the tips of the chenille stems over at each end to secure in place. Sew the bottom edge of the wings to the center top of the sweater, 1” down from the neck edging. HEAD BAND: With CC, ch 11. Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd chain from hook, sc in each ch across; turn – 10 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. (10 sts) Rows 3-12 (3-12, 3-16): Rep Row 2 working 2 more rows CC, then 4 rows CA, then 4 rows CC, then 0 (0, 4) rows CA. Fasten off. Head Band Ear Flaps-First Half-Row 1: With right side facing, join CA to either end of head band; ch 1, sc in first 4 sc; turn. Rows 2-10: Ch 1, sc to end; turn. Fasten off at end of Row 10. Ear Flaps-2nd Half-Row 1: With right side facing, skip next 2 sc on same end of headband, join CA in next sc; ch 1, sc in last 4 sc; turn. Rows 2-10: Ch 1, sc to end; turn. Join Flaps-Row 11: Ch 1, sc in next 4 sc, bring First Half around and sc in each of the 4 sc of First Half; turn – 8 sc. Row 12: Ch 1, sc to end. Row 13: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 5 sc, skip next sc, sc in last sc; turn – 6 sc. Row 14: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 3 sc, skip next sc, sc in last sc – 4 sc. Fasten off. Rep Rows 1-14 on the opposite side of head band. ANTENNA RINGS (Make 2): With CA, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a sl st in first sc. Fasten off. Sew antenna rings to the top of the head band. Weave folded chenille stems in each of the antenna rings, twist the chenille stems together and curl the tips. HEAD BAND TIE (Make 2): With CA and CB held together as one, ch 12. Fasten off. Sew to the end of each ear flap.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 312 Black A, 319 Cherry Red D and 316 Soft White C.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5.5mm [US I-9], 6.5mm [US K-10½] and 4mm [G-6].
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hat circumference: 24” [61 cm]. One Sash and Eye Patch size fits most men.
gauge: Gauge: Hat: 11 sc = 4” [10 cm]; Rounds 1-5 = 3½” [9 cm] across with medium hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge. Gauge not critical for eye patch and sash/belt.

Halloween Pirate
Release his inner swashbuckler with these accessories for the pirate in your life! Cap, belt and eye patch are all very easy to crochet for Halloween fun. ARGGGHHH!
loops only of each sc across; turn—106 sc.
Row 26: Ch 41, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, sc in each sc across; turn—146 sc.
Rows 27-31: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Fasten off at end of Row 31.
Cross Bones (Make 2)
With smallest hook and C, ch 2; 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook; slip st in first sc of 4-sc group, ch 11, 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in next 9 ch. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.
Skull
Row 1: With smallest hook and C, ch 3; 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in last ch; turn—3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn—5 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] twice; turn—7 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 4 sc, skip 1 sc, sc in last sc; turn—5 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 2 sc, skip 1 sc, sc in last sc; turn—3 sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
With yarn needle and strand of C, place bones in an “X” configuration and sew to hat as shown. Layer skull over cross bones and sew to hat. With yarn needle and A, embroider skull face details as shown. Weave in ends.
BELT/SASH
Row 1: With larger hook and D, ch 186; sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn—185 sc.
Work in back loops throughout.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
One Sash and Eye Patch size fits most men.
Note: The st in which the Cross is started is in color A. Skip the working row and 2 more rows.
HAT
Round 1: With medium hook and A, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join but work in continuous rounds. Place stitch marker in first st of round and move up each round.
Round 2: [Inc] 6 times—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, inc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, inc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, inc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sc, inc] 6 times—36 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next 5 sc, inc] 6 times—42 sc.
Round 8: [Sc in next 6 sc, inc] 6 times—48 sc.
Round 9: [Sc in next 7 sc, inc] 6 times—54 sc.
Round 10: [Sc in next 8 sc, inc] 6 times—60 sc.
Round 11: [Sc in next 9 sc, inc] 6 times—66 sc.
Rounds 12-24: Sc in each sc around, do not fasten off.
Hat Band/Tie
Row 25: With largest hook, ch 41, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, sc in front
Row 4: Repeat Row 2 changing to A in last sc. Fasten off D.
Row 5: Repeat Row 2 changing to D in last sc. Fasten off A.
Row 6: Repeat Row 2.
Row 7: Repeat Row 2 changing to A in last sc. Fasten off D.
Row 8: Ch 1, work 37 Cross across changing to D in last st; turn. Fasten off A.
Rows 9-12: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Fasten off at end of Row 12.
EYE PATCH
Row 1: With medium hook and A, ch 5; sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn—4 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn—6 sc.
Rows 3 and 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, ch 40 for tie. Fasten off. Join A to first sc of Row 5; ch 40. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 (1, 2) Skeins No. 0312 Black CA
1 skein each No. 0254 Pumpkin CB and No. 0672 Spring Green CC
abbreviations: CA, CB, etc = Color A, Color B, etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: To Fit Chest: 18 (23, 28)”, To Fit Neck: 16 (18, 20)”, To Fit Length: 10 (12, 16)”
gauge: 11 sts = 4”; Rows 1-10 = 4” in dc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CAPE-Neckband: With CB, ch 5.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 4 sc.
Rows 2-47 (2-55, 2-61): Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Fasten off.
Collar-Row 1: With right side facing, join CA to work across row ends of Neckband; ch 1, work 47 (55, 61) sc evenly across; turn.
Row 2: Sl st in first 10 (12, 14) sc, ch 2, hdc in next 27 (31, 33) sc; turn leaving remaining sc unworked – 27 (31, 33) hdc.
NOTE: The “ch 2” at the beginning of hdc and dc rows does NOT count as a stitch. Do not work into the “ch 2”.
Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first hdc, sc in each hdc across to last hdc; 2 sc in last hdc; turn – 29 (33, 35) sc.
Row 4: Ch 2, hdc in each sc across; turn.
Rows 5 and 6: Rep Rows 3 and 4 – 31 (35, 37) sts. Fasten off for Small Size.
Medium and Large Only-Row 7: Rep Row 3 changing to CC in last st – (37, 39) sc.
Row 8: With CC, rep Row 4. Fasten off.
Cape-Row 1: With wrong side facing, join CA on opposite side of neckband; ch 1, work 47 (55, 61) sc evenly across; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc to last sc; 2 sc in last sc; turn – 49 (57, 63) sc.
Row 3: Ch 2, hdc in first 3 (0, 0) sc, [hdc in next 4 sc, 2 hdc in next sc] 8 (11, 12) times, hdc in last 6 (2, 3) sc – 57 (68, 75) hdc.
Row 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first hdc, sc in each hdc across to last hdc; 2 sc in last hdc; turn – 59 (70, 77) sc.
Row 5: Ch 2, hdc in first 0 (3, 0) sc, [hdc in next 4 (3, 4) sc, 2 hdc in next sc] 11 (15, 15) times, hdc in last 4 (7, 2) sc changing to CC in last hdc – 70 (85, 92) hdc.
Row 6: With CC, ch 1, sc in each hdc across inc 0 (1, 0) st at center and changing to CA in last st; turn – 70 (86, 92) sc.
Row 7: With CA, ch 2, dc in first st, * skip next st, 2 dc in next st; rep from * to last st; dc in last st changing to CB; turn.
Row 8: With CB, rep Row 7. Fasten off.
TIE: With CA, make a chain the length of the neckband PLUS 12”. Fasten off. Weave the chain through the center of the band.
CIRCULAR STARS-Make 6 (7, 8): With CC, ch 6; join with a sl st to form a ring.
Rnd 1: Ch 3; [yo and draw up a lp, yo and draw through 2 lps] twice all in ring, yo and draw through 3 lps on hook – 2 dc cl made; * ch 3; [yo and draw up a lp, yo and draw through 2 lps] 3 times all in ring, yo and draw through 4 lps on hook – 3 dc cl made; rep from * 3 more times; join with a sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.
Sew 5 (6, 7) circular stars evenly around the outside of the cape as pictured.
BODY (Start at Neck): With CA, ch 34 (36, 40).
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across; turn – 33 (35, 39) sc.
Row 2: Ch 2, dc in each sc across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each dc across; turn.
Rows 4-15 (4-19, 4-23): Rep Rows 2 and 3.
Row 16 (20, 24): Rep Row 2 changing to CC.
Row 17 (21, 25): With CC, ch 1, sc in each dc across changing to CA; turn.
Row 18 (22, 26): With CA, ch 2, dc in first sc, * skip next sc, 2 dc in next sc; rep from * across; turn.
Row 19 (23, 27): Ch 1, sc in each dc across changing to CB.
Row 20 (24, 28): With CB, rep Row 18 (22, 26) changing to CA.
Row 21 (25, 29): With CA, rep Row 3 changing to CB.
Row 22 (26, 30): With CB, rep Row 18 (22, 26). Fasten off.
CHEST PANEL: With CA, ch 16 (20, 24).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each ch across; turn – 15 (19, 23) sc.
Row 2: Ch 2, dc in each sc across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each dc across; turn.
Rows 4-15 (4-17, 4-21): Rep Rows 2 and 3. Fasten off.
Sew to the sides of the body 1½” below the neck.
HAT: With CA, ch 4; join with a sl st to form a ring. Mark the beg of each row.
Rnd 1: 6 Sc in ring; do not join but work in continuous rnds. Mark the beg of rnd with stitch marker.
Rnds 2 and 3: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 4: Sc in first sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] twice, 2 sc in last sc – 9 sc.
Rnd 5: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 6: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times – 12 sc.
Rnd 7: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 8: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times – 15 sc.
Rnd 9: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 10: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times – 20 sc.
Rnd 11: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 12: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times, sc in next 2 sc – 26 sc.
Rnd 13: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 14: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times, sc in next 2 sc – 34 sc.
Rnd 15: Sc in each sc around changing to CB in last sc.
Rnd 16: With CB, sc in each sc around.
Rnd 17: Sc in each sc around changing to CA.
Rnd 18: With CA, sc in each sc around.
Rnd 19: Sc in each sc around; TURN.
Brim-Rnd 20: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with a sl st in first sc.
Rnd 21: Ch 2, [dc in next 3 sc, 2 dc in next sc] 8 times, dc in next 2 sc; join – 42 sts.
Rnd 22: Ch 1, [sc in next dc, 2 sc in next dc] 21 times; join – 63 sc. Fasten off. Sew star on the brim of the hat.
